Kids love the style, parents love the safety!UPDATE: New Program for Kids with AutismNow you can donate a band to a kid with Autism through the Autism Society-the Heartland. See program details below.

The Bandkidsport GPS not only looks cool, but there's a ton of technology wrapped up inside this hip little sports band. And that's the "secret sauce"...no wearable product has so much packed into so little space. PRE-ORDER HERE >>>>>>>kidsport GPS Features


Comfort: The band is made of soft and comfortable silicone, much like the feel of bands the kids are used to wearing. And don't worry, they are latex-free.


Three sizes: Little Kid (110 mm-133 mm), Big Kid (134 mm-150 mm) and Biggest Kid (151 mm-170 mm)


Waterproof: Go ahead! Jump in the pool or ocean and have fun! 


Durable: Let the kids have a blast and don't worry about them beating on the band...we got it!



Cool Safety Features

Alert Button: If your kid needs you, they simply press an Alert Button on the band to send you an immediate text.


Secure Latch: Taking the band off is easy for parents; it's NOT easy for somebody who shouldn't be removing the band.


Removal Alert: When the band is taken off, you'll receive an alert letting you know.

The Technology

Wireless Module: World's smallest cell phone module with extremely low power consumption. 


GPS Module: Ability to track location as accurately as 3 meters.


Custom Antennas: Highly sensitive cell and GPS antennas, custom designed for maximum performance. 


Rechargeable Battery: High-powered Lithium polymer battery insures long life throughout an active day of fun!


USB Charger: Just plug it to a wall or computer USB slot, just like your phone.

The technology in the band is much like a cell phone and sends location data in two ways: on on a set time schedule (for example, every 10 minutes) and ON-DEMAND. When you hit the location refresh button on the app, it sends a signal through the cell chip in the band. The band then sends the location through the cell chip back to the app. A lot gets done in a very short period of time. The AppsOur web, iPhone and Android apps are awesome!Mobile App
Step 1: Create your family account online and load up kid's names.


Step 2: Download the iPhone or Android App. 


Step 3: Upload your most fun kid picture and let the fun begin.

Web App3D imagery and even street-view will allow you to zoom right down to your kid's location from you laptop or iPad. And HEY, welcome to our kidsport GPS office below! It's good to have you!
Amazingly Cool Stress-Reducing App Features


Works on iPhone, Android, Computer or iPad.


Upload your most FUN kid picture to the app...or take a new one.


See the exact date, time and address of your kid's location.


Alert by text when kids goes outside the SAFE GEO-FENCE you set for them.


Alert by text when kid enters the GEO-FENCE you set.


Alert by text when your kid holds down his/her alert button.


Alert by text when band is taken off. 

HELPING KIDS WITH AUTISM Similar to wandering behaviors in seniors with dementia or Alzheimer's, children with Autism are prone to wandering away from a safe environment. Unfortunately, many cases end in tragedy.* 
In coordination with the Autism Society of the Heartland, you can donate kidsport GPS bands to kids with Autism. You buy the band; we donate it to the Autism Society-the Heartland. You will get a thank you letter and a picture of
the kid that received your band. If you want it to go to a kid you know, we will make sure that kid gets one. If you want it go to a kid in your area, our local chapter will work with
your chapter to get the band to a kid in your area. Just pick one the Autism Society Perks to the right for $129, $500, or $1,000. There are corporate options available as well. And, it's all tax
deductible. 

*Source: Autism Wandering Awareness Alerts Response and Education (AWAARE) CollaborationThe TeamThe kidsport GPS team includes the Sullivan, Hicks and Long families, plus a bunch of amazing technology partners who helped us make our product dreams come true! We have partnered with the global leaders in cell and location module technology and our team is not only handsome...but crazy smart too! Our company is based on one word...FUN. Our goal is to create a resume of amazing memories and hope to help other families do the same.Why Indiegogo?We may have a cool product, but we aren't made of money! In fact, we have gone ALL IN. But now we need your help. We spent the last two years developing the technology and design of kidsport GPS, and now we are ready for production. But we need more funds to produce the band at a price all families can afford. By pre-ordering your kidsport GPS today at a reduced price, you can help us create stress-free fun for you and your family. And help our dream of creating stress-free fun become a reality.FAQ

Are there monthly charges for band? Yes, the fee is $10 a month.  Of course there's some taxes and fees on top of that, but we don't anticipate that being more than a couple bucks. And you can turn your service off at any time. No contracts to worry about!


How long will the battery last? It will last between 24-48 hours based on usage. It's much like a cell phone.


Are there different sizes? Three sizes: Little Kid (110 mm-133 mm), Big Kid (134 mm-150 mm) and Biggest Kid (151 mm-170 mm)

How do I charge kidsport GPS? Simply plug the USB connector into any USB port, which means your wall charger or laptop work great.

Does kidsport GPS work internationally? Yes, our location chip uses GPS, GLONASS and SBAS satellite signals, and will work in over 115 countries worldwide.


How do alerts appear on my device? When your kid holds down the alert button for three seconds, you will immediately receive a text alert. Also, if your kid goes outside the geo-fence that you created online or on your app, you will receive a text letting you know. You will also receive a text once they enter a geo-fence area...so you know they got back to where they are supposed to be.

Is my kidsport GPS waterproof? Yes...because it's designed to be worn in FUN places...like the beach or pool.
Media

story:
We want to encourage people to put aside all the rules and constraints. But only enjoy free movement. This radiation free 3D pedometer hides lots of exciting features. It uses high-quality 3D sensors and precision micro-processing chips for extremely accurate results.

 

Just place the pedometer over the surface of the designated area. The data will seamlessly transfer to the reader

There is no need of any mobile app, internet or Bluetooth connection to be able to view your exercise data. It’s a technology that simplifies the data transmission technology.

 

This 3D pedometer uses a low-power chip and button battery that can be used for 12 to 18 months, no need to charge it. The battery is very easy to buy and easy to replace.           

    

                               Bring Flash Pedometer, go everywhere you want! 

It is extremely simple, it counts your steps. It will help you put aside any interference for you to enjoy wholeheartedly your daily exercise. The Flash 3D Pedometer is like an invisible sport partner, you almost can’t feel it’s there, and it’s suitable for any outdoor sports, including running, walking or even hiking

                                                        

                                                        Shoes buckle is  very tight！

               

                     Multi-function Alarm Clock Feature

 

                    New Combination : 3D Pedometer Different from other Fitness Tracker            

  • Alarm with snooze function
  • Alarm clock and Calendar
  • Set daily steps target with progress bar indicator
  • Stores up to 30 days of pedometer memory
  • The Pedometer data is saved into the clock memoru, no data loss when the clock is out of battery 

                        Very clear, comprehensive and easy-to-read transparent LCD Display 

                                   Flash is different from other fitness tracker.

The LCD display has some additional features. It can be placed on your nightstand as a decoration, alarm clock and calendar.

You can also express your affection for your loved ones by giving this product as a gift, showing that you care for their health and shape.

If you get this product, you will get a pedometer and alarm clock. You will surely find it worth

it.

Simply because we focused ourselves on improving the main features and design of the product.

We have not wasted a penny on developing complicated and superfluous features, we want to keep developing our pedometer as a professional tool, valuable for sport and fitness enthusiasts’ daily activities. Therefore, we combined a pedometer and an alarm clock into one design multi-function product with interesting features such as step counting, exercise data management and alarm clock.

                             Colors Available 

                     

                                     Q&A

Q: what is the warranty policy ?

A:  We warrants to the original purchaser that the Product shall be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use for a period of one (1) year from the date of purchase.

 

Q: Are there plans for more color to be offered?

A: At initial launch, only 4 colors will be available; Green, black, White and Pink.  We will consider other colors at a later time.

     

Q:what’s the IP rating of the 3D pedometer?

A: Our pedometer is splashproof.  Therefore it is equivalent to IPX4 rating.

 

Q: Will it have a gift package

A: Yes ! Buy it with Gift Price Perk.

 

Q: How many days data can the pedometer store?

A: The pedometer has 7 days memory.  It will automatically reset itself at midnight to collect pedometer for the new day.

 

Q: How often do you need replace the battery ?

A : Approx. 8 months for the pedometer.

 

Q: What is the ‘10 Steps Error Correction’ ?

A: This is a special algorithm built into the pedometer software to avoid counting sudden movement as steps.  It will make the pedometer step counting more accurate. 

Q: What is the key function of this Pedometer?
A: Step counter,Step Tracker,Pedometer Watch,Pedometer For Walking,Clock Alarm

story:
EVEN THOUGH THIS CAMPAIGN IS CLOSED
if you want to help me still, donate directly to my paypal.
the username is jch2905@rit.edu 

 

My Story.

Hi, I'm Liam. I am transgender FTM. That means I was assigned female at birth, but I identify as male. I went through female puberty and that resulted in breasts that I have always hated. I feel very detached from my own body. My video above is one I made for a class I was taking. It describes the dysphoria i feel with my own body when i'm constantly trying to get rid of my chest. I bind my chest down daily, but this often results in a lot of back and chest pain. I am looking forward to being able to have top surgery to permanently fix this problem and make me feel comfortable in my own skin. I have applied to every job opening in my area but because I go to school full-time, it has been hard to find a job that hires employees that can only work weekends. This makes it very hard to save money, since I have no income. I have about $3000 right now dedicated towards my top surgery, but this gets me a little less than halfway there. 

 

How You Can Help!

The total cost of my surgery is $6780 plus travel costs. This is where you come in. You can help me by donating five dollars, two dollars, or even fifty cents. Any little bit will help me get to my surgery. Plus there are some awesome perks for donating!

 

When It Will Happen.

I've got my surgery scheduled for June 27th. I will be going to Dr. McLean in Mississauga, Ontario, Canada. This is only about three hours from where I live, so I will be able to spend my week recovering at home, saving money on hotels and the costs of being away for a week. I can't express how exciting it is to finally have this scheduled. If I can't generate enough money for surgery by this time, I will be borrowing from my school funds that I need to pay for college. This could eventually lead to me having to take time off from school to regenerate that money.

 

Share my story!

If you can't donate yourself, send this on to anyone you think would be willing to help. Word of mouth is a powerful tool!

story:
Cancer counts, everywhere

Early and accurate breast cancer screening for women in Afghanistan.

We're launching a non-profit initiative - Cancer Counts - because we believe access to healthcare should be determined by need, not location. We want to provide screening mammograms to at-risk women, who would otherwise not be able to afford them, and build awareness on the importance of preventative screening. We need your help to provide 200 at-risk women in Kabul with 200 mammograms.


Cancer counts won't stop there

This initiative will kick-start awareness raising and give women access to the medical care they need.  

We’re doing our part to raise cancer awareness in Afghanistan, working with hospitals, doctors and non-profits to provide women with information to make decisions about their health. Furthermore, pending the results of the scans, we have partnerships with non-profit organisations that will help find treatment for women affected by cancer. 


This is an amazing opportunity to cost-effectively raise the quality of care available to women in Afghanistan and give them healthcare they need.


How it works

The best part about our programme is that all the pieces are already in place, it’s all set up and ready to go. This is how we work:

We have the mammography machines at our partner facilities, hundreds of women’s health doctors using our services, and a doctor network throughout the world numbering nearly 1,000 ready to read the images.

We've developed innovative technology, the AlemBox, to link doctors in Afghanistan to experts in the USA, UK and India.  Check out Nvidia's article on us. 


Every dollar you provide goes directly to cover the costs of the mammograms for at-risk women. No overheads like Landcruisers and six-figure salaries, no setup costs and logistics. No wastage, no leakage, just pure impact.

The Impact


The incidence of cancer is increasing worldwide, and nowhere more so than in low-and middle-income countries. More than 80% of cancers now occur outside of the EU and USA, putting a massive strain on the individuals that can afford it least. 

AlemHealth is on a mission to provide world-class diagnoses to hard to reach communities. We link doctors in local hospitals to international experts, giving patients access to early and accurate diagnosis.

Since we opened our Kabul office, the majority of patients we have seen are women and many of them have symptoms of breast cancer. Over 30% of the mammograms our experts read present advanced cancers, which indicates that this disease may be much more prevalent than anyone realised.

We want to act now to stop breast cancer by providing at risk-women with the screenings and information they need. 


Why now, why here?

Preventative healthcare isn’t commonplace in Afghanistan; people go to the doctor once they’re very sick and nearly every cancer case doctors in our network see is late stage, limiting the treatment options available to patients. We want to change that, and help patients get the preventative screening that can change their lives through early diagnosis.

Being a start-up, we don’t have the funds to give out free scans, and nor would we want to – we are about creating a sustainable enterprise in frontier markets – however we do want to see people in need get treatment in a timely manner.The Cancer Counts initiative is our way of making this possible.


Let's make this happen


We are doing this for breast cancer awareness. We are doing it for women in Afghanistan. And we are doing this with your help.

Tell your friends, family and anyone who will listen that cancer counts everywhere, and together we can make a difference. 

The reward will be amazing and the impact you’ll make is potentially life saving. 

Don’t forget to use #CancerCounts to spread the word.


In the press

Nvidia: http://blogs.nvidia.com/blog/2015/10/02/alemhealth/
Vision: http://vision.ae/focus/healing_touchscreens 
Venture Beat: http://venturebeat.com/2015/02/03/digital-health-accelerator-startup-health-adds-six-new-companies-to-its-portfolio/ 
Arabian Business: http://www.arabianbusiness.com/emerging-stars-seedstars-world-comes-dubai-607522.html 
Startup Health: http://www.startuphealth.com/c/26268/AlemHealth 
Wamda: http://www.wamda.com/memakersge/2015/09/telemedicine-middle-east-time-is-now
Yahoo: https://smallbusiness.yahoo.com/advisor/post/111489455307


More questions? Get in contact with us on info@alemhealth.com and we'll get back to you.

story:
**We hit $1000!!!  But the work doesn't stop here - our costs are actually much, much higher (we purposely set it low) so pass, share, send along - let's raise awareness for HCM!!! **

Thanks for taking the time to stop in!

 
In 2008, Elyjah Zakai M. (nickname is Zak) was a normal four year old boy who enjoyed swimming, running and playing with his brothers.  He would become winded and tired - not to mention the one occasion where his extremities turned a light blue from poor circulation.  Not knowing what was the cause, we took Zak and his brothers to a pediatric cardiologist after a murmur was detected.  What we were told changed our lives forever.
 
"Don't blame yourself when he dies."  "You couldn't have done anything to prevent this."  "I have never seen a heart this thick." 
 
Zak was diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.  His heart walls were three sizes too thick and the pumping ability was severely restricted.  The disease was handed down by his father, who had already lost two sisters and a mother to the same disease (though, at the time, was referred to by a different name: IHSS).  He himself had been diagnosed as well, but was told "the girls have it worse" so it was ignored.  Zak was no longer able to run.  He was told never to participate in any sporting activities for fear of cardiac arrest.  We moved to Houston, TX (from El Paso, TX) to be seen by the worlds best pediatric cardiologist and were told the same thing - his heart was ridiculously thick and it looked like Zak would probably progress past the "norm" and fall into the 5% who wound up in endstage (heart failure). 
 
Today, Zak is eight years old.  His heart is getting thicker and he is now experiencing heart failure symptoms.  He is unable to walk without becoming winded.  He cannot play like he used to.  Stairs are no longer an option.  He needs additional medication, but cannot receive any until he gets an ICD implanted.  His father is also very ill, and Zak is having to travel between the ICU and home while keeping a positive attitude at what very well may be his own future.

This is what we need to do:

  • We need to get Zak an ICD.  To do this, we need a $250 deductible, plus 10% of the surgery costs ($5000)
  • We will need gas and food to travel, and stay, at Texas Children's Hospital.  We live 45 minutes away. ($200)
  • We will need the doctor copay before and after surgery for pre and post implant. ($200)
  • We will need a trip to Ohio to see the experts in HCM care should Zak need more invasive procedures (such as a myectomy or a heart transplant).

 

This is why:

Zak has lost a grandmother, two aunts and nearly his father to this awful disease.  We need to get him an ICD to help manage these problems before his heart becomes worse.  There is no cure for HCM, but our hope is to allow Zak to be as healthy as possible for as long as possible... I want to give Zak the opportunity his other family members didn't have.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are rough and money is tight.. trust us.  So if you can't help, please consider passing along our information... Just getting the word out will help us out tremendously!

 

*** Just an FYI - the $25 perk is only the perk - donations can be made in any amount ($1 - $1000000) so don't worry... doesn't have to be $25.. and trust me when I say every bit counts, so THANK YOU for even considering helping!!

Thanks for taking the time to stop in!
 
In 2008, Elyjah Zakai M. (nickname is Zak) was a normal four year old boy who enjoyed swimming, running and playing with his brothers.  He would become winded and tired - not to mention the one occasion where his extremities turned a light blue from poor circulation.  Not knowing what was the cause, we took Zak and his brothers to a pediatric cardiologist after a murmur was detected.  What we were told changed our lives forever.
 
"Don't blame yourself when he dies."  "You couldn't have done anything to prevent this."  "I have never seen a heart this thick." 
 
Zak was diagnosed with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy.  His heart walls were three sizes too thick and the pumping ability was severely restricted.  The disease was handed down by his father, who had already lost two sisters and a mother to the same disease (though, at the time, was referred to by a different name: IHSS).  He himself had been diagnosed as well, but was told "the girls have it worse" so it was ignored.  Zak was no longer able to run.  He was told never to participate in any sporting activities for fear of cardiac arrest.  We moved to Houston, TX (from El Paso, TX) to be seen by the worlds best pediatric cardiologist and were told the same thing - his heart was ridiculously thick and it looked like Zak would probably progress past the "norm" and fall into the 5% who wound up in endstage (heart failure). 
 
Today, Zak is eight years old.  His heart is getting thicker and he is now experiencing heart failure symptoms.  He is unable to walk without becoming winded.  He cannot play like he used to.  Stairs are no longer an option.  He needs additional medication, but cannot receive any until he gets an ICD implanted.  His father is also very ill, and Zak is having to travel between the ICU and home while keeping a positive attitude at what very well may be his own future.
This is what we need to do:

We need to get Zak an ICD.  To do this, we need a $250 deductible, plus 10% of the surgery costs ($5000)
We will need gas and food to travel, and stay, at Texas Children's Hospital.  We live 45 minutes away. ($200)
We will need the doctor copay before and after surgery for pre and post implant. ($200)
We will need a trip to Ohio to see the experts in HCM care should Zak need more invasive procedures (such as a myectomy or a heart transplant).
 
This is why:

Zak has lost a grandmother, two aunts and nearly his father to this awful disease.  We need to get him an ICD to help manage these problems before his heart becomes worse.  There is no cure for HCM, but our hope is to allow Zak to be as healthy as possible for as long as possible... I want to give Zak the opportunity his other family members didn't have.


Other Ways You Can Help
We know times are rough and money is tight.. trust us.  So if you can't help, please consider passing along our information... Just getting the word out will help us out tremendously!
 
*** Just an FYI - the $25 perk is only the perk - donations can be made in any amount ($1 - $1000000) so don't worry... doesn't have to be $25.. and trust me when I say every bit counts, so THANK YOU for even considering helping!!

story:
I am a pediatric emergency doctor, and invented a device that decreases needle pain by 80%.  For my 4 year old’s vaccinations, I had prepared him with numbing creams and distraction. The nurse said “That stuff doesn’t work.  You better hold still, or this is really going to hurt.”  It did; thereafter he would vomit before any doctor visit.  If  inside the system I couldn’t protect my child, who could?  I invented Buzzy as a fast, effective solution to the prevalent problem of needle pain.  49% of our pre-teens now fear needles; it’s not just socially embarrassing, it’s a major public health epidemic that we can do something about.

 

We started with pediatric Buzzy®, a palm-sized device combining vibration and cold to relieve sharp pain on contact in seconds.  Frozen ice wings are attached to Buzzy®, which is then attached with a tourniquet “between the brain and the pain”.  Just like putting a burn under cold water blocks pain, sensations of burning, sticking, or itching are relieved on contact by Buzzy’s physiologic nerve blockade.  Like a dentist jiggling a jaw, Buzzy® interrupts pain from needles, IV attempts, burning medications, or stings.

 

We’ve been making Buzzy in China and have been adopted by over 400 hospitals and 1000 clinics.  The problems are that healthcare providers don’t always care about pain – Buzzy needs to be available to anyone to take with them anytime.  The physiology of Buzzy works for adults, too, but people have been confused by the kid-friendly bee design.  We’d like to make a more discreet one for adults and kids that doesn’t need a tourniquet, fits better into the hand, is stronger, and is MADE IN AMERICA!

 

To make a new Buzzy in the US, we will need about $72,000 for new steel tools for manufacturing, and about $110,000 to purchase the minimum order to get a company interested.  We’ve gotten loans and used our home equity loan, and got a small grant from the Pediatric Device initiatives, but are short $60,000 towards the tooling.  Any amount will be put to the tooling goal to speed things up: otherwise, we have to wait until we bootstrap more through sales.  We WILL make a new Buzzy, it’s just frustratingly slow.  The retail price of the Buzzy used in hospitals is $40; for anyone who contributes a minimum of $30, we’ll send you one of the new Buzzies to help you or anyone you know who hates shots or the burning, stinging sensation of injected medicines for arthritis, fertility treatments, multiple sclerosis, Crohn’s disease, psoriasis… the list goes on and on!  Donate $20 and we'll send you a set of 6 of our Bravery Badges stickers, and donate $100 and we'll send you a Deluxe kit with our current tourniquet Buzzy!

 

It’s important to me that this not be disposable: people need to be able to count on Buzzy being there for them for any painful procedure and not have to buy something over and over.   We’ve got enough medical cost and waste in our country.  Given our mission of reusable, inexpensive products for personal pain control, we avoided VC investment insisting on disposable and higher-end hospital products. Instead, we have bootstrapped development.  In the three years since we launched our striped bee-shaped Buzzy® we have established scientific credibility through publications and winning the Medical Design Excellence Award in 2011, but it’s tough to grow as fast as we need to help everyone we can given my desire to bring jobs to the US.

 

Our biggest successes have been personal: a grandfather decided not to quit dialysis because of Buzzy; a woman terrified of conception because of needlephobia uses Buzzy and now is pregnant; a family was torn apart by three-hour arthritis injection dramas that Buzzy made a 5-minute non-issue.   We have testimonials for everything from arthritis shots to eczema itching to splinter removal pain.  No one likes pain; why not make healthcare and first aid more comfortable? Oh, yes, and my children -- they no longer ask “am I getting a shot?”  when we go to the doctors. They ask, “Did you bring Buzzy?”

 

For anyone who really doesn’t care for needles, at buzzy4shots.com we have lots of tips and proven simple steps to advocate at the doctors, and help even without Buzzy.  Thanks for supporting the goal of no unnecessary pain – shots shouldn’t have to hurt.

story:
Introducing Blossum Mask Bag

Clean and Reuse your masks - Simply

Blossum Mask Bag is a textile heating bag, the size of a purse. When connected to a power source, the heat enables to clean the masks that have been worn. Blossum Mask Bag can be used with both disposable and fabric masks. 

 

 

How It Works 

Simple, Quick & Effective

 

 

 

 

 

Benefits 

 

 

Anyone, Anywhere, Anytime can clean the masks they've been wearing. The Blossum Mask Bag can be taken anywhere, plugged into a powerbank, a cigarette lighter, a computer or a power socket.  

 

 

Using heat, at 70°C-158°F for 60 minutes, the Blossum Mask Bag cleans the masks from elements which do not survive at high temperatures. 

 

 

Disposable masks, which are widely used, are composed of more than 90% plastic and take up to 500 years to decompose. Reducing their consumption is becoming a challenge for waste management on our planet. Cleaning masks with heat also reduces the number of wash cycles for fabric masks.   

 

 

All masks can be used in the Blossum Mask Bag including disposable masks. After heating cycle, you will be able to reuse your mask. With the Blossum Mask Bag, save money by reducing your mask budget.

 

Technical Product Focus

 

 

A 3 Step Operating Process

What's Inside ?

  • Uses microcontroller technology to manage the right cycle : reaching the desired temperature 70°C-158°F, heating cycle duration & temperature cooling.
  • Temperature sensor to guarantee inside temperature
  • Flexible NTC Thermistor IPX3 and Japanese aluminum foil with high temperature resistant silicone => allowing a flexible and long-lasting device

 

 

Which  power sources ?

 The Blossum Mask Bag  is equipped with a USB plug that connects to any DC 5V-9.5W 2A minimum power source :

  • Portable charger or powerbank
  • USB power outlet
  • Car lighter
  • Computer USB port

 

 

For which type of masks ?

The Blossum Mask Bag  is designed for all types of washable fabric masks and disposable masks such as 3-ply surgical masks, FFP2. (4 cycles recommended as the maximum for disposable masks - without overriding manufacturers's recommendations of use).

 

 

Is the Blossum Mask Bag Labelled ? 

All requested validation have been carried out. The Blossum Mask Bag is compliant with the following norms & marks : FCC, CE, RoHS, REACH

 

 

We Ran Tests

The effectiveness of the Blossum Mask Bag has been tested by independent laboratories.

 

Here are what the beta users think about their experience :

 

I must say thank you to Blossum Mask for their new invention. It just means I can give my lecture with my homemade mask on in the safe knowledge that I can talk to my students. I have another one in here already prepared for my next course so it means I don’t have to be walking around with my bag full of masks or throw any away. So thank you very much Blossum Mask. Sam - English University Lecturer

Just a quick message about Blossum Mask Bag. This little pouch changed my life. Instead of taking a full box of disposable masks when I travel to Paris for business every week,  I just need to take 2 and this Blossum Mask Bag. Then I can respect the rules. That’s it ! Easy, compact, I highly recommend it. Pierre-Yves - French Business traveller 

I’ve been using the Blossum Mask Bag for more than 7 days now and I am very satisfied with it. I use it when I need to clean my mask after wearing it for a while. Very good product. I recommend it to everyone. Arnaud - French Real estate agent

When you also travel as much as we do, there is one thing you must have in your backpack - the Blossum Mask Bag. It doesn’t just save you money, you also do something good for the environment. So what are you waiting for ? Flynn - German Backpacker

I am currently working in Taipei and take the metro everyday. I have tested Blossum Mask Bag, it helps me to save my mask in a clean and safe place. I feel it is a great product. Julie - Taiwanese metro user

Hi, I am Pablo, bar owner. We have been using lots of masks. But we have been trying the Blossum Mask Bag for a week, it truly is a money saver and it is also better for the planet. Pablo - Chilean bar owner

 

Blossum & Totem tech Story

Use technology to support well-being and health - each and every day

The Blossum Mask Bag is the result of a Franco-Taiwanese collaboration.

We constantly think about what society and people need using the skills and experience available within our team. In late March 2020, the situation was getting very serious, masks and other PPE were in big shortage. As we had experience making heating products before (Totem Tech) & anti-pollution masks (Blossum), we came up with this idea of using heat to clean masks. 

The original idea was to extend the use time of each mask & to store it in a safe place between use.

 

The Team

An international team with their own specific competencies

 

Rewards

 

IMPORTANT : Our products are set to go through certification for commercial release in the US, Canada and European countries requiring FCC or CE certification at this stage. Therefore, we can only ship to these locations. We sincerely apologize if your country is not listed yet, but ultimately we will open to more countries. To the rest of the world, we are coming soon.

 

Next Steps 

Why Indiegogo and What if we raise more than the initial goal ?

This Indiegogo pre-sales campaign will allow us to start mass production.

At this stage we have invested in R&D, patent, certification & effectiveness testings. Our products are set to go through certification for commercial release in the US, Canada and European countries requiring FCC or CE certification.

Therefore, if we raise more than the initial goal, we will start asap additional certifications to be compliant with Asian norms and in a second step develop a colour collection of Blossum Mask Bags.

 

Risks & Challenges

Parts and suppliers are already in place and a trial manufacture has been conducted. Once the mass production begins right after the campaign is over, we will work closely with the factory to ensure that production is at capacity to minimize any possible risk of delay. 
However, it is important to understand that unexpected things may happen along the way, which are very hard to predict now. For example, delays in shipping can occur due to external factors  such as travel restrictions.
So we feel that the risks of us not delivering a great working product as shown above, are close to zero. We are extremely confident and dedicated in delivering our products to everyone who needs one.
If any delays were to occur due to such circumstances, we will definitely consistently update all our backers with full transparency and of course, aid you with any of the doubts you have along the way.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Make noise about this campaign.
  • Feel free to share it on your social accounts!

Thank you so much for your great support!

story:
EMERGENCY FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE

Greetings to you in the name of Jesus Christ.Thank you for all you do for the nations of the world. 

Am John Bailey McBride  writing to you in regard to the above subject matter.

Defender Africa Foundation based in Uganda is a registered  community based organization that was established by Kisakye Justine in conjunction with the church leaders from Waskiso District of Uganda.

The major Purpose was to promote community development programmes especially those that favor the poor,needy children,widows and single mothers from our district.This is helping in the improvement of lives for these children and communities with our district.

Right now our country like other Nations of the world is experiencing Covid -19 pandemic.This is creating a lot of fear among the people in our community.This is because the virus has claimed  of lives in various countries in the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Our Organization has taken the initiative of sensitizing the children,widows,and single mothers in our communities.

The parenting measures of the Covid-19 is through educating them and even providing them with items needed as preventive measures.

These items include:- Soap,detergents,sanitizers,masks and gloves.

In addition to provision of the above items,Our organization also gives these children and single mothers food stuffs. The Country is also under lock down and these children and single mothers are being supported by our organization especially with emergency relief food and essential items.

All these require us to have funds for procurement,Unfortunately our organization is running out of enough funds being in the lock down for the past one and half months and another two weeks have been extended.

There are also possibilities of further  extension of the lock down. This has necessitate us to have enough funds for procurement of food stuffs and items for prevention of the spread or contraction of the Covid-19. It is because of this that we decided to seek for your support.

The break down of the items that are required to be purchased is here below

THE BUDGET OF FOOD STUFFS AND ITEMS FOR  THE PRVENTION OF THE SPREAD/CONTRACTION OF COVIS-19.

                ITEM      QUANTITY          UNIT COST ($)   AMOUNT ($)

1.POSHO             5 BAGS                 80                           400

2.RICE                   5 BAGS                 100                         500

3.BEANS               10 BAGS               140                         1400

4.BAR SOAP        16 CARTONS       25                           400

5.DETERGENTS  10 CARTONS       30                           300

6.SANITIZERS     10 CARTONS       100                         1000

7.MASKS              10 CARTONS       50                           500

8.GLOVES            10 CARTONS       50                           500

TOTAL   AMOUNT:                                                           5000

 

The Impact

We are therefore kindly requesting you for financial assistance of 5000 USD to enable us acquire food stuffs and items for distribution to the poor,needy children,widows and single mothers whom we support.

Your Co-operation in this matter shall highly be appreciated. We will remain patiently awaiting for your kind consideration and response.

Risks & Challenges

The challenge we are facing in this subject is the fact that Covid 19 has affected many individuals and Organizations financially that could have come to support our cause easily without great pain.

But we pray that God will touch a few and we promise adhere to our profound promise to ease the lives of those we seek to support.

Other Ways You Can Help

Also I  request friends who can not contribute at this time to unavoidable circumstances,  by taking a christian step of  sharing  our Link as well as promoting it.

This will help in the struggle to help raise the needed support for the vulnerable children and single mothers as well affected due to COVID 19.

Your Co-operation in this matter shall highly be appreciated. We will remain patiently awaiting for your kind consideration and response.

May God Bless You

Your Faithfully

Kisakye Justine

Director

Your Co-operation in this matter shall highly be appreciated. We will remain patiently awaiting for your kind consideration and response.May God Bless YouYour FaithfullyKisakye JustineDirector

story:
Who are we:

Our Story: From Trauma to Trailblazing

While in the midst of transitioning from relaxed to natural hair our founder, Mayowa Osinowo, found herself stranded in the middle of an information desert when it came to the world of natural hair care. Nowhere to be found was the info she needed to confidently care for her kinks and curls or show them the love they deserved. Countless hours and hundreds of dollars later she found herself in nearly the same place she was when she started her natural hair journey- frustrated with no guarantee that she was really choosing the best products and services for her. It was then that she came face-to-face with the disturbing truth: She was not alone. The vast majority of curly-haired people spend over $100 a month on hair-care products. And what do they get in return for their investment? A product success rate of less than 50%.

Shouldn’t it be easy to pick the perfect products on your very first try?

We are Glimmer 411, a company that uses internet-related services and products to address everyday hair care needs, with a personalized, dynamic touch. We centralize hair care information, helping people like you find what they need without trial and error.

Mission

To be the number one hair-tech platform by curating a holistic, personalized hair care experience that empowers our clients to reach their hair goals and heal, all without breaking the bank.

Vision

We strive for true representation in the textured hair community by prioritizing efficient, cutting-edge, and quality solutions from a team that champions integrity and shared success.

 

Our Product

Curl Cupid™

Curl Cupid™ is an all-in-one web platform that includes a diagnostic quiz, personalized reports, a catalog of your favorite products, plus hair routine and technique recommendations! 

We learn what makes your hair unique, help you become your own hair expert, and embark with you on a journey to more confident curls. 

It’s like a cheat sheet for your hair! Why stumble in the dark when we can make the science simple and relevant to you? Like a GPS system, we meet you wherever you are in your hair journey and take you where you want to be. 

Protect your hair investment with our tailor-made tools and resources designed to help you make more informed decisions about product purchases, professional hair care, and more. Reduce trial and error,  save time, save money, and get the results you never thought you could!

Curl Cupid™ Beta Reviews

Imani Parker - “This Glimmer hair/quiz report is dope! Super well thought out and informative”

Frantzia Theodat - “Oh my gosh! I’ve been thinking to myself how many people, particularly POC need hair consultancies to personalize their regime and help them care for their hair. This is an amazing idea.”

Chinasa Onyekpa - “It’s already so helpful for clueless naturals like me. The recommendations were really good. I already use one of the products recommended and I can attest that’s amazing!”

Farah Comis - “OMG this quiz is amazing, I love how it tells me which products to use exactly”
 

About This Campaign

Why our product is important

Our hair is a symbol of both personal expression and a shared culture. But so much of what we know about our own hair is learned through word of mouth or from the grapevine. Without a centralized platform to help simplify and document that information, hair care can seem daunting. 

With a technology-driven approach, we can change how people interact with their hair; simplifying everything from how they search for hair care tips to how they choose and buy products.

What your contributions will achieve

In the hair care industry today, many in our target market find themselves left with lackluster results because their problems aren’t prioritized.  Showing your support to Glimmer 411® is a great opportunity to help us cater to the textured hair community, and apply technology to build solutions that actually give customers the lasting benefits and results they’ve been waiting for. 

We are driven by our belief that hair is much more than hair: it is the cornerstone of our community, rooted in our culture, debated politically, and deeply personal. We’ve been in our customers’ shoes, so we know just how frustrating it can be to feel forgotten, left out of something that should be so simple. And now it is! At Glimmer 411® we focus on ensuring every client has what we didn’t: easy access to the tools and information needed to feel empowered in their hair journey! 

Glimmer 411® is completely self-funded but this campaign will give us, a black-owned and female-led business, independence from other external funding sources that could dilute our company’s foundational and early-stage goals:

  1. Easy access for all
  2. Meaningful representation 
  3. Industry reeducation
  4. Centralization of information

 

Our Journey

 

What We Need & What You Get

How much funding we need

We are looking to raise $15,000 which will help cover some of our first-year costs and allow us to scale our Curl Cupid™ product. 

Where is the money going

The money will be allocated to 3 major areas: Marketing, Administrative Expenses, and Product Development.

 We plan on using your contributions to:

  •  Increase awareness for our first product; Curl Cupid™
  • Form a legal entity and protect our intellectual property
  • Cover research and development costs needed to develop planned features and enhance our products

 

Your Perks

Donation Tiers

Product Kits

Wash Kit: 1 Shampoo + 1 Conditioner

 

Moisture Kit: 1 Deep Conditioner + 1 Leave-In Conditioner

 

Styling Kit: 1 Styling Agent (Gel, Curling Cream or Mousse) + 1 Tool (Pick, Comb or Brush, etc.)

 

Tool Kit: 1 Pair of Tools (Pick, Comb, Brush, Scalp Scrubber, Heating Cap or Spray Bottle, etc.)

 

Sleep Kit: 1 Durag / Bonnet/Silk Scarf + 1 Silk Pillow Case

At this time, we are unable to provide international shipping for our product kits. If you would still like to donate, you can click the "Back It" button and make a contribution of any dollar amount or pick one of our "Donation-ONLY" perks.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Donating financially isn’t the only way to contribute to our vision! A large part of what drives our success is becoming more visible to the people who need our products the most. You can show your support by making noise about our campaign. To help out, you can visit our Instagram or Facebook, follow us, and share our Indiegogo campaign post on your story and timeline. You can even use the Indiegogo share tool below to get the word out! 

Either way, you choose, we sincerely thank you for considering donating to our mission and helping us build a more equitable and inclusive hair industry. Every dollar truly counts and will help maximize our impact and reach. We hope to see you soon on Curl Cupid™ (your curls will definitely thank you!) and as always, we love interacting with our community so our DMs and email are always open.

story:
Bipolar Disorder (manic depression) affects 2% of the population and is the leading cause of suicide. At this point the illness is diagnosed based on psychiatric symptoms and misdiagnosis is common. It is also difficult to find the optimal medication as different medications have different effects on different patients. Currently, no genetic or biochemical diagnostic test exists for Bipolar Disorder. ProMatrix Technologies, LLC is hoping to change that.

The average time from onset of bipolar symptoms to diagnosis is 12 years. This worsens symptoms and increases risk of suicide. Having a means of early diagnosis of Bipolar Disorder could save many lives.

We will be studying differences in the protein expression in the blood between healthy patients and patients with Bipolar Disorder. Using a large sample size and powerful separation and imaging technology we hope to find biomarker proteins which can serve as means of diagnosing the disorder. We hope to also gain more information about the blood protein profile of the different subtypes of the disorder. This could help to facilitate the selection of medications.

ProMatrix Technologies, LLC is seeking funding for equipment to enable these experiments, as well as to cover costs of analysis. We thank you sincerely for your interest and we will be sure to make every contribution go a long way!

story:
Family Is Family!

Remember that most orphans are orphans for life. They have special needs. A family that will always love them and that will be with them for life is one of them. 

"Help SXS Sorority Make Good Magic For Orphans!"

House of XI Maidens! SXS Sisters of XI Sorority Orphans!
http://www.houseofxi.com/hxi/sorority/sorority_orphans.htm

Diamonds In The Rough!

Sisters of XI Sorority Orphan Resource will be seeking out orphan candidates to sponsor through college level studies and career preparation. The areas of SXS Sorority sponsored studies can include endeavors such as Rhythmic Gymnastics, Dance, Tennis, Volley Ball, Graphic Arts, Swimming, Marine Studies, Geological Studies, Agriculture, Archery, Fencing, Cheer Dance. Audio Video Production, and even Fashion Design - We've been an accredited employer at F.I.D.M. Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising for many years. For Example, students enrolled at FIDM can receive school study credits for working on SXS Sisters of XI Sorority "Vie de Elegance! (TM)" Fashion Projects.

Love Is Good, Yet It Is Best When It Is Shared!

For starters we need initial funds to properly setup a lasting trust that will make certain that the resources actually get where they are supposed to go. SXS Sorority has friends and contacts living in regions and cities into which we send assistance, cutting through the red tape of politics and self serving religious organizations, 

The cities which we have chosen to send help to, indefinitely, are Sophia Bulgaria, Belfast Northern Ireland, Dublin Ireland, Prague Czech Republic, and Bucharest Romania. 

SXS Sorority is committed to freeing forgotten and abandoned children from the constrains of poverty and social status, by giving them the education and international association to know, without a doubt, that they do count and that they are able to live the life they had hoped for. They will receive support through college and beyond. 

The Impact - More Means More!

What must be understood is this... It is very difficult for a ten year old student to strive with confidence, when they expect to be expelled and later abandoned to the world, once they've reached a certain age, anyway. 

Support from the SXS Orphan Resource gives that same ten year old the hope and surety that their efforts will count and that their accumulated skills, education and experiences are meaningful. A family for life, no matter what, supercharges and inspires that Kid to believe in them self, learn more, and be better prepared for a productive and more expressive life. 

Risks & Challenges

Our campaign financial goal is very small to help insure that at least the first step (organizing a 501c3 Trust) gets accomplished. Then we will need your help to raise much more and start sponsoring some Kid's educations and career preparatory activities for them! Let's Do This! 

Help Us Be Able To Tell Another Abandoned Child That People Care About Them So Much That Their Education Is Funded!

And That They Have A New Family!

For Life!

SXS Sisters of XI Sorority - We Really Can Change The World - One Life At A Time!

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't just wait for us or someone else to help these Kids. Get on the web, get on the phone, and find orphans or orphan care givers and ask them what they need. You can probably help more than you think that you can.

Here are just a few things the SXS Sisters of XI Sorority found that orphans really need Right Now! 

Clothing, grooming supplies, school supplies, medical care, school uniforms, rail passes to get to school, books, art supplies, technical supplies, computers, eye glasses, documentations - they are expensive and a constant set back for orphans at every stage of life, hearing aids, wash towels, food, and nutritional supplements - these Kids deserve vitamins too. 

Just contact an orphanage and see for yourself how much is needed and what you can do about that, You Can Do It!

story:
I am a mom of one awesome teen son and our road to now has been really rough the last few years.

From losing my sons dad to suicide in 2012 to also losing our rental and contents to Hurricane Sandy to being dealt with health problems myself I can no way afford on a Social Security Income and Death Benefit Income of under $1400.00 a month cover braces for him.

I went to a couple different orthodontists and the lowest I was quoted was $4500 and with a payment plan of 30 months due to the length of how long his treatment would last. They say he has major crowding which is affecting the growth of his upper jaw. This is affecting the way his teeth come down and has made his facial construction grow with an underbite. If bands, expander and braces arent applied he will most definitly need surgery on his jaw to fix this when he becomes an adult.

I am really in need and would appreciate any help anyone could offer me.

Thank you and many blessing to you,

Stephanie H.

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

In the past year, I have had to make some very important decisions in my life. I was graduating from the University of Toronto and had to decide what my plans would be after graduation. It was a very confusing time as I was unsure of what to do next. However, there were a few things that I was certain about: I wanted to continue learning outside the classroom; gain a different perspective on life; and contribute to the global community. That is when I came across Youth Challenge International (YCI), an international youth development organization that promotes youth innovation to drive positive change.

From February 1st to March 1st, I will be travelling to Tanga, Tanzania with YCI. While in Tanzania, I will have the opportunity to develop personal and professional skills while contributing to youth development programming. As an YCI volunteer, I will work closely with local community members, partner organizations, and local youth to implement programs related to sexual reproductive health, HIV/AIDS, literacy, environmental awareness, and human rights.

I am also responsible for the costs of personal equipment, vaccinations and other expenses associated with volunteering overseas. As such I am seeking your help to propel my career aspirations and invest in my professional and personal development! I am also pledging to turn my global perspectives into action by volunteering with youth development organizations in our community upon my return. Any and all donations will help me achieve my goal and I will forever be grateful to you! Along with my genuine appreciation, I would also like to thank you with a few incentives as listed below.

Love,

Urvi

story:
My name is Amy Joy. I was born in Japan, grew up in the U.S., and studied modern languages and sociology in Europe and South America. I speak 5 languages (English, Japanese, French, Spanish and Portuguese). I am a singer and a dancer, and will very soon complete my studies and become a certified raw foods chef, holistic health coach and yoga instructor. My dream is to help people live healthier and happier lives by offering my skills as a multilingual health educator and performer. 

I am launching this campaign to kickstart my new company, Follow Your Joy. The purpose of Follow Your Joy is to raise awareness about healthful, vibrant, intelligent and compassionate lifestyles though holistic healthcare coaching, raw vegan food workshops, videos, and yoga classes. Health and happiness on a global scale starts with the individual. This is why helping individuals attain true health and happiness matters so much to me. 

The contributor’s support to this campaign is paramount, as it helps me finalize the accreditation process that is necessary to begin serving others in attaining healthier and happier lives. By supporting Follow Your Joy, the contributor also helps to develop community networks that support greater health education and awareness, as well as a web based health channel that educates and inspires viewers worldwide.  

My goal is to raise $8,000. This amount will cover the final leg of my accreditation necessary to officialize Follow Your Joy. This amount covers the cost of my yoga teacher training accreditation ($5,550), my travel cost to Indonesia for the completion of this certificate ($1,500 ~ $2,000), and between $500 ~ $1,000 to cover extra costs related to setting up Follow Your Joy.

This June, I will be taking a course at the Diet for Living Center in Albuquerque, New Mexico with the Center’s charismatic and inspirational lead instructor, Paula Diana, to become a certified holistic health coach and raw foods chef. In September, I will be traveling to Florida to study at the world renowned Hippocrates Health Institute, where I have graciously been awarded an Act of Education award. At HHI I will be attending the Life Transformation Program, which includes studies about holistic approaches to health and wellness, including transformation of the mind, body and spirit. Finally, in October, I will be traveling to Bali, Indonesia, to attend a 200 hour yoga teacher training intensive to become a certified yoga instructor under the tutelage of Alicia Cheung of Yoga Works. I chose this particular program based on my conversations with Alicia, the quality of her character and instruction (based on the numerous testimonials she has received at www.aliciacheung.org), as well as my intuitive affinity and connection with her. 

Through work and savings I have generated enough to pay for my health coach and raw foods chef certification as well as travel expenses to Hippocrates Health Institute. However, I still need additional financial support in order to complete my yoga training, and to cover expenses to get Follow Your Joy up and running.

There are many great perks to supporting Follow Your Joy’s IndieGoGo campaign! From custom designed handcrafted Follow Your Joy jewelry and unique stylish recycled Follow Your Joy T-shirts to yoga classes, private holistic health coach sessions, and gourmet raw vegan meals! By supporting this campaign you will get a first hand preview of the services that will be offered by Follow Your Joy, and also become an integral part of the Follow Your Joy community and network.

Every donation will go towards helping me complete my certification process. Even in the situation that I do not reach my goal, every dollar that is donated during this campaign will go directly to supporting the fulfillment of my accreditation.

There is more than one way to help! If you are not available to make a monetary contribution at this time, please consider helping by getting the word out by sharing this Indiegogo link with friends and family via social network and email, and by making some noise about this campaign in your community! 

Your support of this campaign is DEEPLY appreciated!

A very heartfelt THANK YOU for your interest in supporting FOLLOW YOUR JOY and in creating a healthier, happier and more compassionate world! 

For more information about the campaign and about Follow Your Joy, visit: www.followyourjoy.life

Health and happiness on a global scale starts with the individual. This is why helping individuals attain true health and happiness matters so much to me. 
The contributor’s support to this campaign is paramount, as it helps me finalize the accreditation process that is necessary to begin serving others in attaining healthier and happier lives. By supporting Follow Your Joy, the contributor also helps to develop community networks that support greater health education and awareness, as well as a web based health channel that educates and inspires viewers worldwide.  
My goal is to raise $8,000. This amount will cover the final leg of my accreditation necessary to officialize Follow Your Joy. This amount covers the cost of my yoga teacher training accreditation ($5,550), my travel cost to Indonesia for the completion of this certificate ($1,500 ~ $2,000), and between $500 ~ $1,000 to cover extra costs related to setting up Follow Your Joy.
This June, I will be taking a course at the Diet for Living Center in Albuquerque, New Mexico with the Center’s charismatic and inspirational lead instructor, Paula Diana, to become a certified holistic health coach and raw foods chef. In September, I will be traveling to Florida to study at the world renowned Hippocrates Health Institute, where I have graciously been awarded an Act of Education award. At HHI I will be attending the Life Transformation Program, which includes studies about holistic approaches to health and wellness, including transformation of the mind, body and spirit. Finally, in October, I will be traveling to Bali, Indonesia, to attend a 200 hour yoga teacher training intensive to become a certified yoga instructor under the tutelage of Alicia Cheung of Yoga Works. I chose this particular program based on my conversations with Alicia, the quality of her character and instruction (based on the numerous testimonials she has received at www.aliciacheung.org), as well as my intuitive affinity and connection with her. 
Through work and savings I have generated enough to pay for my health coach and raw foods chef certification as well as travel expenses to Hippocrates Health Institute. However, I still need additional financial support in order to complete my yoga training, and to cover expenses to get Follow Your Joy up and running.
There are many great perks to supporting Follow Your Joy’s IndieGoGo campaign! From custom designed handcrafted Follow Your Joy jewelry and unique stylish recycled Follow Your Joy T-shirts to yoga classes, private holistic health coach sessions, and gourmet raw vegan meals! By supporting this campaign you will get a first hand preview of the services that will be offered by Follow Your Joy, and also become an integral part of the Follow Your Joy community and network.
Every donation will go towards helping me complete my certification process. Even in the situation that I do not reach my goal, every dollar that is donated during this campaign will go directly to supporting the fulfillment of my accreditation.
There is more than one way to help! If you are not available to make a monetary contribution at this time, please consider helping by getting the word out by sharing this Indiegogo link with friends and family via social network and email, and by making some noise about this campaign in your community! 
Your support of this campaign is DEEPLY appreciated!
A very heartfelt THANK YOU for your interest in supporting FOLLOW YOUR JOY and in creating a healthier, happier and more compassionate world! 
For more information about the campaign and about Follow Your Joy, visit: www.followyourjoy.life

story:
Go to: komonews.com/mike's arm ,

Go to komonews.com/mike's arm MY NAME IS MIKE MONEY & I LOST MY RIGHT ARM TO NECROTIZING FASCIITIS (flesh-eating bacteria, which can be Googled: Necrotizing Fasciitis) on March 9, 2012!  I got it from a simple cut on my hand that got infected while working on my pick-up truck!  The horrific condition attacked my right arm, hand and nearly took my life!!  At 4 a.m. I was begging them: "Please don't take my arm!" but wasn't given a choice about keeping my arm-Doctors said:  "Either we amputate your arm or you won't make it!" Within 5 minutes I was taken to surgery!  I awoke to my right arm being amputated!!  On March 11, 2012, two days after the amputation the stump of my arm was still infected so I was airlifted from St. Joseph Hospital in Bellingham, WA. to Harbor-view Trauma Medical Center in Seattle, WA., where they put me on 5 antibiotics at the same time for 4 days, to save my life!  1 in 4 people die from this disease so I am thankful I made it!  

On Dec. 20th, 2012 I went to Harbor-view Trauma Medical Center to have a 2nd surgery, that was for 5 hours, and this time it was to have my nerve endings tucked up higher to lessen the extreme pain I was having and to make it possible to get a "mechanical" prosthetic arm to fit right & be functional.  The bone was also shorten an inch, because it was starting to protrude through the end of the stump of my arm, the skin was tightened and my nerves were rerouted.  Dr. Douglas Smith did the surgery, who is a renowed surgeon and is known world wide! He specializes in amputees needing a "mechanical" prosthetic limb that functions properly.  I was his 41st. patient, which gave me confidence having him do my surgery!

Since losing my arm I have been unable to work, which has caused un-do hardship for my family of 4.  I want to tell people my story on how easy it is to get this infection & how devastating it can be!  Living in a 2 handed world with 1 hand is a struggle everyday!  I need your prayers, well wishes & support.   

I am seeking financial & occupational help, your support & someone who will do a fund raiser for me so I can get a "mechanical" prosthetic arm & return to work! The cost of a "mechanical" prosthetic arm: $50,000-$60,000 dollars!   I am low-income so do not have the funds that I need & can use all the help I can get!

I will be up-dating my web-site if and when a fund raiser is scheduled. There is hope of being able to do one the middle of January at Hotel Bellwether at Bellingham Harbor per Jim Haupt, the manager, but I don't have all the necessary things to do one yet.  I will be working on that after New Years day, will put an article in the Bellingham Herald and will post it here, as soon as I know a definate date. I still need servers, food and flyers.  I have a 6 person band that said they would play-Bandzandt, a cafe that said they will do the catering and 92.9 FM radio said they will be the "voice" for us when we have a definate date scheduled, so it is getting close to being scheduled!

I was interviewed by Komo 4 news on Dec. 24, 2012 while I was at the hospital-I came home Christmas day and the surgery went  well!  Dr. Douglas Smith is an amazing person and surgeon!

Update:  I was back at Harbor-view on Dec. 28, 2012 though to be put on more antibiotics for swelling in the stump of my arm-came home Dec. 30, 2012.  Komo 4 news came to Bellingham that day to finish the article that aired Jan. 1, 2013.  To view the article and see the video go to: komonews.com 

Another Update:  I went back down to Harborview on Jan. 8, 2013 and was re-admitted to the hospital for a 3 hr surgery to irrigate my stump because of an infection!  I came home on the 11th and am doing ok so far!  I go for an appointment tomorrow, Jan. 16th, and will be doing re-hab too, so will know more after tomorrows visit!

I want to say "THANK YOU" to each and everyone who have sent donations-they are appreciated more than I can say!  I am really anxious to get through with rehab so I can get an arm! 

Donations can be made in person with check or cash at ANY Wells Fargo Bank--make checks payable to: "Carol Susmilch for Mike Money" (w/account ending of 7074 in the notes).  

To mail donation to Wells Fargo make checks payable to: "Carol Susmilch for Mike Money" (w/account ending of 7074 in the notes).  Mail to: Wells Fargo Bank/1780 Front St./Lynden, Wa. 98264      Attn: Tami  

Or you can donate thru paypal.com - click on "Transfer tab"  Use my Mom, Carol Susmilch, email address: carol61640@msn.com

An article telling my story was in Bellingham Hearld Oct. 29, 2012-click on link: http://www.bellinghamherald.com/2012/10/29/2743858/bellingham-man-who-lost-arm-to.html#storylink=misearch

If you need more information on how to donate call my Mom or me:   Carol Susmilch: 360-820-3166 /  Mike Money: 360-739-9404  Mail: PO Box 31244 Bellingham, Wa. 98228

Email:  carol61640@msn.com   

Web-site:  indiegogo.com/susmilch

Web-site: komonews.com                                 Web-site: donationsformikesarm.com

Web-site: facebook.com/money

story:
Why Contribute?

  • Surgical staples are used in almost 1/3 of all Surgeries. 
  • There is a 33% chance YOU will have surgical staples removed in your life time. 
  • This device makes the process FASTER, SAFER and LESS PAINFUL.

The SSR is the first Surgical Staple Remover that is completely sterile and compliantwith OSHA’s Needlestick Safety and Prevention Act.

This device makes the removal of surgical staples less painful and is almost 100% faster.

Doctors, nurses, veterinarians, and healthcare workers all loathe removing surgical staples because of the primitive nature of the procedure - it's risky and dangerous!

Now, in 2014, it’s time to introduce the technology to change this process and make it both efficient and hygienic.

With your help, we can get it done! 

We will use these funds to create a production model and get FDA approval.

Check out this acknowledgement from the United States Congress 

______________________

What's Next?

We have signed a contract with FX Devices. A company that has a proven and successful track record of taking medical devices through the FDA approval process and getting the device to market.

The money we raise will be used for testing and manufacturing, allowing us to bring the most effective, user-friendly product to market.

______________________

If you want more information, here's an inside look at the SSR.

About FxDevices

FxDEVICES was founded in 2006 for the purpose of designing, developing, manufacturing and marketing two unique and innovative orthopaedic technologies.

The Company is structured to capitalize on its technologies and produce devices for the fast growing orthopaedic surgical market. FxDEVICES also provides design related services as well as research and development.

FxDEVICES has assembled an experienced management team and medical advisory board and has developed an efficient and cost effective market rollout strategy to penetrate the medical market. 

Our Partners

Mike and Alex Mijares of MJM Manufacturing

MJM Manufacturing is a fully integrated, world class precision sheet metal and metal machining company utilizing complete in-house divisions to provide reliable service. We offer our customers single source responsibility.

MJM provides a wide range of technical and manufacturing services in one company. Their plant is staffed with experienced technicians who realize the need for accurate and innovative services, but maintain an awareness of the reality of production schedules and deadlines.

story:
Hi, I'm Tara Emory, a transgendered woman who is  model and adult actress, self made artist, pin up girl and burlesque performer.  I know it is almost cliche to say that my body is my canvas, but for me it is really is true. If you don't know me, do a little search for my name and you'll see a sampling of my talents in costume design and photography.

You may think this fundraiser looks familiar.  That is because it is an time extension of my original FFS kickstarter.  In that one I raised $2000 of a $9000 goal.  Since it fell short of it's $9000 goal, I have scaled the total amount back to $6000 (which is enough to cover the most important part of the surgery- the forehead/hairine/brow recontouring, leaving the rhinoplasty for another day.   $6000-$2000= $4000 which will be enough to

The $2000 I already raised in the first fundraiser is almost enough to cover a down payment on the surgery to secure a date this spring!  Thank you everyone who donated but I know I wasn't able to promote the fundraiser as much as I wanted to as I was very busy.  As it is I think a lot of people did not know about it.

I'm sure that more people would have become contributors if nly they had known about it- therefore I have extended the fundraiser one more month as the same time as scaling back my goal.

For more information on the surgery package I am planning, visit http://transop.com/index.php/pricing/packages  Originally I was seeking package "B" but I have scaled my goal back to package "A".  $6000 will roughly cover package A + travel costs to Guadalajara, Mexico.

  • I am seeking the help of interested parties helping me to perfect my physical image, so that my body can match up with the heights of my imagination.
  • This is not about me "passing", it is about surpassing, and synching my body image to the boundless ambitions of my imagination, to which I have expressed in my costume design, modelling, and personality.  I've come so far with some of my other surgeries (breast augmentation), but in so doing I missed what was probably the area in most need of attention, my brow and forehead.I'm seeking help from my fans and peers as i would like to get some more surgery done to my face mostly in the hairline/brow region.

    • I have been doing research on this for nearly a decade and have had consultations with surgeons in the United States, however, their prices ($18-30 thousand) have always been out of my budget, even why my website was doing better.  I've found a doctor in Mexico who is world reknown for his work on trans women, and have spoken to and seen some of his clients.  His prices are far more reasonable, but I still need help.

    What I Need & What You Get

    But wait you say, you're Tara Emory, you're PERFECT in your photos! oh my god don't change!!  NoOOOooOOOOO!!!

    • Well, yes, why thank you for believing everything you see in my very selective photos.  And though i use photoshop to a minimum (and try to not misrepresent myself), please don't judge the real me by own photos.
    • There's two very distinct ways you can look at the argument for more surgery.
      First off, we can take the frivilous approach.
    • To all you you fans who have been following my career, you probably have noticed that i have taken a shift towards the plastic, embracing my own talents to be a living cartoon doll.  Getting some light facial surgery done around my eyes and forehead will only enhance that image, and push my career and my own fetishes further, and to you the consumer, that's a good thing, isn't it.  Yes,  you want to see me go further down this rabbit hole! 

      Also, please be assured that i have a very very clear idea of what exactly I want done, and how they won't actually take the personality out of my face or change the way I look that much.  I am very targeted with my goals of only smoothing out the sharp edges and taking what I have, and making it look even better.

      But the flip side to this is very simple.  I still have a hairline of a boy, and hormones only did so much to fix that, limiting my natural hairstyles.  Though for my professional persona I wear lots of different wigs, my natural look could use some help, and the solution is facial feminization surgery.

    The Impact

    The impact of this will help my career, my destiny and actually my self esteem as I will be able to do a lot more with my natural hair than I have previously done.  I've actually never been to a hair salon, though pixie hairstyle cuts work well on me.  Add to that my improved image for my modelling career and my current direction, then it's a win/win.

    • Since my visage and my art are popular with the public, it seems only fitting to ask the public for help, since it is the public who will be the ones who will enjoy the end results as seen in my photographic and modelling art.
    • Also, I know there are fans out there who have seen me and wondered how they could best further my career so I can take it further and further to new heights.  This is the best thing you can do for me and quite literally one of the very few things I want in life!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Perhaps you LOVE what I do, but you just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

    • Spread the word on twitter and the transsexual forums.
    • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to let people know!
