story:
July 17, 2016: Thank you kindly for everyone's support. If you're interested in donating further, please visit https://riderinstitute.org/pages/donate. Thank you!

_________________________________________

We Hope DRACO Will Be A Cure For ALL Viruses! #EndTheVirus | RIDERinstitute.org

Dr. Rider’s DRACO approach and results have been called “visionary” by the White House (White House National Bioeconomy Blueprint, April 2012, p. 9), named one of the best inventions of the year by Time Magazine (November 18, 2011, pp. 58, 78), and featured on the BBC Horizons TV program (2013).

View our previous IndieGoGo campaign that raised $60,823.

DRACO has been effective against ALL viruses tested against! See the Journal of PLOS ONE results

 

Read 'Meet Todd Rider, the Man Who Maybe, Probably Cured Most of the Viruses on Earth' by Inverse.com


Read 'This man's potentially huge medical breakthrough can't get funding, so he's trying something desperate' on Tech Insider.

DRACOs (Double-stranded RNA Activated Caspase Oligomerizers) are broad-spectrum antiviral candidates developed by Dr. Todd Rider. They have proved safe and effective in treating ALL 18 viruses against which Dr. Rider has tested them in proof-of-concept work. Two different types of H1N1 influenza (flu), four types of rhinovirus (the common cold), two adenoviruses, dengue hemorrhagic fever, and others were among the 18 viruses that DRACOs have successfully treated in human and animal cells and in mice.
Check out the published results in the peer-reviewed journal PLOS ONE.

 

We are now raising funds to test and optimize DRACOs against the herpesvirus family, which contains many major clinical viruses such as Herpes Simplex Virus 1 (HSV-1), Herpes Simplex Virus 2 (HSV-2), Cytomegalovirus (CMV), Varicella Zoster Virus (VZV, chickenpox and shingles virus), Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV), and Kaposi's Sarcoma Herpesvirus (KSHV). 
If we can raise enough funding, we also hope to test and optimize DRACOs against the family of retroviruses, which includes Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) and Human T-Lymphotropic Virus (HTLV). 

In principle, the DRACO approach should be effective against virtually all known viruses, or potentially even against new viruses that may appear. Join the movement to #EndTheVirus! 

Donate and spread the word!


Previously published on:


                               

DRACOs could potentially...

A DRACO has already proved effective against four different rhinoviruses (common cold) strains in human cells and against H1N1 influenza (Swine Flu) in cells and in live mice!

(i.e; Ebola, swine & bird flu, SARS, MERS, Zika, Chikungunya etc.)

End the suffering and save the lives of those with incurable viruses (i.e; HIV/ AIDS, HSV (cold sores and genital herpes), herpes zoster virus (chickenpox/shingles), HTLV, HPV, etc...

However, research on DRACOs has entered the well-known “Valley of Death" (Source: NY Times), in which a lack of funding prevents DRACOs, and many other promising new drugs, from advancing toward human clinical trials. 

DRACOs could potentially revolutionize the treatment and prevention of viral infections, just as the development of antibiotics revolutionized the treatment and prevention of bacterial infections in the mid-20th century. 

With your help, we hope that DRACOs may ultimately end suffering and save lives of those struggling with any number of viruses.

By the process of efficiently eliminating only virus-infected cells, DRACOs may be able to permanently cure viral infections that can currently only be controlled but not cured by existing antiviral therapeutics.

When tested in human and animal cells, DRACOs have been nontoxic and effective against 18 different viruses, including rhinovirus (the common cold) and dengue hemorrhagic fever (see table below).

For more information on the results of previous DRACO experiments, see the article published in PLOS ONE.

Still looking for more explanation? Check out this great video!

The ultimate goal is to develop DRACOs as a therapeutic that might be able to treat or prevent virtually all viral infections. But in order for that to happen, we'll need the following:

Lab Space

UMass Lowell is an option that is available for us.

Equipment

Continued Research and Progression of Trials

Timeline: When Might DRACOs Be Available?

The drug approval process is unfortunately long and complicated. What we know is that 4 years (or potentially less depending on funding and results) should be enough time for Dr.Rider to test and collect enough data on clinically relevant herpes viruses that should persuade partners to help advance DRACOs toward human clinical trials. We are committed to testing and optimizing DRACOs against clinically relevant viruses as rapidly and as thoroughly as funding will permit, and we hope to see DRACOs advance to human trials as soon as possible. 

Risks & Challenges 

The greatest challenge has been securing funding to help DRACO research progress. It is also important to note that while DRACO is based on sound scientific principles and has yielded promising experimental results thus far, biological systems are very complex and we can offer no guarantee that DRACO research will end with a pill in a bottle for everyone. Without your help, though, we may never find out.

Currently, DRACO development is in the Valley of Death (the financial and experimental gap between the previously funded National Institutes of Health proof-of-concept experiments and the threshold for convincing major pharmaceutical companies to advance DRACOs toward human trials). This campaign has been set up to raise the funding necessary to bridge that gap. With your assistance, we hope to obtain enough funding to test and optimize DRACOs against clinically relevant viruses in human cells.

Please visit our slideshow presentation for more details and examples by clicking HERE.

If successful, the results of those experiments should persuade pharmaceutical companies and other major sponsors to commit their own resources to advance DRACOs through large-scale animal trials and hopefully human trials. Without your assistance, DRACOs may never progress further, and their potential to revolutionize the treatment of viral infections may remain unfulfilled.

82% of your donation, less the $0.30 credit card fee on each transaction and overhead costs, will go directly to DRACOs research!



Dr.Todd H. Rider

Dr. Todd H. Rider studied both biomedicine and engineering at MIT, including coursework at Harvard Medical School, and has spent his career inventing novel biotechnology projects by combining molecular and cellular biology tools with a systems engineering approach. After receiving his Ph.D. from MIT, he worked at Aeiveos Corporation on in vitro experiments to test and potentially intervene in the molecular mechanisms of human aging.  In 1997 he joined MIT Lincoln Laboratory and the MIT Center for Cancer Research and invented the CANARY biosensor, which uses genetically engineered lymphocytes to identify pathogens within seconds with very high accuracy and sensitivity. He engineered and demonstrated the first CANARY cell lines, as reported in his widely publicized 2003 Science paper.  Dr. Rider invented the DRACO antiviral approach, designed the therapeutics and experiments, personally conducted many of the in vitro and in vivo experiments, and recruited and supervised a team in carrying out the rest. His DRACO research has been called “visionary” by the White House (National Bioeconomy Blueprint, April 2012, p. 9), named one of the best inventions of the year by Time magazine (November 28, 2011, pp. 58, 78), and featured on the BBC Horizons TV program (2013). He has also invented additional PANACEA anti-pathogen therapeutics, novel high-energy biofuel cells, and other projects.  Along the way, Dr. Rider founded and runs the Science on Saturday program and other K-12 science outreach programs at MIT.

The Marketing Team

Behind the scenes we have been lucky to have the assistance of several marketing professionals and volunteers.

This is your chance, so please donate! You can help to advance the development of a therapeutic that may be effective against almost any viral infection. So please, choose to help push research forward by making a donation. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Not able to make a donation? That's okay. If you believe in our mission you can still help by spreading the word on your social media.

Share this link on facebook, twitter and via email:  http://igg.me/at/EndTheVirus
story_txt:
July 17, 2016: Thank you kindly for everyone's support. If you're interested in donating further, please visit https://riderinstitute.org/pages/donate. Thank you!_________________________________________We Hope DRACO Will Be A Cure For ALL Viruses! #EndTheVirus | RIDERinstitute.orgDr. Rider’s DRACO approach and results have been called “visionary” by the White House (White House National Bioeconomy Blueprint, April 2012, p. 9), named one of the best inventions of the year by Time Magazine (November 18, 2011, pp. 58, 78), and featured on the BBC Horizons TV program (2013).View our previous IndieGoGo campaign that raised $60,823.DRACO has been effective against ALL viruses tested against! See the Journal of PLOS ONE results
 Read 'Meet Todd Rider, the Man Who Maybe, Probably Cured Most of the Viruses on Earth' by Inverse.comRead 'This man's potentially huge medical breakthrough can't get funding, so he's trying something desperate' on Tech Insider.DRACOs (Double-stranded RNA Activated Caspase Oligomerizers) are broad-spectrum antiviral candidates developed by Dr. Todd Rider. They have proved safe and effective in treating ALL 18 viruses against which Dr. Rider has tested them in proof-of-concept work. Two different types of H1N1 influenza (flu), four types of rhinovirus (the common cold), two adenoviruses, dengue hemorrhagic fever, and others were among the 18 viruses that DRACOs have successfully treated in human and animal cells and in mice.Check out the published results in the peer-reviewed journal PLOS ONE.


 
We are now raising funds to test and optimize DRACOs against the herpesvirus family, which contains many major clinical viruses such as Herpes Simplex Virus 1 (HSV-1), Herpes Simplex Virus 2 (HSV-2), Cytomegalovirus (CMV), Varicella Zoster Virus (VZV, chickenpox and shingles virus), Epstein-Barr Virus (EBV), and Kaposi's Sarcoma Herpesvirus (KSHV). If we can raise enough funding, we also hope to test and optimize DRACOs against the family of retroviruses, which includes Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) and Human T-Lymphotropic Virus (HTLV). 
In principle, the DRACO approach should be effective against virtually all known viruses, or potentially even against new viruses that may appear. Join the movement to #EndTheVirus! 
Donate and spread the word!

story:
FitNeck

Designed in collaboration with chiropractors, doctors, and professional sports team trainers. It's the only posture device that properly strengthens your critical neck muscles to realign your head back over your body.

 

Use FitNeck for just 1-2 min a day to prevent injury, relieve pain and fatigue caused by neck strain, reverse "text neck," look better, and feel healthier!

Your neck posture is critically important to your overall wellbeing.

No exercise in the gym properly targets the stabilizer muscles in your neck which are responsible for pulling your head back over your shoulders and correcting your posture. 

FitNeck is the only home device that properly assists in performing cervical retraction. The exercise prescribed by chiropractors to strengthen key stabilizer muscles in your neck. Unlike methods that use bands, towels or balls, FitNeck's adjustable tension and hands-free use makes it easy to perform effective and safe cervical retractions.

 

 

Poor neck posture is more than just an unsexy look.

It actually leads to neck pain, headaches, fatigue, and a host of serious problems.

Normal exercise... if you can even find the time or energy... does not help. That's because there are specific neck muscles that exercise equipment does not target. These neck muscles are responsible for aligning your head above your body, allowing your spine to function properly.

 

 

Tested by doctors, chiropractors, and top sports trainers.

 

Shown above: Valerie Orsoni testing FitNeck.

We've been extensively testing and refining FitNeck over the past year. It's now ready for manufacturing. We just need your help and early support to launch FitNeck and help cure the "text neck" epidemic.

 

 

What is "text neck"?

Just take a look around you, how many people do you see staring down at their phones? Our modern lifestyle means we spend several hours a day with our necks bent forward and down staring at our smartphones and computer screens. By doing so, we increase the weight of our heads dramatically, causing extreme pressure on our necks. Over time, the nerves are continually put under great stress and tension, leading to significant health risks like chronic headaches, digestive issues, and spine degeneration.

 

 

 

Who is FitNeck designed for?

The short answer, everyone!

Anyone who wants to feel and look better, have more energy, and eliminate the serious problems associated with poor neck postures.

Your neck stabilizer muscles really are that important!

FitNeck is not a magical cure-all, but it is an essential tool in correcting one of the worst problems in modern life: poor neck posture leading to dozens of undiagnosed problems.

With any exercise device, please consult a qualified chiropractor or doctor if you've had a neck injury or have any issues with your spine.

 

People who spend more than 30 minutes a day looking down at cellphones and other electronic devices can greatly benefit from FitNeck.

 

Contact sports players who need to strengthen their necks to prevent whiplash and concussion.

 

 

Anyone with back and neck pain due to poor posture.

 

Nursing women often end up with severe neck pain, headaches, and other problems due to constantly looking down at their baby. FitNeck can help you feel better and even give you more energy by preventing fatigue associated with neck strain. Follow best practices for ergonomically nursing and use FitNeck to restore your posture.

 

 

More than just a pain in the neck

“Text neck” causes us to carry our heads out in front of us rather than over our shoulders where it belongs. This disruption in posture is connected to anxiety, fatigue, and even allergies. Excessive stress and strain on the neck and spine affects the central nervous system, which runs the entire body. If left untreated, “text neck” can cause some serious damage like IBS, onset of early arthritis, nerve damage, disc compression, loss of lung volume capacity, and more.

The solution

FitNeck is a unique and innovative device designed to strengthen your neck muscles and correct your posture. It helps prevent the development and advancement of “text neck."

 

FitNeck makes it easy!

1. Quick - Get your neck strong again with a 2 minute exercise 4x a week

No sweat, no fancy gym gear

2. Easy - It can be used everywhere

3. Effective - Research-backed results

FitNeck properly aligns the head and neck while performing the chin tuck exercises prescribed by chiropractors for injury recovery and prevention.

Academic research has shown proper use of chin tuck exercises strengthens critical stabilizer neck muscles and realigns the head back over the body.

FitNeck is the only device that makes it easy, safe, and fun to perform these exercises and achieve results in just a couple minutes a day of use.

 

Key Features

  • Variable tension adjustment knob
  • Quick release switch to close FitNeck for storage
  • Carrying case
  • Heavy duty, durable construction
  • 2 year warranty

 

Reviews

 

 

 

 

FitNeck does what other exercises can’t

"Most of the exercises we do in the gym fail to address the core stabilizer neck muscles. The ones that matter most. When we begin to use effective exercise designed to realign our head back over our shoulders, we look more attractive, we feel way more confident, and we age better because our health improves dramatically." – Dr. Paula Moore

FitNeck is the only device designed to specifically target the core stabilizer neck muscles. Making it easy, safe, and fun to fix your neck posture and reverse the damage done by hunching over phones and laptops.

 

Timeline

  • Early 2016 - concept and initial prototypes
  • Mid 2016 - testing
  • Late 2016 - patent filed
  • Early 2017 - design refinements and testing with professional sports teams and trainers
  • Mid 2017 - design for manufacturing, secured manufacturer
  • Oct 2017 - IndieGoGo launch
  • Nov 2017 - Manufacturing
  • Dec 2017 - Shipping

 

Team / Manufacturing / Delivery

The design team for FitNeck has decades experience designing and manufacturing high quality mechanical products. We are confident in the product design and manufacturing process.

While we cannot guarantee a specific delivery date due to high shipping volume in December, we will do everything in our power to ensure a smooth manufacturing process and prompt delivery. Our top priority is ensuring the quality of the product and satisfaction of our backers (YOU).

 

Warranty

We believe in the superior quality of FitNeck. If for some reason it breaks during normal use, just send it back to us and we will repair or replace it free of charge. Our #1 priority is making a top quality product and making sure you are happy with your FitNeck. Most importantly, we want you to keep using your FitNeck and staying healthy!

 

Thank you!

It's been a long journey to get to this point, and we're just getting started on our mission to reverse the "text neck" epidemic. With your generous support as an a backer of this project, you'll not only receive a FitNeck before everyone else, you'll be part of the journey.

We greatly appreciate your help in spreading the word about FitNeck.

Please share this page on social media and tag someone you care about.

Thank you!

story:
Cotton Face Masks

We are aware that many people work in environments where dust, powder or sprays are a regular part of their work, who need added protection from these daily tasks.

Which is why we have created washable face masks.

Our Solution

We decided to produce washable, soft, cotton face masks; they are also recyclable. Using our knowledge and resources from our experience in the UK fashion industry, we have designed original masks in a range of colours and patterns.

 

Available now

You can choose to purchase a mask for yourself by selecting one of our perks.
You can choose a bundle of masks if you would like multiple masks.

Available colours

We have completed our prototype stage and have begun production, however we want to reach out to anyone who would benefit from our masks.

We have produced our masks with a triple layer of cotton. Please view our perks available in this campaign in exchange for your contribution.

We have a wide range of styles available; we are launching with Sky Blue, Jet Black, Blossom Pink, Cocoa Brown, Crystal White and Sand, which can be selected individually or as a bundle.

Thank you for helping us to reach our Stretch Goal! We have now introduced our wonderful new patterns and prints below; Polka Dot Pink, Floral Meadow, Pineapple-Pop, Jungle Khaki Camo, Navy Camo and Panda.

We have also released our super early bird perk, which features the Camo Collection; three masks in Jungle Khaki Camo, Black and Navy Camo. 

All of our masks are made with a triple cotton layer.

Why is it important for the environment?

Our masks are recyclable and made with natural products such as cotton.

So many single-use, disposable items end up on landfills and in our oceans, which is what we are looking to avoid. Our reusable masks may be washed at home in your washing machine and used again.

When you are finished with your mask, please recycle it. 

Please help us to spread the word by sharing this campaign or following us on social media and tagging your friends and family on Facebook and Instagram.

If you require a press kit or would like to speak to us about distribution please feel free to email us.

story:
The Temple Massager

Say hello to a non-invasive, non-drug, complementary alternative to medicine device that does one wonderful thing extraordinarily well. The temple massager relaxes the facial muscles, and that’s a big deal.
Corroborated anecdotal data indicates the temple massager was useful as a drug-free distractor and a calming mechanism in both post-combat and hospital settings.
Fund raising will help our company with  manufacturing , data collection, donations and logistical needs so we can serve the communities of:
Service members
Veterans
First Responders
Woman's shelters

Combat Army soldiers deployed to Afghanistan, Iraq and Kuwait have reported:

“The Temple Massager was used as a natural form of combat stress relief.”

Service members in recovery at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center reported:

 “The Temple Massager acted as a drug free distractor.”

Veterans across the U.S. have reported:

“That Temple Massager stops me from thinking and for that I am grateful.”

Visit www.TempleMassager.com today!

Background

In September of 1997, I was nearing the end of my military career as a Combat Engineer and college student and was under heavy stress. I started to develop pain in my lower jaw area, began to poke and prod at my facial muscles with my sunglasses, and decided that I needed to buy a temple massager immediately. But such a device did not exist. Realizing the potential in the product, I spent years developing a prototype and in  2008 received a patent.  As I was working on this project, the men and women I had served with were being deployed to Iraq and Afghanistan. Seeing the stress they were under I hoped the Temple Massager would help them and other veterans to relax. Over the next 11 years, I gave away 2,800 of them. Now, with unprecedented stress in the workplace, we're making the Temple Massager available for everyone.

The Impact

TMD

What is TMD? Temporomandibular disorders (TMD) are disorders that arise from problems with the occlusion (the contact between teeth), jaw joint, and surrounding facial muscles that control chewing and moving the jaw. Symptoms include: clicking/popping sounds in the jaw, jaws that get 'stuck' or 'locked' in the open- or closed-mouth position, difficulty chewing, and swelling/pain/tenderness in the face.

When using the Temple Massager for relieving the facial muscle tension relating to TMD it is important to use the small single massage tip and apply a small amount of non scented lotion to the skin in front of the ear to reduce and prevent skin friction irritation.

Focusing the massager tip close to and around the TMJ joint is most effective while letting the mouth hang open, the muscle is engaged if the mouth is closed so practice massaging while remembering to leave your jaw open and not engaged. Having your mouth open is the best way to massage into the TMJ area and under the cheek. Also massaging around the top area of the ear and around the Temple area is good too. Massaging the entire area but more specific to the area in front of the ear is best.

Intrusive Thoughts

The Temple Massager, as described by Doctor Mark Abramson Adjunct Professor Stanford University School of Medicine founder of the Mindfulness based stress clinic, is stimulating critical areas of the head such that the users awareness shifts from daily thoughts or intrusive thoughts to the massage and aromatherapy stimulation thus breaking a person out of reoccurring intrusive thoughts of past trauma. This bad loop memory can cause an increase of adrenaline and cortisol which are powerful stress hormones that can cause harm by keeping a person at constant vigilance or hyperawareness when they are not actually in harm’s way.

For a person to now have a small lightweight tool to instantly stop these intrusive reoccurring thoughts is a new way of approaching mental health. Based on thousands of years of temple massaging, aromatherapy and acupressure the Temple Massager was designed to deliver Holistic practices or also known as CAM therapy (Complimentary Alternative Medicine.) in a drug free and noninvasive manner. 

If a person has been exposed to any trauma in life, military or not, bad stuff is bad stuff no matter who you are. You could have these reoccurring thoughts haunting you. The creator of the Temple Massager suffered from these thoughts when a fellow soldier drowned in training. He has used the Temple Massager to disrupt these reoccurring thoughts which gets you out of that mental rut.

Headaches

The Temple Massager was designed to relieve the user from holding up and engaging the neck, shoulders, arms and hands so you can get a personalized pressure adjusted targeted massage at little effort. Keeping the facial muscles relaxed is recommended by Dr’s to prevent and relieve facial muscle tension that can lead to tension headaches caused by stress.

Massaging the entire area of the side of the head is important to relieve muscle tension that can lead to tension headaches. We recommend the tri-point massage tip for this. Focusing the massage tips around the top of the ear and around the temple area is best, it is important to remember to let your mouth hang open. If you allow your jaw to hang open the facial muscles are not engaged and you will get more out of massaging a limp or not engaged muscle than keeping your mouth closed which engages the facial muscle. Breathing deep is critical as you massage. Some people including the creator of the Temple Massager who suffers from migraine headaches likes the lights out while lying down and in a quiet area.

Calming

Here is how to use the Temple Massager to calm and relax.

Make yourself comfortable preferably laid down or sitting in a reclining chair. If you don’t have that just sit or lay down anywhere and open the massager arms so they are about head width apart then push the Temple Massager arms over your forehead and then adjust the pressure to your desire and begin to move the Temple Massager around your temple area. Move the massage tips all around the ear and jaw. All the while you breathe deeply.

Be Mindful, stop thinking, let the stimulation of massage and aromatherapy be your total awareness.   

The Data Doesn't lie!

Temple Massager. Inc. is currently undergoing pre-clinical trials with Polytrauma Systems of Care VA Palo Alto, Ca and Stanford University School of Medicine to test the efficacy of the Temple Massager in mild and moderate Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) patients who suffer from headaches. 

In addition to the data forthcoming from these studies, Temple Massager has years of anecdotal data from surveys, user feedback, and questionnaires conducted at CalState Hayward University, Marines at 29 Palms and the storied Camp Pendleton. Results from these sources are exceptional.

Temple Massager has been invited to present our abstract at the 2017 2018 Stanford School of Medicine Neuroscience Forum, 2017 2018 Palo Alto, Veterans Administration TBI Forum and most recently the Military Health Systems Research Symposium.
story_txt:
The Temple Massager
Say hello to a non-invasive, non-drug, complementary alternative to medicine device that does one wonderful thing extraordinarily well. The temple massager relaxes the facial muscles, and that’s a big deal.Corroborated anecdotal data indicates the temple massager was useful as a drug-free distractor and a calming mechanism in both post-combat and hospital settings.Fund raising will help our company with  manufacturing , data collection, donations and logistical needs so we can serve the communities of:Service membersVeteransFirst RespondersWoman's shelters
Combat Army soldiers deployed to Afghanistan, Iraq and Kuwait have reported:
“The Temple Massager was used as a natural form of combat stress relief.”
Service members in recovery at Walter Reed National Military Medical Center reported:
 “The Temple Massager acted as a drug free distractor.”
Veterans across the U.S. have reported:
“That Temple Massager stops me from thinking and for that I am grateful.”

Visit www.TempleMassager.com today!
Background

In September of 1997, I was nearing the end of my military career as a Combat Engineer and college student and was under heavy stress. I started to develop pain in my lower jaw area, began to poke and prod at my facial muscles with my sunglasses, and decided that I needed to buy a temple massager immediately. story:
INTRODUCING TOMPOMA

Highly resistant. Improves posture & reduces stress. A fashion accessory.




WHO INVENTED TOMPOMA?


TOMPOMA AWARDS

Selected and published as best design object in 2010 by

OUR MISSION

OUR MISSION is to overcome the psychological and physical barriers of the disability! Illnesses, accidents or old age condemn us to live dependent on canes and crutches. Imposing us to adapt to a motor aid that will harm the course of our life, causing side effects, such as calluses and blisters on the hands and forearms, shoulder and back pain.

The true weakness is not the disability in itself, it is the fragility of the motor aids.

We created a cane with a revolutionary shape that changes the way we live disability in a big way. With Tompoma, being temporarily or permanently limited, or simply aging, will no longer be a handicap but a new beginning.

MEET THE TEAM

story:
Our Story

 My father, Robert Smith Jr. aka Abu, has been a hard worker all his life and has always worked for himself. He  worked practically every job from being a cab driver in NYC to owning a candy shop business to owning a very small incense and body oil business, which he loved very much and was very proud of. Although, neither of these businesses made him millions it was enough for him to provide for himself and his family and keep my brother and I in private schools for a good education.


 He was very a independent worker and always on the go even at 67 years old!, until a few months ago when he was diagnosed with complete kidney failure. He now has to go for dialysis 3 times a week which weakens him. On top of this he has type 1 diabetes, very high blood pressure, and has recently become unable to see in one eye.


Its hurtful and shocking to see him like this but I know that there is light at the end of the tunnel. One good thing I notice is that it seems that when he consistently has loving family members around him, he finds the hope, strength and will to get better. One person who I know will have the strongest impact, is his mother, my grandmother Francis. He is her first son and loves him dearly.  The only problem is that my father is in a rehab nursing home in Wilkes-Barre, PA and she lives over 600 miles away in Clover, South Carolina and she does not have the funds to go see him.


The Impact

 The purpose of this campaign is to help pay for travel and hotel expenses for my grandmother and her daughter/caretaker, Aunt Helen to see to see my dad. 


What We Need & What You Will Get

Were hoping that $1000 will be enough to cover all travel expenses for my grandmother and Aunt Helen. Any funds that is raised over  that will go towards my dad's medical bills. Everyone who contributes will get a personalized Thank You card and picture of my dad. We will also send you pictures and an update of what happened after my Grandmother visited her son.


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out by sharing with your friends and family. If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to message me here. We thank you dearly for your support and my father will be pleased to hear that you've help facilitate this union of mother and son!

story:
A little more about Staying Healthy San Antonio...

 

"Staying Healthy San Antonio" is a news and information show dedicated to reporting the latest in medical innovations, emerging technologies, and health treatments available in San Antonio.

There is no other show like this in the San Antonio area and it surprises me every day because our city needs this!

 All over San Antonio there are treatment centers for a number of different things that nobody knows about.  "SHSA" brings these treatment centers out into the public spotlight.  The show will also feature fitness segments where professional athletes and fitness gurus will get the word out on the benefits of exercising and the different types of fitness activities the city of San Antonio offers.  Also a vital segment to the show is our Comedian's Kitchen, where comedians Jade Esteban Estrada and Roman Garcia travel to different kitchens around San Antonio for tips on healthy eating!

Please, I need your help!  $5, $10, $20--whatever you can spare, this show will use and turn it into quality local television aimed at providing a public service to the people of San Antonio to bring them healthy and informative programming that may actually make them feel better.

story:
Share Your Calories App

Track Your Calories and Share the Extras

Join the movement to improve your health and to end world hunger all in one incredible FREE mobile app! Please help us today!

Users will track calories consumed and burned off, AND they will be able to share their extra calories by donating them to Stop Hunger Now’s global feeding programs.



Partners and Sponsors



Introducing The Share Your Calories App

What $95,000 Will Build:

  • Personal Bio-Data Calculator
  • Daily Calorie Tracker
  • BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate) calculator and BMI (Body Mass Index) calculator
  • Food Database
  • Bar Code (UPC) Scanner
  • Build a Meal for users to see their remaining calories for the day
  • Food Finder
  • Calorie Bank to bank your extra calories
  • Donate Now to translate those extra calories into meals
  • Meal Tracker to show how many meals you  have donated to Stop Hunger Now
  • Share Your Calories feedback on when and where your meals were delivered
  • Community Building with integrated social media
  • Customer Service to keep you happy

What $95,000 Extra Funding Will Build:

  • Android App
  • Pop-Up Smart Options to help you stay within your calories range
  • Game Layer to make learning about calories fun
  • Animated Educational Videos by a team of medical illustrators to explain what calories are and how your body uses them
  • Nutrition Basics to learn about essential nutrients and how they work
  • Inspiration Gallery, short videos with healthy lifestyle tips from celebrities and real heroes, like our US disabled veterans
  • Cooking and Exercise Videos to keep you inspired
  • Recipes from The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook: The Toolkit You Need to Make Smart Calorie Decisions Every Day
  • Spanish and other language translations




HOW THE APP WORKS

  1. Determine Your Daily Calorie Needs by entering your bio-data: height, weight, age, gender, and activity level. Start tracking your calorie input for the day by entering foods or scanning barcode labels. Track your exercise, too. The design will be intuitive and fun to keep users coming back.
  2. Set Up Your Calorie Bank. Any calories that you don’t consume can be stored in your Calorie Bank. For instance, if you skip a 250-calorie candy bar, you can place 250 calories in your personal calorie bank. The calories are then converted to monies at the exchange rate of 250 calories = 25 cents.
  3. Transfer Your Extra Calories to Your Calorie Bank. When you have reached $12, or more, worth of calorie savings, you have the option to donate to Stop Hunger Now. $12 will get you 48 freeze-dried meals. You will be informed when your meals are packaged and shipped, and you will receive a receipt for tax deductions. Donations of any amount can be made at any time, even without cutting back on calories!

  4. Join the Container Club. When you donate the equivalent of a box of meals (216 meals or $54), you will be listed on the virtual container (on the Share Your Calories website) being filled for shipment. Schools, social groups, and friends can gather to make large donations, especially when natural disasters strike.

    • 1 Stop Hunger Now high-protein dehydrated meal = 250 calories
    • 1 meal = $0.25
    • 1 bag = 6 meals = $1.50
    • 1 box = 36 bags = 216 meals = $54
    • 1 pallet = 66 boxes = 14,256 meals = $3,564
    • 1 container = 20 pallets = 285,120 meals = $71,280
  5. Repeat, Repeat, Repeat! And invite your friends to get involved. Together we can and will make this world a healthier and happier place.

Where do these Stop Hunger Now meals go?

Stop Hunger Now, established in 1998, has packaged over 121 million meals that have been distributed to more than 65 countries, and the list is constantly growing! They also play a key role in providing meals for global disaster relief. The Share Your Calories App will have a system to send out mass appeals for meal-funding during disasters, such as the recent tragedy in the Philippines from Typhoon Haiyan.


How does this app work with Stop Hunger Now?

The financial contributions from the Share Your Calories app would go towards funding Stop Hunger Now’s meal packaging events. The meal assembly process combines rice, dehydrated soy and vegetables, and a vitamin-mineral pack into every meal. Meal packs store easily, have a shelf-life of two years, and transport quickly. Stop Hunger Now works with international partners that ship and distribute the meals in-country. Currently, the only way Stop Hunger Now can execute meal-packaging events is for large host-organizations, such as IBM, to provide financial support. Funds from this app will enable Stop Hunger Now to engage smaller groups, such as universities, schools, civic and religious organizations, and small business to participate.


What problems do the Share Your Calories app solve?

The Obesity Epidemic Around the Globe

According to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, 69% of Americans are overweight or obese. Worldwide, 35% of adults are overweight or obese. Obesity in the US has nearly doubled since 1980. From 1960 to the early 2000s, the average weight of adults in the US increased by 20 pounds: an increase from 174 to 195 pounds for men, and 145 to 165 pounds for women.

Malnourishment and Hunger Around the Globe

Nearly 870 million people, or one in eight of the world’s population, suffer from chronic malnourishment (United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization, FAO). Of those suffering from chronic malnutrition, roughly 25,000 die per day (FAO). Under-nutrition contributes to 2.6 million deaths of children under five each year; that is, a child dies every six seconds due to hunger and malnutrition. Proper nourishment has profoundly positive effects on all aspects of a child’s growing years.


How can sharing can make you feel good about weight loss?

Losing weight isn’t easy. Two recent studies suggest that giving to others makes us happy, even happier than spending on ourselves. What’s more, our kindness might create a virtuous cycle that promotes lasting happiness and altruism (Journal of Social Psychology, 2011). Weight loss alone can lead to feelings of deprivation, loneliness, and depression. The social-giving component will have a built-in feel-good factor. So, even if you take a diet tumble, instead of kicking yourself, you know you’ve done a great thing.

We are committed to completing this app by May 2014. We appreciate your help and support!

Program Team

Catherine Jones

Catherine Jones is an award-winning author of three nutrition-cookbooks, including The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook: The Toolkit you Need to Make Smart Calorie Decisions Every Day, Eating for Pregnancy: The Essential Nutrition Guide and Cookbook for Today’s Mothers-to-Be (2nd Edition), and Eating for Lower Cholesterol: A Balanced Approach to Heart Health with Recipes Everyone Will Love. Her goal is to increase calorie awareness, and to inspire people to adopt a healthy lifestyle. She and Elaine Trujillo, MS, RDN, co-founded Share Your Calories, with a mission to create nutrition-based apps. She is the Program Director of Share Your Calories. Catherine calls Bethesda, Maryland home. More information available at www.caloriesinandcaloriesout.com.


Elaine Trujillo, MS, RDN

Elaine Trujillo, MS, RDN, is a national leader in nutrition. She received a BS degree from the University of Delaware, and a MS at Texas Woman’s University. She is Chair of the Oncology Nutrition Dietetic Practice Group of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics, which in 2013 published Oncology Nutrition for Clinical Practice. She formerly served as Chair of Education and Research for the Maryland Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. She uses a variety of approaches to share her views and findings about nutrition, including co-authoring, with Catherine Jones, The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook and Eating for Lower Cholesterol. In addition to authoring the textbook, Nutritional Support in the Care of the Critically Ill, she has written various scientific journal articles and book chapters. She received the Huddleson Award for her outstanding article published in the Journal of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. She and her husband live in Maryland. More information available at www.caloriesinandcaloriesout.com.


Rod Brooks, CEO Stop Hunger Now (Partner)

Rod Brooks is the CEO of Stop Hunger Now, a US-based international hunger relief organization established in 1998, that has grown exponentially over the years. Through Stop Hunger Now’s meal packaging program, volunteers assemble high-protein fortified meals designed for shipment around the globe. These freeze-dried meals are distributed by in-country partners in communities in more than 65 countries, primarily through school feeding and other transformational development programs. More information at www.stophungernow.org


Juan Ignacio Montesinos Uñate, MD

The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas

Dr. Juan Ignacio Montesinos obtained a Medical Degree from the Instituto Tecnológico y de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey. While training to become a surgeon, he realized that his real passion was IT. He manages the IT components of MSFA and two more companies, including medical information technology initiatives, digital marketing, social media, technology infrastructure, and database management. His main areas of interest are bioinformatics, eHealth, and health IT.


Armando Salim Munoz Abraham, MD

The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas

Dr. Salim Munoz is currently working on his Masters of Science in Biotechnology Enterprise and Entrepreneurship at Johns Hopkins University in Maryland. As an intern for MSFA, his work consists of providing medical insight and expertise for several research opportunities, evaluating new medical technologies, coordinating clinical trial networks, and strategic planning for new research projects. Munoz obtained a Medical Degree from the Universidad Anahuac in Mexico.


HUGE THANKS TO OUR PARTNERS

Rod Brooks, CEO of Stop Hunger Now, has a mission to end world hunger in our lifetime. We support his team and volunteers to make this dream happen!

The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas has embraced Share Your Calories under their organization, which is determined to reverse the obesity trends around the globe. This app is their first tool.

Matthew Lore, President of The Experiment Publishing, called the Share Your Calories app visionary. We are grateful for The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook: The Toolkit You Need to Make Smart Calorie Decisions Every Day, and his support.

We would like to thank Donny Bliss, a medical illustrator at the NIH for sharing his creative talent, and Matt Greenland, our videogpraher and photographer. You are both amazing, and lots of fun to work with!

Share Your Calories is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization under The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas, EIN: 27-0350125.


Frequently Asked Questions

Why does it cost so much to build this app?

The creation of a large project such as the Share Your Calories Application involves many hours of complex design, programming, and product testing on the selected delivery platforms. Seamless integration with additional programs, databases and websites, as well as monetary donation organizations require a multitude of security features and scrutiny by many companies and organizations to make sure that all aspects are working within current standards and laws. Building the SYC app takes time, individuals with nutrition expertise, and partnering with the best companies out there. Additional funding will mainly go towards the creation of an Android Application, adding a game layer to the app and creating video animations that help the message get across. The typical charge per second of finished animation is $250 to $300 USD per second.

Do weight loss apps really work?

Yes! A study from Northwestern University shows that using mobile apps as part of your weight-loss program can help you drop as much as 15 pounds and keep it off for at least a year. That’s great news!

When will the app be ready?

We will launch the app with The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook in May 2014. We’ve been brainstorming and working on the design plans for months, so as soon as we have the funding we will start the development process immediately.

Do users have to cut back calories to donate them?

No! Anyone can donate any amount at any time to Share Your Calories. We hope the social giving component inspires users to feel good about losing weight, if they need to. And, if they don’t, giving back is the best recipe for happiness.


Even if you can't contribute, please spread the word to family and friends. With your help we will be able to reach our goal!


For more information, feel free to contact: Catherine Jones, Co-Founder and Program Director of Share Your Calories.

Pop-Up Smart Options to help you stay within your calories range


Game Layer to make learning about calories fun


Animated Educational Videos by a team of medical illustrators to explain what calories are and how your body uses them


Nutrition Basics to learn about essential nutrients and how they work


Inspiration Gallery, short videos with healthy lifestyle tips from celebrities and real heroes, like our US disabled veterans


Cooking and Exercise Videos to keep you inspired


Recipes from The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook: The Toolkit You Need to Make Smart Calorie Decisions Every Day


Spanish and other language translations


HOW THE APP WORKS


Determine Your Daily Calorie Needs by entering your bio-data: height, weight, age, gender, and activity level. Start tracking your calorie input for the day by entering foods or scanning barcode labels. Track your exercise, too. The design will be intuitive and fun to keep users coming back.

Set Up Your Calorie Bank. Any calories that you don’t consume can be stored in your Calorie Bank. For instance, if you skip a 250-calorie candy bar, you can place 250 calories in your personal calorie bank. The calories are then converted to monies at the exchange rate of 250 calories = 25 cents.

Transfer Your Extra Calories to Your Calorie Bank. When you have reached $12, or more, worth of calorie savings, you have the option to donate to Stop Hunger Now. $12 will get you 48 freeze-dried meals. You will be informed when your meals are packaged and shipped, and you will receive a receipt for tax deductions. Donations of any amount can be made at any time, even without cutting back on calories!


Join the Container Club. When you donate the equivalent of a box of meals (216 meals or $54), you will be listed on the virtual container (on the Share Your Calories website) being filled for shipment. Schools, social groups, and friends can gather to make large donations, especially when natural disasters strike.

1 Stop Hunger Now high-protein dehydrated meal = 250 calories
1 meal = $0.25
1 bag = 6 meals = $1.50
1 box = 36 bags = 216 meals = $54
1 pallet = 66 boxes = 14,256 meals = $3,564
1 container = 20 pallets = 285,120 meals = $71,280



Repeat, Repeat, Repeat! And invite your friends to get involved. Together we can and will make this world a healthier and happier place.
Where do these Stop Hunger Now meals go?
Stop Hunger Now, established in 1998, has packaged over 121 million meals that have been distributed to more than 65 countries, and the list is constantly growing! They also play a key role in providing meals for global disaster relief. The Share Your Calories App will have a system to send out mass appeals for meal-funding during disasters, such as the recent tragedy in the Philippines from Typhoon Haiyan.
How does this app work with Stop Hunger Now?
The financial contributions from the Share Your Calories app would go towards funding Stop Hunger Now’s meal packaging events. The meal assembly process combines rice, dehydrated soy and vegetables, and a vitamin-mineral pack into every meal. Meal packs store easily, have a shelf-life of two years, and transport quickly. Stop Hunger Now works with international partners that ship and distribute the meals in-country. Currently, the only way Stop Hunger Now can execute meal-packaging events is for large host-organizations, such as IBM, to provide financial support. Funds from this app will enable Stop Hunger Now to engage smaller groups, such as universities, schools, civic and religious organizations, and small business to participate.
What problems do the Share Your Calories app solve?
The Obesity Epidemic Around the Globe
According to the Center for Disease Control and Prevention, 69% of Americans are overweight or obese. Worldwide, 35% of adults are overweight or obese. Obesity in the US has nearly doubled since 1980. From 1960 to the early 2000s, the average weight of adults in the US increased by 20 pounds: an increase from 174 to 195 pounds for men, and 145 to 165 pounds for women.
Malnourishment and Hunger Around the Globe
Nearly 870 million people, or one in eight of the world’s population, suffer from chronic malnourishment (United Nations Food and Agricultural Organization, FAO). Of those suffering from chronic malnutrition, roughly 25,000 die per day (FAO). Under-nutrition contributes to 2.6 million deaths of children under five each year; that is, a child dies every six seconds due to hunger and malnutrition. Proper nourishment has profoundly positive effects on all aspects of a child’s growing years.
How can sharing can make you feel good about weight loss?
Losing weight isn’t easy. Two recent studies suggest that giving to others makes us happy, even happier than spending on ourselves. What’s more, our kindness might create a virtuous cycle that promotes lasting happiness and altruism (Journal of Social Psychology, 2011). Weight loss alone can lead to feelings of deprivation, loneliness, and depression. The social-giving component will have a built-in feel-good factor. So, even if you take a diet tumble, instead of kicking yourself, you know you’ve done a great thing. 
We are committed to completing this app by May 2014. We appreciate your help and support!
Program Team
Catherine Jones
Catherine Jones is an award-winning author of three nutrition-cookbooks, including The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook: The Toolkit you Need to Make Smart Calorie Decisions Every Day, Eating for Pregnancy: The Essential Nutrition Guide and Cookbook for Today’s Mothers-to-Be (2nd Edition), and Eating for Lower Cholesterol: A Balanced Approach to Heart Health with Recipes Everyone Will Love. Her goal is to increase calorie awareness, and to inspire people to adopt a healthy lifestyle. She and Elaine Trujillo, MS, RDN, co-founded Share Your Calories, with a mission to create nutrition-based apps. She is the Program Director of Share Your Calories. Catherine calls Bethesda, Maryland home. More information available at www.caloriesinandcaloriesout.com. 
Elaine Trujillo, MS, RDN
Elaine Trujillo, MS, RDN, is a national leader in nutrition. She received a BS degree from the University of Delaware, and a MS at Texas Woman’s University. She is Chair of the Oncology Nutrition Dietetic Practice Group of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics, which in 2013 published Oncology Nutrition for Clinical Practice. She formerly served
as Chair of Education and Research for the Maryland Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. She uses a variety of approaches to share her views and findings about nutrition, including co-authoring, with Catherine Jones, The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook and Eating for Lower Cholesterol. In addition to authoring the textbook, Nutritional Support in the Care of the Critically Ill, she has written various scientific journal articles and book chapters. She received the Huddleson Award for her outstanding article published in the Journal of the Academy of Nutrition and Dietetics. She and her husband live in Maryland. More information available at www.caloriesinandcaloriesout.com.
Rod Brooks, CEO Stop Hunger Now (Partner)
Rod Brooks is the CEO of Stop Hunger Now, a US-based international hunger relief organization established in 1998, that has grown exponentially over the years. Through Stop Hunger Now’s meal packaging program, volunteers assemble high-protein fortified meals designed for shipment around the globe. These freeze-dried meals are distributed by in-country partners in communities in more than 65 countries, primarily through school feeding and other transformational development programs. More information at www.stophungernow.org
Juan Ignacio Montesinos Uñate, MD
The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas
Dr. Juan Ignacio Montesinos obtained a Medical Degree from the Instituto Tecnológico y de Estudios Superiores de Monterrey. While training to become a surgeon, he realized that his real passion was IT. He manages the IT components of MSFA and two more companies, including medical information technology initiatives, digital marketing, social media, technology infrastructure, and database management. His main areas of interest are bioinformatics, eHealth, and health IT.
Armando Salim Munoz Abraham, MD
The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas
Dr. Salim Munoz is currently working on his Masters of Science in Biotechnology Enterprise and Entrepreneurship at Johns Hopkins University in Maryland. As an intern for MSFA, his work consists of providing medical insight and expertise for several research opportunities, evaluating new medical technologies, coordinating clinical trial networks, and strategic planning for new research projects. Munoz obtained a Medical Degree from the Universidad Anahuac in Mexico.
HUGE THANKS TO OUR PARTNERS
Rod Brooks, CEO of Stop Hunger Now, has a mission to end world hunger in our lifetime. We support his team and volunteers to make this dream happen! 
The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas has embraced Share Your Calories under their organization, which is determined to reverse the obesity trends around the globe. This app is their first tool.
Matthew Lore, President of The Experiment Publishing, called the Share Your Calories app visionary. We are grateful for The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook: The Toolkit You Need to Make Smart Calorie Decisions Every Day, and his support. 
We would like to thank Donny Bliss, a medical illustrator at the NIH for sharing his creative talent, and Matt Greenland, our videogpraher and photographer. You are both amazing, and lots of fun to work with!
Share Your Calories is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization under The Medical Science Foundation on Behalf of the Americas, EIN: 27-0350125.
Frequently Asked Questions
Why does it cost so much to build this app?
The creation of a large project such as the Share Your
Calories Application involves many hours of complex design, programming, and
product testing on the selected delivery platforms. Seamless integration with
additional programs, databases and websites, as well as monetary donation
organizations require a multitude of security features and scrutiny by many
companies and organizations to make sure that all aspects are working within
current standards and laws. Building the SYC app takes time, individuals with
nutrition expertise, and partnering with the best companies out there. Additional funding will mainly go towards the creation of an Android Application, adding a game layer to the app and creating video animations that help the message get across. The typical charge per second of finished animation is $250 to $300 USD per second.
Do weight loss apps really work?
Yes! A study from Northwestern University shows that using
mobile apps as part of your weight-loss program can help you drop as much as 15
pounds and keep it off for at least a year. That’s great news!
When will the app be ready?
We will launch the app with The Calories In Calories Out Cookbook in May 2014. We’ve been
brainstorming and working on the design plans for months, so as soon as we have
the funding we will start the development process immediately. 
Do users have to cut back calories to donate them?
No! Anyone can donate any amount at any time to Share Your
Calories. We hope the social giving component inspires users to feel good about
losing weight, if they need to. And, if they don’t, giving back is the best
recipe for happiness.Even if you can't contribute, please spread the word to family and friends. With your help we will be able to reach our goal!
For more information, feel free to contact: Catherine Jones, Co-Founder and Program Director of Share Your Calories.

story:
(David is in the bottom left) (In the icon you clicked he is the one in black in the middle)

Our story

David was brought to our attention as a young man, age 14.  We already had four children and didn't expect anymore. However, when we learned about his story our hearts felt a purpose. What if we could make a difference? 

Taking him in has had it's definite ups and downs.  He showed us more than we cared to know about a world outside the peaceful one we knew.  Slowly, very slowly, he developed trust in us. We have reached a point of desperation after eleven years of every therapy we can think of. He has become so desperate to overcome the sadness in his heart created by years of abuse, neglect and abandonment. His hope of overcoming his PTSD issues and experiencing for the first time healing for his mind, body, and spirit can be found at a residential mental health facility called "The Ranch" based in Tennessee.

"The Ranch" is not cheap unfortunately and our insurance will pay only a small amount of the cost. We are desperately trying to raise the funds to complete the costs because the total cost of the program is $58,000 and our funds are depleted as well as our credit maxed out.   The program director of "The Ranch" has adjusted the cost to $31,000. Every penny raised will go to them for our precious son. It doesn't matter how much you give.  Every little bit helps.  It feels like an awful lot to ask, but we believe David must have this help before his suicidal thoughts become a reality. Your contributions will make all the difference in whether he lives a long productive life or continues to live a tormented self loathing existence of unproductiveness.

Through giving and helping us reach this goal we believe that the bright young man we have nurtured will overcome and become what he is wishing to be. We have seen him at his worst, yet try again to help himself while helping others.  We need help making this opportunity a reality, to end suffering from the stress and nightmares of his past so that he can go on to help others. You will forever be remembered by him and us for any help no matter how small. If money is a problem for you please just send notes of encouragement. 

Thank you for your care.

The Davison Family

story:
Hi there =) My name is Heather and I am a single, full time Mother to three spectacular gifts from the heavens. I have been serving the community for years in many different ways: In home child care, Pet care, Plant care, House keeper, Birth Doula, Placenta specialist, Healing stone jewlery designer, Henna artist, Lactation support person, and an organic gardener who always shares the bounty with our community <3

I am a giver by nature and through my whole being, I have always had a hard time remembering to take care of myself let alone to ask for help for myself...but something has been brewing for years that is now threatening not only my happinessand ability to give my children my full attention by causing indescribable and debilitating pain at times but also something that can threaten my very life. Bad teeth by heritage. 

In my family we have beautifully straight, and often white, teeth with wonderful gums, but we make up for those gifts by a curse of being cavity ridden. It sounds and seems benign at first, but over time it deteriorates your teeth and causes abscesses that, when not fixed, have been known to kill people. 

I have not been in a financial situation to take care of my growing cavities for roughly 4 years. This resulted in 4 of my teeth, over the past 18 months, breaking and abscessing. I was embarassed when they started to break but they were out of sight in the back of my mouth and not causing too much pain....at first. When 2 out of the 4 broke they were very sharp but I dealt with them cutting the inside of my mouth because I was trying to be strong for and not scare my children, friends, or family and knew I didn't have dental insurance nor the finances to cover it while caring for three children and from Oct 2011- Feb 2014 not having a car (which made working near impossible). 

One day, at the begining of 2014, I began to get a deep pain that went from my cheek, into my jaw, and even into my neck. I tried to ignore it, but over the months it grew to be so intense I couldn't sleep and would stay up crying at night. In the end I was taking roughly 4 IB Prophen/Advil (switching off) every 2 hours and was still in unbearable pain. I went to the E. R.  multiple times and they have various ideas of what it could be but nothing solved the problem....so I found somewhere where I could get evaluated by a dentist for free. The day I went in, around June, there was a hard lump under my jaw and by my cheek...they found my tooth was terribly abscessed. I used money I didn't have to spend to have it removed. DONE! I was free of the evil infected too and was going to be all better now!....or so I thought. 

Days passed and the pain didn't get better and the swelling under my jaw got worse and worse though my cheek swelling went down. When I revisited the dentist he was concerned the infection was so strong that there was a bubble, if you will, of infection that only the hospital could attend to so they said to head to the E.R. ASAP. 

When I went to the E.R. they thought the swelling/"bubble of infection" needed to be drained. So for hours on end on a Saturday night (missing my children and basically alone) I sat at the hospital being numbed up with lidocain on a swab of cloth in my mouth for roughly half an hour, then given another shot in my mouth to numb, then cut open in my mouth near my recent extraxtion site (already tender and in pain), was injected with a dye for x rays, had blood drawn, and an IV of more antibiotics all the while the room seemed to be spinning with facial pain, nausea, and a migraine. In the end they said what the dentist said and sent me home with stronger antibiotics.

Still after a day or so NOTHING improved. So I went to a different hospital under the urge of my dentist. I was seen quickly all to find out my glands were infected due to the intense abscess. I had to be given steroids, pain medication (of which was intersting in and of itself trying to find something I could stomach as most heavy pain medications make me ill which is why up until this particular E.R. visit I was only on IB Prophen and Advil that was upsetting my stomach extremely), a shot of fast acting steroid, and directions to keep up the higher potency of antibiotics. 

After large feats of trying to rest as much as I could (a difficult thing to do with a 9 y.o., 5 y.o., and 2 y.o.) and the new care from the E.R. I FINALLY started to feel better and the swelling reduced. I found out around the end that this all could have killed me. A horrifying and eye opening fact I knew I was going to have to deal with now...for I have THREE other broken and abscesing teeth that were begining to cause the same pain shortly after I mended from the giant fiasco of that ONE tooth. And oh the time lost! All the time lost that I could have been spending with my children and all the time I could not smile, laugh, and be happy with them...and how much more time will such a silly thing like bad teeth take from my children and I?

Since then (now in the beginings of July) I have had 2 more teeth extracted and am now on a payment plan (money I just don't have some days) but there is still another broken tooth, another close to being unsaveable in the front that is on the verge of going from in need of a crown to a root canal and if not treated then will end up abscessed as well, at least 4 others that need crowns, and countless cavities needing to be filled. All of this to try and save my life because in the end I do not have the means to get the work I need done and if I leave them I may not be around for my children. 

I know I am asking a lot when there are others in way worse situations than mine, but I so humbly and bravely ask now if those in our community could help by giving just a few dollars each to raising money to give our family a miracle. A few dollars from you equals the chance at a happily ever after for my children and I.  

If you have gotten this far (and even those who skimmed or barely read anything) in reading I want to say thank you a hundred times over. What a kind and patient person you must be and I hope for showers of blessings on you and yours! Thank you so much for your precious time, prayers, blesings, energy, and good thoughts xoxoxoxox


*Love and prosperity to you and your loved ones*

<3 Le latcho drome <3

~Heather Shannon~

story: Nameless Valley Blogger Managing Editor Tammie Williams Sheppard lost all her teeth at the age of 29 from the affects of bulimia/anorexia and medications harmful to her teeth.  She doesn't have the money to get a set of choppers and her medical insurance will not cover dentures or implants.  She has never asked anyone for anything nor does she expect anything.  Her mission in life is to help those who still suffer from mental and physical illness, since she has Lupus, too.  Let's show this woman some love, folks, by donating today.

story:
During July and August Ian will be competing in 3 sponsored swims for Katie's Helping Hand. The first 2 are one mile swims in The Thames and Salford Dock. The third is a two mile swims in the darkest, deepest and possibly monster infested open water of Loch Lomond. If you want the opportunity to make sure Ian faces his worst fears and to make sure he keeps training, please help by sponsoring him here.

Ian will be swimming for Katies Helping Hand. 


Katies Helping Hand was formed in 2013 in rememberance of Katie Flood. Katie devoted so much of her life to helping children achieve, and exceed, their potential. However it’s often difficult for a multitude of reasons, whether they be cultural, financial or through a lack of facilities for these young people to fulfil their dreams, hopes and aspirations. The fund aims to help by providing bursaries for children to experience new sports, skills or pastimes to give them an opportunity they may otherwise not have had. We have already approached a number of local sports clubs, artists and musicians who are willing to provide a great start for these young people. This help may range from a tennis racquet and fees paid for a term at the tennis club, equipment and subs at the cricket club, a Gi and karate lessons, assistance in the purchase of an instrument and lessons, to drama club subscription. Of course we have only been able to think of a few of the things that people may aspire to. We have been lucky that we have had many kind donations to the fund and we hope that the beneficiaries will become the fund raisers of tomorrow to give long term help to young people in the area.
