story:
Short Summary

Hi-my name is Joseph Affrunti. 

I am the inventor/creator of Kheelz: Key Emergency Contact & Medical Information for Children-Every Step They Take

Kheelz provides a safe, secure and reliable way for children and to carry an In Case of Emergency Card, (ICE Card" with them where ever they go... every step they take!

Kheelz will help your child, or a family member, in the following situations:

  • To quickly reunite a lost person (child, autism, dementia) with their family

  • To provide medical records – such as blood type, allergies, conditions, this will minimize the chance of injurious treatment and medical errors.

  • To notify family – minimizes the family's worry and ensures First Responders have a contact.

  • To provide support – ensures you have an advocate at your side ASAP – this is critical during that first "Golden Hour" following an accident or sudden illness

  • To ensure your medical wishes are followed – either provided by family or directly linked with the ID – in the same way your medical information can be provided

Kheelz is a product that utilizes my patent pending idea: a pocket cushion shoe insert 'with possible life saving benefits for children and adults being used this way.

It is a very reliable, low tech way to provide peace of mind for parents and the children who wear them.

At the retail level, the price will be around $12-15 per pair-free shipping,

I will be contacting schools and daycare centers and offering a deep discount if they buy in bulk, around $7-7.50 a pair. Want to get product out there!

I am looking for your support to:

  1. Create and launch an e-commerce website IceCardInsoles.com to promote and sell Kheelz product line
  2. Add to my existing inventory of Kheelz for children
  3. Contact elementary schools/child care centers to see if they would use Kheelz 
  4. Finalize design and place first order for Kheelz for Adults
**Keep in mind when reviewing this campaign, that yes there are numerous companies selling medical alert jewelry, but because of my patent pending pocket cushion shoe insert, NO other company will be selling anything like Kheelz!  

IDEA of "Kheelz"?

When I first came up with the idea of Kheelz, it was to be a spare key shoe insert holder for my 2 children who kept losing or forgetting their house keys. I would have to leave work early in order to let them into the house. 

Below is an image of my first drawings of the idea.

key + heel = Kheelz 

After my children were both in an auto accident, it transformed into the potential life saving device it is today!

I have made way too many proof of concept prototypes before final design was approved. Below is an image of a few...


Kheelz the PRODUCT

Each Kheelz ICE Card Shoe Insert ID System includes:

  • One pair of patent pending pocket cushion shoe inserts
    The insert themselves provide cushion and support often lacking in todays children shoes. The insert can be hand washed as well if needed.

  • Two shoelace charms with the standard red medical emergency ID logo surrounded by the words in black ink "ICE CARD in Shoe Insert"
  • Two blank Emergency Contact/Medical ID Cards to be filled out the same way (one for each insert). 

    These cards are special because they can be filled out with a regular ball point pen and are printed on WATERPROOF paper! 

    These cards can get wet, be submerged under running water and the ink will not smear. Just dry off with paper towel and insert back into insert.

    Front of tri-fold Card
    Back of tri-fold Card



    Available sizes

How Kheelz changes EVERYTHING

Emergency ID is like an insurance policy that, when you have a claim "pays out", or delivers, information when and where you need it most.

Kheelz does NOT rely on electronic card readers or computer devices that first responders must figure out how they work, no passwords to enter in order to access contact/medical information. Phones are damaged in accidents so their medical ID apps are useless.
First responders and emergency personnel are trained to look for medical alert jewelry.  Shoelace charms are an accepted form of medical ID and the most recommended for young children

Kheelz simplicity it what makes it so effective in an emergency situation.
I have even spoken with Bob Brotchie, the creator of the ICE Card movement and he thinks Kheelz is a great idea and wishes me well on this project!

Kheelz enhances the many of the positive features of medical ID jewelry while eliminating most of the negative aspects of medical ID jewelry, such as:

  • Readily Available Information- ICE cards in Kheelz can provide full detailed medical records, such as blood type, allergies, conditions, medications, along with multiple family contacts, and ensure medical/religious wishes are followed. (Medical Jewelry has limited space to engrave such information.)
  • Updating- If your medical conditions changes or you need to update emergency contact numbers, it’s easy to do with inexpensive replacement blank Kheelz ID cards. (Medical ID jewelry is engraved and unchangeable.)
  • Security- Kheelz Medical ID cards are hidden within the shoe. Medical information should only be accessed when needed. No information is reveled on the ID Charms located on shoes. (Important information visible on a bracelet can cause embarrassing situation or fall into the wrong hands if Medical ID jewelry falls off.)
  • Breakage- Kheelz and ID’s are secure within the cushion pocket shoe insert and placed in shoe. (Jewelry based ID’s especially bracelets and necklaces are prone to breakage.)
  • Forgettable- With the Kheelz ICE Cards placed in shoes, when you go out, you will have medical ID every step you take! (Jewelry based ID tends to be removed for sleeping, showering, dirty chores, must be removed for many activities like gym, food handling occupations, construction work, safety sensitive jobs(don’t want the jewelry to get caught on machinery). Once jewelry is removed, it can be misplaced, lost and even easy to forget to put back on. If it’s not being worn all the time you are out, it doesn't work.)
  • Usability- The Kheelz: ICE Card Shoe Insert is designed for everyday use and with you every step you take. (Some ID are designed for use during a single activity- rugged sports IDs, kids throwaway wrist IDs for use on outings. These items have their place and tend to be inexpensive. Since they are not for use all the time they don’t really work to protect you. It’s like having auto insurance only on Saturday.)
  • Price- The Kheelz: In Case of Emergency ID System can fit any budget and  has no hidden costs compared to other jewelry based IDs:

    ID Cost    -by this we mean the costs of the physical ID. It varies but in general entry level durable ID starts in $20 to $40 range. That’s for 1 stainless steel ID. One can spend hundreds or thousands for Swarovski crystals and gold bracelets

    Engraving    - some companies charge for engraving the jewelry ID- can be more than $20 for 5 lines.
Kheelz will hopefully become the new standard for children's medical alert ID's. 

Where I Am & Where You Come In

Here is what I have done so far: 
  • Created concept and developed idea
  • Paid for professional patent searches
  • Protected idea with Provisional Patent in 2013 
  • Filed a Full Utility Patent for Pocket Cushion Shoe Insert early 2014
  • Filed Trademark for Kheelz in 2014
  • Secured domain names: IceCardInsoles.com, IceCardInsole.com and Kheelz.com
  • Set up working relationships with suppliers
  • Small inventory of 250 Kheelz ready to sell along with 250 more for give-a-way/promotion
Here is how your contributions will help:
  1. Set up and promote e-commerce website in 1-3 months.
  2. Send samples to elementary schools/child care centers immediately
  3. Secure more inventory
If my goal is exceeded the funds will used to:
  • Finalize design for adult version of Kheelz
  • Place order for adult version of Kheelz
  • Promotion of both Kheelz

    The Impact

    Just for reference and to put things in perspective let's consider a few accident and illness facts. This is not scare-mongering – all these stats are foot-noted to government web sites. Accidents happen. Illness happens. Injuries happen.

    • Vehicle accidents - 10.8 million accidents resulted in 2.3 million children/adults treated in emergency departments2 and 35,900 deaths3
       (USA 2009). (http://www.census.gov/compendia/statab/2012/tab... )

    • Lost children - 579,000 children in the US go missing each year4. 66,000 children in Canada go missing5.
      (http://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/preview/mmwrhtml/mm5951...)

    • Wandering children - 49% of autistic children wander off at least once after age 4. http://www.cbc.ca/news/background/missingchildren/

    • 1,315,600 children were missing from their caregivers during 1991 (OJJDP, 2002). That is over 3600 missing children every day, one every 24 seconds. Of these, 797,500 were reported missing to the police or other agencies, and 198,000 were lost or injured.

    • After the tragedy of the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting, the parents of the deceased children were brought into the school one set of parents at a time to help identify the children because the children couldn’t be recognized.
    You cannot control when an accident, sudden illness and injury happens. But you can control what happens afterwards – here's why you should care about controlling what happens afterwards:
    • 32: % of Emergency Dept. Visits with an identified information gap (Steillet al, Information Gaps in the ER, CMAJ, 2003) 

    • 250,000: People killed by medical errors each year in the United States. Add the millions who are injured and "you have probably the third leading cause of death", says Dr Peter Pronovost - Sr. Vice President for Patient Safety and Quality, Johns Hopkins Medicine. (http://www.cnn.com/2012/06/09/health/medical-mistakes/index.html)

    • 6: hours on average for family members to be contacted in an emergency. http://ice4safety.blogspot.com/2010_09_01_archive.html ; http://ice365.net/ 

    To recap, more than a third of people will directly or indirectly interact with an emergency department; a third of emergency department visits involve a lack of information; the third leading cause of death is medical errors.

    Who can make sure the hospital has the right information? FAMILY. But it takes 6 hours for family members to be contacted in an emergency!

    So the context is that bad things happen, people end up in hospitals, where despite the best efforts and intentions of our medical system, bad things also happen.

    Do you want to ensure the right information is provided to the hospital and that you/your family are notified immediately that there is an emergency? Of course.

    Kheelz will help family's in emergency situations and give them peace of mind more efficiently than existing products 


    Risks & Challenges

    Like crossing the street, there are risks and challenges everyday that may affect my outlined timeline for meeting my own self imposed deadlines.

    There may be delivery/supply issues with my vendors/suppliers.

    I will do my best to give timely updates on the progress or lack of progress being made in specific areas as they are met or unmet.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Times are rough and please feel no pressure to make a financial contribution.

      If you have an even a more valuable  commodity...FREE TIME... I'll Take it

      Here's ways to help me get this potentially life saving device recognition:

      • Share this campaign with friends and family
      • If you have a grammar school age child, tell their teacher/principal  about this great product you think ALL the children should be wearing
      • Contact the local PTA and tell about Kheelz and to learn about selling Kheelz as a school fundraiser
      • Enter Kheelz giveaways (coming soon to a social media near you)
      I would welcome everyone's opinion and comments as well
      THANKS FOR THIS OPPORTUNITY!!!

I am the inventor/creator of Kheelz: Key Emergency Contact & Medical Information for Children-Every Step They Take
Kheelz provides a safe, secure and reliable way for children and to carry an In Case of Emergency Card, (ICE Card" with them where ever they go... every step they take!



Kheelz will help your child, or a family member, in the following situations:


To quickly reunite a lost person (child, autism, dementia) with their family


To provide medical records – such as blood type, allergies, conditions, this will minimize the chance of injurious treatment and medical errors.


To notify family – minimizes the family's worry and ensures First Responders have a contact.


To provide support – ensures you have an advocate at your side ASAP – this is critical during that first "Golden Hour" following an accident or sudden illness


To ensure your medical wishes are followed – either provided by family or directly linked with the ID – in the same way your medical information can be provided

story:
Hi my name is Matthew, I'm a 19 year old aspiring professional cyclist. I have been cycling for only 3 years now and I have already achieved so much. My greatest achievement to date is recording a PB for a 10 mile time trial, of 20:32, in respect of not just a friend, but a role model for my cycling. I achieved this time on just a standard road bike with 50mm wheels. Another one of my achievements is producing a 2nd place in general classification in the Downton 2 day race, where I also achieved 2nd place in the time trial stage, producing a 32:03 for a 14 mile TT on a borrowed time trial bike, as shown in my campaign photo. I have also had some good road race results with a win at both the Purbeck road race, which I broke away from the bunch with 35 miles left and stayed away by myself. I also won the Hestridge road race where myself and another great rider broke away after 5 miles and stayed away for the next 45 miles.

Next year I will be looking to enter the British national U23 time trial championship, of which is my main goal. As well as the national 10 and 25 and not to mention making a name for myself within the cycling community. For my future goals I am looking to go all of the way and turning into a professional cyclist. Competing with the best riders in the world and challenging for the time trial rainbow bands.

To help me turn my goals into a reality I am in need of some extra cash to help me purchase the equipment I require. With the kind donations, that'll be greatly appreciated, I will be looking to achieve a grand total of £6000 which will be put to purchasing time trial equipment, as listed below. If there's money left over after purchasing the equipment needed, I will put it into race entries as well as transport for the races I'll be entering.  This will help me to get noticed by bigger teams that will help me to progress to achieve my goals.

The money that is raised will be going to purchasing:

Giant Trinity pro TT frameset £2500

Ultegra 6870 di2 11 speed group set £900

Shimano di2 11 speed TT switches £180

Fast forward carbon rear tubular disc wheel £780

ISM PR 1.0 saddle £75

Victoria open corsa evo CX (£48x6=£288)

Carbon brake pads (£30x2=£60)

Osymetric road outer chainring £115

Professional bike fit £180

Aero helmet (depending on bike fit position) £150-£300

Like I said previously, if there is money left over I will be looking to use it for race entries as well as travel expenses and also maintaining the bike (services/repairs if need be).

 

Thank you very much for having a look at my campaign.

story:
-Working to improve healthcare delivery and consumption has been my goal since losing my fraternal grandfather to Parkinson’s disease. My name is Chris Vukin, I am a registered nurse with 12 years working on improving access to quality non-biased healthcare in real-time.experience and practice working on improving access to quality non-biased care in real-time. My experience in the real world with myriad EMR software iterations in a multitude of settings, Medical-Surgical/ICU/Emergency Room/Dr offices, and remote access clinics via skype and facetime, provides me with an acute awareness of what is lacking, what is hoped for and some of the exciting possibilities in meeting and conquering these challenges. Watching a loved one pass away was a life changing experience for me. Over the course of two weeks my family watched as our loved one slowly died before our eyes due to the ravages of Parkinson’s disease. We were not aware of nor were we offered any assistance of help and support through organizations as basic as Hospice or Comfort Care services. How can we all have access to quality information, so we, as healthcare consumers and providers can make informed decisions? evermed is a new paradigm for a classic charting method in healthcare that has the added advantages of modern data analysis and advanced data collection/display UIs.

 

-If an individual suffers from diabetes, high blood pressure, chronic pain, elevated cholesterol, irregular heartbeat, COPD, emphysema, Crohn’s or kidney failure; join our group of patients and providers in collecting data on these and other diseases to help researchers develop better treatments and therapies. evermed provides real time advice and info based on your specific health profile. This specific information does include, but is not limited to: meal suggestion’s, supplemental therapies you can do right where you are to improve your overall health and wellbeing, medication reminders, appointment reminders for healthcare appointments and links to current, easy to read and understand information on your health conditions and medications.

 

GRASP (graphical reference analytic systems pod via evermed browser +Glass+MYO+Scanadu)

-Participating in the evermed GRASP, individuals, families and caregivers get access to video care consults and receive real-time treatment recommendations based on the most current and accurate information provided by your evermed profile. See your lab history and get evidence based information specific to your health problems and lab results virtually immediately.

 

-evermed is the culmination of a desire to improve not only the routine (an ounce of prevention..) day to day care , but access to advanced care for situations that require the most accurate and immediate response. evermed merges advanced cloud computing with unique data collection and input technologies that will be commercially available for reasonable prices to assist healthcare consumers in maintaining and improving overall health and wellbeing.

 

-The Indiegogo community will allow evermed to provide an opensource EMR/EHR for little and eventually no cost to healthcare consumers and providers. The Indiegogo community will allow for the expansion of core database and API interfaces for Google Glass, Thalmic Labs MYO motion control UI, and Scanadu medical tricorder devices. Together we will launch the smart EMR tek that will allow high quality healthcare access wherever a data connection is available.

 

-If an evermed subscriber is out in a remote location with a medical emergency, they can access the system and get real-time assistance with their medical needs by using their smartphone, tablet, laptop, desktop or web enabled TV. Have a Glass? Even better, join a hangout with your provider for unprecedented access to care and advice along with the evermed  GRASP of presented health data.

 

-Together we will change healthcare delivery and consumption throughout the world. Your contributions will help not only those of us here in the States, but in all those burgeoning areas of the remote world gaining internet access; Africa, Asia, Indonesia, Alaska, South America, Canada, Mexico; virtually anywhere in the world.  evermed will provide health monitoring for healthcare consumers via remote web access. Anywhere there is an internet connection; homes, offices, schools, libraries, clinics; evermed will allow medical students, nursing students, physical therapy/occupational therapy students, along with other health science students to run community based clinics to provide ongoing health monitoring and treatment for inner-city, or outback areas (Alaska, Canada, Mexico, etc) with direct access to advanced practitioners and instructors through augmented video chats to provide healthcare to underserved populations. (GRASP)

 

-Join the evermed team by helping to change how healthcare is provided worldwide to the healthcare consumer by real-time monitoring of their health status and active alerts and actions sent directly to them and their healthcare provider when action needs to be taken on health issues. evermed provides unique opportunities for healthcare consumers and providers. We welcome your contributions at the individual, friend, family, small business, provider, practice, clinic, and homecare level to help us develop healthcare to a level of efficiency heretofore only dreamed of or imagined.



-Healthcare in America is expensive and time consuming, there is no reason for us to consume our healthcare this way. We have the tools and techniques to provide quality care at reasonable cost why not use them? When you come to a Doctor or other healthcare provider with a health problem, they have a treatment protocol they go through based on the stated and observed complaints a patient has. evermed is taking this same process and making it smart. Our team of physicians, pharmacists, nurses, technicians and health IT professionals are designing and testing care algorithms for addition to the evermed platform. Initially, evermed will launch with smart monitoring for the top 10 health conditions in the US; Heart Disease, Cancer, Stroke, Respiratory Diseases (Asthma,COPD & Emphysema), Diabetes, Alzheimer’s Disease, Influenza and Pneumonia, Kidney Disease, and Septicemia.Our physicians, pharmacists, nurses and IT professional’s have already built and designed the ARRA stage 1&2 Meaningful Use EMR builds for established EMR vendor technology at their various institutions. The team consists of practitioners with extensive history on current EMR vendor platforms including; Cerner, Epic, Meditech, Greenway, Practice Fusion, and the VA system. These systems are all a variation on a theme, point and click charting, the narratives are lost leaving us with patients all looking the same when charts are compared. evermed hopes to change this with a shift to narrative based charting. Recently Stanford researchers showed how this charting method is effective for catching more data.



  • http://med.stanford.edu/ism/2013/april/clinical-notes.html

  • http://www.scanadu.com/

  • https://www.thalmic.com/myo/

  • http://www.google.com/glass/start/

 

Thanks for spending a few minutes of your day thinking and learning about evermed, we encourage you to feel free to share our story with others you believe might get the vision of evermed.

 

ps, don't forget to head over to the Scanadu and MYO links above to augment your evermed experience!
story_txt:
-Working to improve healthcare delivery and consumption has been my goal since losing my fraternal grandfather to Parkinson’s disease. My name is Chris Vukin, I am a registered nurse with 12 years working on improving access to quality non-biased healthcare in real-time.experience and practice working on improving access to quality non-biased care in real-time. My experience in the real world with myriad EMR software iterations in a multitude of settings, Medical-Surgical/ICU/Emergency Room/Dr offices, and remote access clinics via skype and facetime, provides me with an acute awareness of what is lacking, what is hoped for and some of the exciting possibilities in meeting and conquering these challenges. Watching a loved one pass away was a life changing experience for me. Over the course of two weeks my family watched as our loved one slowly died before our eyes due to the ravages of Parkinson’s disease. We were not aware of nor were we offered any assistance of help and support through organizations as basic as Hospice or Comfort Care services. How can we all have access to quality information, so we, as healthcare consumers and providers can make informed decisions? evermed is a new paradigm for a classic charting method in healthcare that has the added advantages of modern data analysis and advanced data collection/display UIs.
 
-If an individual suffers from diabetes, high blood pressure, chronic pain, elevated cholesterol, irregular heartbeat, COPD, emphysema, Crohn’s or kidney failure; join our group of patients and providers in collecting data on these and other diseases to help researchers develop better treatments and therapies. evermed provides real time advice and info based on your specific health profile. This specific information does include, but is not limited to: meal suggestion’s, supplemental therapies you can do right where you are to improve your overall health and wellbeing, medication reminders, appointment reminders for healthcare appointments and links to current, easy to read and understand information on your health conditions and medications.
 
GRASP (graphical reference analytic systems pod via evermed browser +Glass+MYO+Scanadu)
-Participating in the evermed GRASP, individuals, families and caregivers get access to video care consults and receive real-time treatment recommendations based on the most current and accurate information provided by your evermed profile. See your lab history and get evidence based information specific to your health problems and lab results virtually immediately.
 
-evermed is the culmination of a desire to improve not only the routine (an ounce of prevention..) day to day care , but access to advanced care for situations that require the most accurate and immediate response. evermed merges advanced cloud computing with unique data collection and input technologies that will be commercially available for reasonable prices to assist healthcare consumers in maintaining and improving overall health and wellbeing.
 
-The Indiegogo community will allow evermed to provide an opensource EMR/EHR for little and eventually no cost to healthcare consumers and providers. The Indiegogo community will allow for the expansion of core database and API interfaces for Google Glass, Thalmic Labs MYO motion control UI, and Scanadu medical tricorder devices. Together we will launch the smart EMR tek that will allow high quality healthcare access wherever a data connection is available.
 
-If an evermed subscriber is out in a remote location with a medical emergency, they can access the system and get real-time assistance with their medical needs by using their smartphone, tablet, laptop, desktop or web enabled TV. Have a Glass? Even better, join a hangout with your provider for unprecedented access to care and advice along with the evermed  GRASP of presented health data.
 
-Together we will change healthcare delivery and consumption throughout the world. Your contributions will help not only those of us here in the States, but in all those burgeoning areas of the remote world gaining internet access; Africa, Asia, Indonesia, Alaska, South America, Canada, Mexico; virtually anywhere in the world.  evermed will provide health monitoring for healthcare consumers via remote web access. Anywhere there is an internet connection; homes, offices, schools, libraries, clinics; evermed will allow medical students, nursing students, physical therapy/occupational therapy students, along with other health science students to run community based clinics to provide ongoing health monitoring and treatment for inner-city, or outback areas (Alaska, Canada, Mexico, etc) with direct access to advanced practitioners and instructors through augmented video chats to provide healthcare to underserved populations. (GRASP)
 
-Join the evermed team by helping to change how healthcare is provided worldwide to the healthcare consumer by real-time monitoring of their health status and active alerts and actions sent directly to them and their healthcare provider when action needs to be taken on health issues. evermed provides unique opportunities for healthcare consumers and providers. We welcome your contributions at the individual, friend, family, small business, provider, practice, clinic, and homecare level to help us develop healthcare to a level of efficiency heretofore only dreamed of or imagined.

-Healthcare in America is expensive and time consuming, there is no reason for us to consume our healthcare this way. We have the tools and techniques to provide quality care at reasonable cost why not use them? When you come to a Doctor or other healthcare provider with a health problem, they have a treatment protocol they go through based on the stated and observed complaints a patient has. evermed is taking this same process and making it smart. Our team of physicians, pharmacists, nurses, technicians and health IT professionals are designing and testing care algorithms for addition to the evermed platform. Initially, evermed will launch with smart monitoring for the top 10 health conditions in the US; Heart Disease, Cancer, Stroke, Respiratory Diseases (Asthma,COPD & Emphysema), Diabetes, Alzheimer’s Disease, Influenza and Pneumonia, Kidney Disease, and Septicemia.Our physicians, pharmacists, nurses and IT professional’s have already built and designed the ARRA stage 1&2 Meaningful Use EMR builds for established EMR vendor technology at their various institutions. The team consists of practitioners with extensive history on current EMR vendor platforms including; Cerner, Epic, Meditech, Greenway, Practice Fusion, and the VA system. These systems are all a variation on a theme, point and click charting, the narratives are lost leaving us with patients all looking the same when charts are compared. evermed hopes to change this with a shift to narrative based charting. Recently Stanford researchers showed how this charting method is effective for catching more data.



http://med.stanford.edu/ism/2013/april/clinical-notes.html


http://www.scanadu.com/


https://www.thalmic.com/myo/


http://www.google.com/glass/start/

 
Thanks for spending a few minutes of your day thinking and learning about evermed, we encourage you to feel free to share our story with others you believe might get the vision of evermed.

story:
28 August 2013

To all Cardboard Bike supporters: 

In a previous email on July 15th we committed to returning contributions to our crowd-funding campaign, and we wanted to give you an update on where we are in this process.

During the course of the next few days, Cardboard Technologies will receive the contributed funds from Indiegogo, and will begin the refund process directly to those contributors who wish to receive a refund.

Please note that there are some procedural and regulatory issues that are country specific, so you should expect to receive a personal follow up email from us in the coming days requesting relevant details from you that will enable us to process your refund in a quick and efficient manner.

Again, we thank you for your support (and your patience).

The Cardboard Team
______________________________________________________________________


Cardboard Technologies has decided to stop our Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign.

We embarked on our crowdfunding campaign with the aim of incorporating you, our supporters, in the cardboard revolution and in helping us to raise the funds needed to build our first factory. We learned that, without a production facility in place, we were not able to provide you with a truly affordable bike within a reasonable period of time. We have therefore partnered with equity investors to build our first production facility.

We are closing our campaign, 25 days before due time. We will issue a refund to all who so generously contributed to our campaign and we hope they will continue to support us as Ambassadors and in focus groups. As a token of our appreciation, we will grant each of contributors our products, bikes or other rewards at our expense.

We listened to you, our greatest supporters, and will re-open our Indiegogo campaign once the factory is up and running and can offer lower prices and a three-month delivery time. That is the beauty of crowdfunding.

Thank you for your support! We hope we can turn to you for your help again in the future.

story:
WWW.BEABETTERMAN.ORG


We all want to get better and this is our attempt to help get us there together...


A Better Man, Inc was founded on the basic premise that people get better by learning how to help and how to be helped by others. We are a non profit organization that works not only to provide men with the tools necessary to make their lives better, but we also develop programming that engages men to become more involved members of their community. 


     Our 2014 year end goal is to obtain $10,000 to provide over 500 men with... 

               

        ...through the A Better Man Challenge 


The A Better Man Challenge is a 90 day program where certified life coaches, trained through A Better Man Inc., provide men across the United States with free online life coaching services, mental health awareness workshops, and self development webinars designed from a multicultural perspective. Upon completion of the program, men will have the opportunity to pay forward the hand they were extended and obtain certification to provide life coaching services to other men participating in the A Better Man Challenge.

  

Why A Better Man needs YOUR help 

All of our services are provided at absolutely no cost to the participants. This means that we have an entire staff of people working tirelessly to:

        

Each contribution received creates an additional opportunity for a man that you care about to benefit from these services and give back to his community. While many people have a desire to address social ills in the world today, we are providing you with a clear cut path to help make the world a better place.


The Gameplan

We have estimated this 2014 “A Better Man’s Challenge” will require $10,000 from our crowd funding efforts to achieve our goal. Our program staff and volunteers are working diligently to obtain grant funding and establish strategic partnerships to assist with taking this initiative to the next level. Below we have broken down “A Better Man’s Challenge” into 3 steps to best explain the concept:


Step 1: Project Managers are partnering with local businesses, universities, and churches to provide promotional workshops to introduce A Better Man, Inc. to the community. Each workshop will provide an opportunity for each participant to register for “A Better Man’s Challenge.” All programming will be offered at no -cost and will be available to all men ages 21 and up. We estimate that this phase will cost approximately  $2.000 to complete, which covers the manpower and cost associated with hosting each workshop. These costs include but are not limited to professional fees, marketing fees, insurance, printable materials, event space fee, speaker fees, etc. 

Step 2: Each participating member of “A Better Man’s Challenge” will be provided with the essential tools necessary to help them navigate this program. These tools include: a life coach, print and media materials to provide assistance along this Challenge, and exclusive membership benefits that include additional workshops, membership meetings, webinars and so forth. Each aspect of “A Better Man’s Challenge” will be interactive, complete with multimedia access to best reach our network of men. E-learning content will constantly be updated to ensure that participants have the most up to date material to work with. This phase is estimated to cost $4,000 to complete which will cover the creation and implementation of the resources provided, printing fees, and network development.

Phase 3: Our  services provide opportunities for development for the life coaches and the participants. A Better Man, Inc. provides ongoing training for our certified life coaches throughout the duration of their program. Additionally, “A Better Man’s Challenge” offers each participant  a bi-weekly, hour long, life coaching session with his assigned life coach. The 1-on-1 relationships offered through the life coaching aspect of “A Better Man’s Challenge” affords each participant the opportunity to have personalized support, ask questions, and the space to stratgize. Participants who complete the program will be able to receive training to become life coaches themselves. This phase is estimated to cost $4,000 to implement. This will cover certification fees, continued education costs, life coaching fees, screening fees, and operations costs.


Direct Path to Success -Every dollar counts

                               

          "COMMUNITY IS A NECESSITY, NOT AN OPTION" -Molefi Sondai-


Other ways you can help

 Can’t contribute financially, but still want to help? Here’s how!

1.  Tell somebody. Share this link with family, friends, co-workers, and social media friends.  Don't forget to use the Indiegogo sharing methods located at the top of this page!

2.  Host a workshop. Its’ easy!  Are you a member of a men’s group, church, school etc.? Team up with the event committee, programs director, or pastor in your network to host a free workshop in your city or state.

3.  Are you a certified life coach and wish to join in on this project? Contact us to see how you can become a part of this network.



Please contact us at drthomas@beabetterman.org to help out or ask questions. Thank you for your time and support we realize both are valuable!

story:
Mizzou Quidditch

Mizzou Quidditch is an official club sport at the university of Missouri. The team is three years old and is attending its first World Cup this year after qualifying at Midwest Regionals in October.

With World Cup VII in Myrtle Beach, we need help getting there. We intend to drive but the cost of gas and hotels in compliance with the IQA's Stay-and-Play Policy don't come cheaply and we can't afford it on our own.

As a group of college kids that rely almost entirely on ourselves for funding, we need your help to get to World Cup VII in Myrtle Beach so that we can compete for the highest honor in our sport.

What We Need

$3000 may sound like a lot, but there is a method to our madness when it came to calculating that goal.

The safe estimate for gas costs on this trip comes out to $1000, or around $250 per car, and that is no small chunk of change.

Then there is the IQA Stay-and-Play Policy, which requires us to book through the All About Group Travel travel agency. The cost per person for lodging is $100 and with our intent to bring a 21-person roster, that brings us to $2100 for hotels alone!

The Impact

The Mizzou Quidditch team is already one of the most recognizable Club Sports on Mizzou's campus and by attending World Cup, we only stand to increase the clubs popularity. By doing this we will get even more people on Mizzou's campus interested in playing our unique sport and getting active. 

Finally, this will give our players a rare opportunity to compete for a national title, which is something most of us only dreamed of as kids.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, make sure to share this campaign! We need all the help we can get, money or otherwise!

For shirt sizes, jersey names, numbers, and other personalization details please email your name and selected perk with details to MizzouQuidditch@gmail.com

Shipping for everything except decals is $8, decals are $2. For more than one item, add $4 per item. If you have already purchased an item, please e-mail mizzouquidditch@gmail.com for instructions on shipping. We will place orders with our suppliers when the campaign is over, and you should receive any items that require shipping in late March or early April. Thanks to everyone for contributing!

story:
I am a Yoga/ meditation and dance teacher and in November I will be travelling to Amman, Jordan to provide Yoga and dance classes, as well as a Yoga teaching training. This will offer ongoing benefits in health and wellbeing to some of the Syrian and Iraqi Refugee population in Amman. I will also be offering dance sessions with women and children.

I will be staying for a month to work with Collateral Repair Project- a local grassroots organization that provides assistance to refugees and victims of war and conflict. CRP runs an emergency assistance program, providing food and household items. They also run a community and family resource center, offer programs that focus upon building community, education, and fostering peace and reconciliation. They provide activities and learning opportunities that facilitate refugees to begin to re-build communities they lost after fleeing their home countries.

Through my own work in Ireland with different community groups, I see how Yoga and meditation can help to address issues such as PTSD, anxiety, depression, by providing simple techniques that offer relaxation, stress reduction, body/mind awareness, and can foster feelings of safety, inner strength, helping people to find inner resources to deal with difficulties they may be experiencing.

During my time in Amman, I will be offering classes for women, men, children and teens , as well as running a Yoga training program  that will enable a small group to teach basic Yoga techniques: postures, breathing, meditation  and relaxation.

Dance is a universal language- a way in which we can cross cultural borders, share a sense of connection, find physical freedom, and experience and transform emotion.. It can be a tool for well being, health and for building community. Dance can help us to be in the present moment, to let go, to enjoy our physicality.. I have seen through my work with women and girls how dance empowers and gives us a place to celebrate what we have, ourselves and each other. 

I am seeking to raise 2500 by Oct 15th. All funds raised will go directly to CRP to help with their ongoing work in Amman, and will also support my work there by paying for:

Printing costs of training materials

A local interpreter

Yoga equipment for the center

You can donate ANY amount that you want to..anything will help.

If you donate 50e or more you will receive a limited edition photograph from Jordan by photographer Alexandre Reisdorfer, who will be documenting the work for CRP.

Please help by spreading the word about this project to your friends, families and wider network.. Your support is invaluable.

Thank you.

story:
Our Story

Pack Matthews had been teaching Yoga for more than a decade when he noticed he and many of his students were losing hard won gains after returning to their desk jobs between classes. Determined to prevent a family history of debilitating arthritis from robbing him of mobility as well, Pack first moved all his office and musical equipment to the floor to keep stretching all day. Pack's first iteration of what is now the Soul Seat emerged from perching a floor-like platform on an old task chair he found discarded along Broadway Blvd in Columbia. Pack's passion for well designed tools led him through numerous subsequent designs with the help of local talent and early fans.


If you've heard the meme, “Sitting is The New Smoking” you may already be aware of the health risks associated with our sedentary way of working. We now know that we have to keep moving in ways that engage the large muscles of our pelvis throughout the day, or else we become prone to diabetes, heart disease and other chronic conditions. If the standard office chair keeps us comfortably motionless for more than 30 minutes, can it still be called ergonomic? It's easy to feel like we're in a bind. The best jobs involve lots of sitting, but too much sitting is wrecking our health. Soul Seat was designed to resolve this conflict. It works well in concert with stand-up desks and brings active sitting to any work place or home.

We're raising $9,500

The portion of funds not used to deliver the product perks (customized Soul Seats etc.) will cover travel and conference expenses for two of the Soul Seat team to bring the message of Chair Choice to  the folks who attend Ergo Expo, Dec 2-5.  Our expenses include the cost of registration, our booth, signage, shipping Soul Seats to Las Vegas, air fare and lodging for two team members.  

You no longer have to just sit there.

  • By contributing, you'll experience the satisfaction of helping to improve the health of office workers all over the world 
  • You'll get updates about our experience at Ergo Expo, and see your own chair join hundreds of others as a part of "Exhibit A" in why we all need Chair Choice.
  • We've already produced dozens of these chairs so you can be the proud owner of a very well designed chair that's proven itself in the marketplace.
  • You'll be part of growing  global movement demanding healthier choices at work by helping to provide a response to the challenge of "Sitting Disease" and "Sitting is the New Smoking".

Risks & Challenges

We know that changing culture around how we sit is a big challenge, that's why we're showing up at Ergo Expo with numbers, your numbers.

  • Many of our current customers are in the Wellness and Physical Therapy professions, so we're in good company
  • While at Ergo Expo we'll be soliciting input and feedback from these professionals about how our innovation in seating can become more accessible in the workplace, in schools, in the home.

Other Ways You Can Help

If for some reason you can't make a financial contribution at this time, you can still make an impact on the health of people at work.  Spread the news about this campaign by sharing it with your friends, co-workers and employers.

  • Please spread the word and make some noise about the need for Chair Choice.
  • Please use the awesome Indiegogo share tools!


Our video editor Felicia Rateliff shares her Soul Soul Seat Story below


"Take A Seat....." Washington Post article.

A Sept 8 Washington Post article cited a study suggesting that 5 minutes of walking each hour engages the large pelvic muscles enough to reverse the blood pooling effects of sitting.  Another study showed, "Going to the gym isn't likely to reverse the damage caused by sitting all day (one study found that six hours of sitting counteracted the positive health benefits of an hour of exercise). But several studies suggest that simply breaking up bouts of sitting with moderate exercise or movement can have a positive impact."
story_txt:
Our StoryPack Matthews had been teaching Yoga for more than a decade when he noticed he and many of his students were losing hard won gains after returning to their desk jobs between classes. Determined to prevent a family history of debilitating arthritis from robbing him of mobility as well, Pack first moved all his office and musical equipment to the floor to keep stretching all day. Pack's first iteration of what is now the Soul Seat emerged from perching a floor-like platform on an old task chair he found discarded along Broadway Blvd in Columbia. Pack's passion for well designed tools led him through numerous subsequent designs with the help of local talent and early fans.If you've heard the meme, “Sitting is The New Smoking” you may already be aware of the health risks associated with our sedentary way of working. We now know that we have to keep moving in ways that engage the large muscles of our pelvis throughout the day, or else we become prone to diabetes, heart disease and other chronic conditions. If the standard office chair keeps us comfortably motionless for more than 30 minutes, can it still be called ergonomic? It's easy to feel like we're in a bind. The best jobs involve lots of sitting, but too much sitting is wrecking our health. Soul Seat was designed to resolve this conflict. It works well in concert with stand-up desks and brings active sitting to any work place or home.   We're raising $9,500 The portion of funds not used to deliver the product perks (customized Soul Seats etc.) will cover travel and conference expenses for two of the Soul Seat team to bring the message of Chair Choice to  the folks who attend Ergo Expo, Dec 2-5.  Our expenses include the cost of registration, our booth, signage, shipping Soul Seats to Las Vegas, air fare and lodging for two team members.   
  You no longer have to just sit there.
 
By contributing, you'll experience the satisfaction of helping to improve the health of office workers all over the world 
You'll get updates about our experience at Ergo Expo, and see your own chair join hundreds of others as a part of "Exhibit A" in why we all need Chair Choice.
 We've already produced dozens of these chairs so you can be the proud owner of a very well designed chair that's proven itself in the marketplace. 
 You'll be part of growing  global movement demanding healthier choices at work by helping to provide a response to the challenge of "Sitting Disease" and "Sitting is the New Smoking".
 
  Risks & Challenges  We know that changing culture around how we sit is a big challenge, that's why we're showing up at Ergo Expo with numbers, your numbers.

Many of our current customers are in the Wellness and Physical Therapy professions, so we're in good company 
 While at Ergo Expo we'll be soliciting input and feedback from these professionals about how our innovation in seating can become more accessible in the workplace, in schools, in the home. 
 
  Other Ways You Can Help If for some reason you can't make a financial contribution at this time, you can still make an impact on the health of people at work.  Spread the news about this campaign by sharing it with your friends, co-workers and employers. 
Please spread the word and make some noise about the need for Chair Choice. Please use the awesome Indiegogo share tools!

 of sitting counteracted the positive health benefits of an hour of 
exercise). But several studies suggest that simply breaking up bouts of

story:
First of all, thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project!

About me:

A series of unfortunate events have lead me here. Some may say I am accident prone, but I think of myself as lucky. After being struck by a car while walking my dog, I discovered the magic of acupuncture. Acupuncture has given me relief both physically and emotionally. After experiencing that relief, I decided I had to study this medicine. After 10 years working as an ICU nurse I decided my life needed to take a turn, both professionally and personally. I wanted to offer my patients more relief and something that was more affordable. I also wanted to focus on not just treating physical symptoms, but getting to the root of the problem and treating the whole person. After three years of attending an intense graduate program at the Seattle Institute of Oriental Medicine I am ready to take all the skills I have learned through my nursing career, mentors, and my amazing teachers and make the journey to Nepal.

Why I chose this project:

I am excited beyond words to have this amazing opportunity to be a part of the Acupuncture Relief Project in Nepal. I have always known I would go to Nepal one day, and when I heard Andrew speak at my school about his project, I was sold. Watching the “Compassion Connects” documentary moved me to tears and I knew I wanted to be a part of this project. Nepal is one of the poorest countries in the world, with little to no healthcare. The Acupuncture Relief Project has clinics set up in rural Nepal where the greatest healthcare needs are and provides a cost-effective, sustainable service to the people. In September I will be heading to Bhimphedi, Nepal for two months to work in a primary care clinic where the underserved people of that region will trek for hours to hopefully gain some relief from their multitude of illnesses.  Some of these people will have never seen a doctor before and we will be their only shot at relief. Our team will consist of six practitioners, each from different backgrounds, treating 20 patients per day, five days a week. There are full-time interpreters that work with us and help run the clinic, along with learning the medicine so they can continue to care for the patients when we depart, which makes this project sustainable. This is one of the many reasons I was drawn to this program.

How you can help:

Hopefully you have explored the website and watched the documentary “Compassion Connects” to better understand what we will be doing in Nepal. I expect that this journey will be challenging, but also beautiful and I will learn a lot about myself as well as others in the process. Please support me in this journey and help me reach my goal by making a donation. Every little bit helps! All the donations are tax deductible and go directly towards running the clinic, supplies, and the interpreters.  We get no monetary compensation for this work. If you cannot make a donation, please keep me in your thoughts and wish me well as I embark on this journey. Thank you for your time.

"Please consider supporting our project by making a tax deductible donation. Every dollar we collect goes directly to the purchase of medical supplies and operating expenses of our field clinic." (ARP)

Every dollar allows us to provide one patient treatment.

$20 pays for an interpreter for 10 days!
$50 pays for one practitioner's clinic supplies for one week!
$100 pays all of our clinic expenses for one day!


 Stay tuned for updates on the website and check out my blog!

story:
Saturday, September 6, 2014
San Jose, CA

www.HealingJourneys.org

The Conference

The purpose of the conference is to educate, inspire, celebrate, and connect all whose lives have been touched by cancer or any life-altering illness. This includes those living with a diagnosis as well as their friends, family, support persons, and health professionals. Cancer as a Turning Point, From Surviving to Thriving™ offers resources to support medical care and help heal the whole person. The conference includes educational speakers, performers, music, humor, healing stories, and networking time – all aimed at inspiring and encouraging people to strengthen their own healing potential and their ability to thrive. For many patients, there is no "cure," but often healing is available. We strive to create an experience that makes a genuine difference in the recovery of patients and the practice of healthcare.

Who We Are

Healing Journeys is a non-profit organization whose vision is that EVERYONE  touched by cancer or any life-altering condition be empowered to move from surviving to thriving.

Healing Journeys was founded as a result of a personal cancer experience. In 1989 Jan Adrian became one of the 1.8 million women in this country diagnosed with breast cancer. Treatments recommended to Jan focused on the physical body, leaving psychological, social, and spiritual needs unmet.

Combining the needs she felt as a cancer survivor with her experience in teaching seminars, Jan designed an  award-winning conference called Cancer as a Turning Point, From Surviving to Thriving™. 

Our goal is to offer a FREE Conference on September 6, 2014, in the south San Francisco Bay Area.  As one participant at a 2012 conference commented:

  • "Incredible! Thank you for all you've done. You were largely responsible for my sister being alive today. I brought her when she was at the end of fighting and hope."  

What We Need

To create a one-day conference, we need $60,000 (it costs us $75/person).  Our goal here is to raise $10,000.  Your contributions are tax-deductible.

  • The funding we receive will completely go towards every aspect of presenting this conference.  We need to rent a facility, bring in professional speakers, medical experts, performers, support staff, offer a comfortable environment to our participants, and much more (all the details of putting on an event). 

  • 100% of your donation will go toward the production of this free conference.

The Impact

Tens of thousands of people have experienced the free Cancer as a Turning Point conference: cancer patients, survivors, caregivers, medical professionals, family and friends.

Attendees leave the conference empowered with knowledge to augment their medical program, inspired by the stories of others, uplifted by knowing they're not alone, and stirred by the power of music and laughter. Participant comments:

  • "Very eye-opening and heart-warming to experience this fabulous conference by wonderful presenters covering all aspects of the human body and spirit. I commend Jan, her board, and the volunteers for giving this FREE to those who need it but could not have afforded it!"
  • "Excellent program with a beautiful balance of heart, soul and spirit. With gratitude to all, I am physically and emotionally touched with pure healing."

Your tax-deductible contribution can make an incredible difference in the life of someone touched by cancer!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please get the word out and tell everyone about our campaign.
  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, and your other social media sites.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Be a volunteer at our next conference.
  • www.HealingJourneys.org

Thank you!


Healing Journeys Board of Directors
  • Jan Adrian, M.S.W. – Executive Director
  • Lloyd Barde
  • Carolyn Chamberlain
  • Cathleen Ferraro, M.A.
  • Fran Haynes, M.F.T
  • Susan E. Mazer, Ph.D.
  • Terri Reasoner, Ph.D. – Board Secretary
  • Lynne Singer – Board President
  • Deborah Wilder, M.A.
Healing Journeys Advisory Board
  • Ernie Bodai, M.D.
  • Jean Shinoda Bolen, M.D.
  • Joan Borysenko, Ph.D.
  • Jeremy Geffen, M.D.
  • Caryle Hirshberg
  • Lawrence LeShan, Ph.D.
  • Dawna Markova, Ph.D.
  • Wayne Muller, M.Div.
  • Rachel Naomi Remen, M.D.
  • Marty Rossman, M.D.
  • Marion Woodman

story:
The idea is to post a physical challenge to one of your friends on our Facebook page(@Challenge a Buddy-fitness page). Your friend have to complete the challenge in the time you allowed him and then post a video or a photo of his success. The motivation comes from ''peer pressure'' and encouragement from your buddies.

With the money we receive, we will be able to develop this idea (creating a website and reach more people). More over we will be able to give rewards (such as t-shirts, wristbands and even gym membership if we have a good enough sponsor).

story:
Hello, my name is Kristen and I volunteer at a non-profit organization, Dream Catcher of L.A. Their goal is to provide therapeutic riding to individuals of all ages with cognitive, physical, social and emotional disabilities. We also have a Equine Assisted Psychotherapy (EAP) program, go on location to a assisted living school for sever needs and support our veterans through our riding program. Princesa is our rock star! After pulling through a sever bought of colic and a stifle injury, she came back ready to serve and help in all of the areas we offer. 

I want to thank everyone for their donations! We have reached our goal of $500 and have been able to preform the Cushings test. Regretfully, Princesa has tested positive for Cushings (a tumor on the Pituitary Gland). Although we are upset by the test results, we are taking the necessary steps to ensuring her health and comfort. She will need to be on medication for the rest of her life, but this medication will reduce the production of cortisol from the tumor and, in return, increase her health! She will live a healthy and happy life at Dream Catcher with all the love and support from the director, Joan, the volunteers and, most importantly, our riders.

If you can find it in your hearts to help with the medication bill, we will be forever grateful! No amount is too small to help us out and ensure her health and sustained happiness.

Princesa means the world to a good amount of our riders as well as for me. She has over come so much and has reached a place where she no longer fears human contact or the touch from our hands. In less than a year I have seen this horse come out of her shell and seek attention, love and acceptance. She has found a job she enjoys and does it with strength, courage and more heart than we ever asked of her. This kind donation to her health costs will only make her days more enjoyable and encourage her to to come further and further out of any of her shell she is still hiding in.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Steven and I'm the Founder and CEO of Myo Fuel ComplX. As a professional fitness trainer for over 19 years, I've had the opportunity to train hundreds of people from all walks of life including runners, cyclists, football and tennis players, housewives, professional athletes and also general fitness enthusiasts like yourself.

All these people had one thing in common : They needed to see results!

The sport supplement business is a crazy industry with revenues to the tune of over a hundred billon dollars annually. An average consumer walking into a supplement store is surely overwhelmed with the available choices. Normally picking up 3-5 different raw supplements at a premium, you transform yourself into a scientist trying to formulate a horrible tasting product!

Let me introduce you to Myo Fuel Complx, a Stimulant Free, Non-GMO, Gluten Free and all natural product designed to increase Strength, Fuel Endurance, promote Lean Muscle Growth, reduce Body Fat and accelerate Recovery.

MCFX is not just for the typical person who is wanting to gain Lean Muscle Mass or to Burn Calories more efficiently but for individuals wanting to transform their Physique and improve their Physical Performance.


Key Ingredients of Myo Fuel ComplX

All Natural

Non-GMO, Gluten Free and all Natural Coloring and Flavoring.

Creatine Monohydrate and Creatine Hydrochloride

Creatine has been clinically proven time and again to be safe to consume, effective in building strength and lean muscle. 

Branched Chain Amino Acids; L-Leucine, L-Valine, L-Isoleucine

Three of the most critical amino acids involved in the process of protein synthesis that leads to subsequent muscle repair and growth.

Glutamine helps the muscles repair, stimulates muscle growth, and enhances the immune system. 

Beta Alanine

Helps in the muscle power output, strength, training volume, high-intensity exercise performance and peak oxygen.

Alpha Lipoic Acid has been found to be a super anti-oxidant, is used to combat the effects of aging, is highly beneficial for diabetics.

L-Arginine 

It is in the body, the Amino Acid Arginine changes into Nitric Oxide (NO). 

Nitric oxide is a powerful neurotransmitter that help blood vessels relax and also improves circulation.

Vanadyl Sulfate helps maintain blood-sugar levels by its insulin-like effects in the liver, skeletal muscles, and adipose tissue, by activating glucose transport at the cellular level.

Dextrose

It is noted to be a perfect source for restoring Glycogen stores as it has high Glycemic index and its quickly digested, which promotes quick recovery.

D-Ribose is a carbohydrate molecule found in every living organism, facilitates the production of ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate), the primary source of energy for all cellular processes.


What We Need 

MCFX is not an experimental product. It is a proven formula and has been sold locally for over 10 years. People have been using it with consistent results and we believe our product has the potential to be the No. 1 Supplement for Strength, Endurance and Recovery, if it is marketed properly.

We are a Dallas based company and the reason for starting this campaign is to get the word out and raise funds so that we can fulfill inventory orders nationwide. We have finalized our manufacturing facility and we are in talks with major retailers to place our product in their stores. 


What You Get

Every pledge you make not only brings us closer to our goal but you will receive awesome perks at a fantastic price. These perks and pricing are limited to Indiegogo users only and will not be available after this campaign ends. And you get FREE shipping too!(within the US only). Calculated shipping costs will apply for International orders.


The Impact

The best part of this is that of every container sold online through www.TheGreenPunch.com, $5 goes towards mentoring kids through Big Brothers Big Sisters (www.bbbs.org) of North Texas which I've proudly been a part of for the past 7 years. 


Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with your friends and help in spreading the word out.

The Impact

The best part of this is that of every container sold online through www.TheGreenPunch.com, $5 goes towards mentoring kids through Big Brothers Big Sisters (www.bbbs.org) of North Texas which I've proudly been a part of for the past 7 years. 





Other Ways You Can Help
Please share this campaign with your friends and help in spreading the word out.

story:
Short Summaryh

Hi,
A year ago we created HUNK WORKOUT A fitness company that trains via apps.
We here trying to raise money for Advertising Campaign,  we group of young trainers, that love what we do and want to help others get healthier, look better and fell good about themselves .  Instead of paying 80-120$ for a training session, you buy the app for 3-5$ and you got it for life! 8-30 videos of great and the right way to work out!
What We Need & What You Get

We hoping to raise $50,000.  That will allow us to publish on a fitness  magazine or billboard and online.  

You can see some of the promotion we did without money which allows us to produce the apps , but now we are looking to grow bigger and wider !

The Impact

Once people can get the right workout for such a low price, they will get it. Once they will see how good are the workouts, they will do the workouts!

Once they will do the workout, it will change their lives!!! They will look better, feel better, get healthier!!!  And who doesn't want that???!  It will make the world a better place, a happier place!!!

You can trust us!!! We know what we doing!! You can check our apps @the Appstore and decide yourself !

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can help us with money, its ok1 we will appreciate you telling your friends and people you might think can help, about us!
Thank You

story:
UPDATE: October 24, 2013

Oral surgery went well in Brooklyn, NY.  Due to the experience that Dr. Bruce Lish has with AVMs, he was able to manage my bleeding and the healing inside my mouth has gone very well.  Next procedure dates have been moved back a week and will be performed on Nov. 22nd & 25th just prior to Thanksgiving.  SO MUCH TO BE THANKFUL FOR!!!  Keep smilin'


UPDATE: September 9, 2013.

Another infection has flared up, but this time it's located inside my mouth.  My dentist, Wayne LaRiviere, referred me to an oral surgeon in Portland, ME in order to have a tooth extracted.  After he consulted with my AVM surgeon, Dr. Waner, he decided that it was not safe to extract the tooth in Maine.  Dr. Waner referred me to an oral surgeon that has experience with AVM issues, so I'm off to Brooklyn, NY next week.  Unfortunately, he is out-of-network according to my health insurance.

NEXT STEPS:

Last month, I met with Dr. Waner and am scheduled for more procedures on November 15th and 18th.  I was told in 2009 that there is no real permanent cure for my AVM, but that as it continues to evolve additional surgeries to keep it under control will be needed from time to time.  It has been 4 years since my last series of over a dozen procedures.  Unfortunately, again, the hospital that I need to go to in November is out of my insurance network, but I'm grateful that Dr. Waner's bill is covered by my insurance.  I feel that if all goes well with the November surgeries that I will be able to go many years without any more procedures needing to be done...but only time will tell.


WHY DID I DECIDE TO LAUNCH ANOTHER INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN?

For the past few years, I have set an annual goal to get out of debt.  I have not yet achieved that goal & I do not see 2013 as a realistic time frame to complete that goal.  I have now set my sights on striving to become debt-free by the end of 2014.  I keep thinking: "Enjoy the journey"...but it's not that easy at times!!!

A close friend that I met over 20 years ago suggested that I use the Indeogogo crowd funding platform to assist in paying the ongoing bills associated with my AVM surgeries.  All bills due for the many procedures that were started in 2009 have been paid except for one hospital bill.  I still owe $3,800 and continue to make small monthly payments to them as I am able.

The first Indiegogo campaign officially raised $1,202.  A donation in the amount of $1,000 was also given directly to our family, but was not given via the Indiegogo portal.  I am very grateful to all who have helped with donations and also with sharing this campaign with others!!!  Especially touching to me was a lady that donated 2 dollars.  It reminded me of the story in the New Testament of the "Widow's Mite."

I do not know how much further my family will go into debt after the dust settles once my next three procedures are completed in October & November.  Missing work so often only adds to the challenge of paying our current bills & striving to get out of debt.  Without the incredible support from family, friends, and even those who do not know me, our financial situation would be even more deplorable than it currently is.


PAST POSTS:

Over the years I have had issues with infections & spontaneous bleeding from my birthmark which has recently been properly diagnosed as an arterial-venous malformation (AVM). In 2008, my AVM got extremely aggressive and I began contemplating surgery once again. After months of research, we decided to undergo a continuing series of surgeries with a team headed by Dr. Milton Waner & Dr. Alejandro Berenstein in Manhatten, NY. I am now 55 and started having surgeries in 2009 which have been going well. My last procedure was in June of this year and I have been hesitant to set a date for the next procedures that has been recommended due to financial difficulties.

In the same year as I started having surgeries again, I closed my construction business & have struggled to meet our financial needs since. We still owe a few thousand dollars for past surgeries and I am not keen on going further into debt for additional future surgeries. Monies acquired via Indiegogo shall be used to pay for direct expenses for the procedures as well as indirect expenses such as travel, food, and other expenses.  

Feel free to call or email with any questions: 207-432-6974 or wpfa23@gmail.com.


PERSONAL HISTORY

(As it pertains to my AVM)

I was born with a birthmark on the right side of my face. When I was about 5 years old, I fell off my bike and got a fat lip that never went down. My Dad came back from Vietnam to pick me up from the orphanage in Rochester, NH and took me to a doctor who told us that nothing could be done.

My aunt & uncle took us in when I was 8 years old and we moved to Sanford, ME. The only other problem I encountered with my AVM while growing up was a growth that appeared on the roof of my mouth when I was in junior high school. This was surgically removed with no complications.

After graduating from high school, I tried to enlist in the US Air Force to become a pilot, but the doctor would not even give me a physical due to my birthmark. My brother, Mike, had enlisted in the US Marine Corps and talked with his recruiter about my situation. It took us seven months of battling for me to receive permission to enlist and finally I was off for boot camp at Parris Island, SC. After Infantry Training School at Camp Pendleton, CA, I was told that I could choose any available duty station in the world that I desired because I graduated at the top of my class. I discussed with the interviewing officer that I wanted to go to Annapolis, MD to become an officer and eventually a pilot. I was told that due to the aesthetics of my birthmark, there was a Navy regulation that would not allow me to become an officer. However, I could choose to go to San Diego for corrective surgery and if successful, I could pursue becoming a pilot.

I was diagnosed with a hemangioma and after several consultations, surgery was performed in October of 1977. It did not go well. I recall a temperature of 106.7 that finally abated after my being placed in a tub of ice water for over 24 hours. Nearly a month later, I was sent home for 30 days of convalescent leave to recuperate. When I returned to Camp Pendleton, the doctors told me that there was nothing more that they could do. I was transferred to an infantry battalion and served as a mortar-man until I won the base wrestling tournament. Next was a trip to Quantico, VA to try out for the All-Marine wrestling team. A shoulder dislocation sent me back to Camp Pendleton to my unit. After a run in the mountains, I woke up early in the morning with a staff infection in my birthmark. After a month in the hospital and another month of convalescent leave, I was sent to San Diego to await an honorable discharge under medical conditions.

Shortly after arriving back home in Maine, I experienced my first spontaneous arterial bleeding episode from my face. I went to several hospitals in Boston to see what could be done, but each of them had a vastly different approach with little past experience with my particular problem and no guarantees of success. I chose to not undergo any additional surgeries at that time. I had attained several credits while in the marines at Azusa Pacific College, so after working several different jobs, I decided to go to college full-time. Due to spontaneous bleeding episodes, I missed several classes and had to drop out of college. I got into the construction industry and eventually started my own business.


Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

You can use social media, send emails, share on your personal blog and/or website using a widget.  You may also contact a journalist or radio station about this campaign.  

Indiegogo also has various share tools for this purpose.


Feel free to call or email me with any questions: 207-432-6974 or wpfa23@gmail.com

story:
Hello, My name is Alanis, And this is my daddy in the picture with me.  I am almost 17 and my daddy has MS (mutiple sclerosis).  He has had crippling symptoms because of this for over 2 years now with more symptoms coming up every so often because he can't work and has no insurance and has been denied disability.  My daddy is the world to me and he's all I have.  I'm still in High School and still have 2 years left (this year & next).                                                                                                                                    I'm trying to raise money to pay for my dads increasing medical expenses.  My grandparents can't afford to help with these bills and I don't know what to do.  I know he hasn't told me how bad his health is but I can see it in his eyes not to mention his physical being.  I don't want to loose my daddy he's all I really have left.. If you know anyone who has MS you understand it's really hard to deal with and to get diagnosed and with his disability being held up for 10-18 months before we can get a hearing date things are really pilling up here.  

If you can help my daddy and I out with anything it will be greatly appreciated.  As I said I'm only 16 and he's all I have.  I just want to try and relieve some of the stress that's been weighing on our minds with all these bills.  I know everyone has bills and money isn't that easy to give up to someone you don't know... But I love my daddy and I'm going to do everything I can to try and help him....                                                                                                                               

What we need from everyone is help in how ever much you can contribute.  Our bills are pilling up since my mother abandoned us.  If not for my grandparents we would be homeless.  We are needing $25,000+ to pay for medical bills and medications. 

His current medications are costing in excess of $600 per month.  His last trip to the ER because he fell was in excess of $3000.

Since he doesn't have insurance he has to go to a free clinic Dr. who can only prescribe certain medications not all of them are prescribed to him through the free clinic Dr. daddy has to go to another Dr. every 3 months at $255 per office visit not counting his prescriptions. 

If our goal is reached the money that is recieved will be donated to the Christian Medical Clinic that my dad goes to for help as there are many people there that need help too...

I would like for everyone to know that even if you can't contribute any money to the fund you can still help out by using social media like Facebook or Twitter by posting or tweeting about it and sharing our story...     The Clinic that is mentioned is the free christian clinic that my daddy has to go to for treatment.. And they only operate because of donationns and volunteers so we thought it would be best to help the Clinic that helps my daddy.                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Thank you everyone                                                                                                                                                                                                          Alanis H.                                                                                                                                                                                                   P.s. I have added some perks for contributing donors..  Please understand that these are there for your contributions and are limited and will only be sent out if the goal is reached. As I stated if the goal isn't reached the money will be donated to the Christian Medical Clinic that my daddy goes to.
