I have added some perks for contributing donors..  Please understand that these are there for your contributions and are limited and will only be sent out if the goal is reached. As I stated if the goal isn't reached the money will be donated to the Christian Medical Clinic that my daddy goes to.

story:
Short Summary:

This project is a joint effort between Circle of Health International (COHI) and WATAN. COHI is a US-based non-profit organization that helps mamas and babies in some of the world's hardest places. We work with nurses, midwives, mamas themselves, locally based women's organizations, clinics, and hospitals to provide life-saving services in war and disaster settings, and within communities that have been displaced. We are midwives, doctors, nurses, trauma specialists, activists, public health professionals, and concerned members of humanity.
 
WATAN is a Syria-based organization with the mission to support Syrian society by providing services that promote its progress and development. WATAN is working to provide numerous types of aid for the people of Syria during this time of conflict, from building hospitals to employing refugee women to housing orphans.
 
According to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), there are over four million people displaced in Syria, most of them women and kids. COHI and WATAN are in Syria to help feed and protect the mamas and babies in harm's way, and we are asking for your help. 

Project description:  

COHI and WATAN want to raise funds to purchase local flour, oil, and milk for malnourished mamas, babies, and kids under six years of age affected by the conflict in Syria. 
 
We aim to raise $50,000 by the middle of August to provide thousands of mamas, kids, and babies with flour, cooking oil, and supplemental milk products. 
 
Flour prices have doubled since the conflict began, making this an item most families can no longer afford. Cooking oil, needed for parents to provide cooked meals for families, is mostly unavailable as well. Supplemental milk for babies and for older children is being requested by health professionals and mothers and hasn't been seen in markets for months.  
 
COHI plans to promote breastfeeding through the provision of flour and oil, in an effort to enable the women to be healthy enough to produce milk without risk of malnutrition. When supplemental feeding is required, COHI and WATAN intend to provide the appropriate items for successful outcomes for moms and babies, as well. 
 
COHI has served over three million women in similar settings, recently sent a life-saving Solar Suitcase to provide light to a clinic without power, and delivered 3000 diapers inside of Syria. WATAN is on the ground daily assessing and addressing the needs of the Syrian people.

The Impact: 

Inadequate availability of main staples such as flour, oil and milk has been identified as one of the main causes of malnutrition in protracted refugee settings, in a recent analysis conducted by the UNHCR jointly with the World Food Program. 
 
Infant feeding practices including: exclusive breastfeeding, the timely and appropriate introduction of complementary feeding to children around six months of age, and continued breastfeeding alongside other foods for children until two years of age and beyond are an essential part of infant and young child health. Sadly, most children inside of Syria are not receiving enough food, either through breastfeeding or due to the unavailability of supplemental milk. COHI aims to address this through the simple procurement of flour and oil for cooking and milk for moms, babies, and children to promote adequate caloric intake. 
 
Wars have a devastating impact on children's lives. The impact on women can be tremendous mentally, as well as physically. Some women may become malnourished themselves. There may be even more demands on a mother's time to get food for her family, source shelter and deal with insecurity. Her family support may be disrupted. All of these factors may undermine adequate feeding practices for moms and kids. Without protection and nutritional support for the mother who addresses all of these issues herself, the babies and kids are less likely to survive.

COHI and WATAN want to raise funds to purchase local flour, oil, and milk for malnourished mamas, babies, and kids under six years of age affected by the conflict in Syria. 
 
We aim to raise $50,000 by the middle of August to provide thousands of mamas, kids, and babies with flour, cooking oil, and supplemental milk products. 
 
Flour prices have doubled since the conflict began, making this an item most families can no longer afford. Cooking oil, needed for parents to provide cooked meals for families, is mostly unavailable as well. Supplemental milk for babies and for older children is being requested by health professionals and mothers and hasn't been seen in markets for months.  
 
COHI plans to promote breastfeeding through the provision of flour and oil, in an effort to enable the women to be healthy enough to produce milk without risk of malnutrition. When supplemental feeding is required, COHI and WATAN intend to provide the appropriate items for successful outcomes for moms and babies, as well. 
 
COHI has served over three million women in similar settings, recently sent a life-saving Solar Suitcase to provide light to a clinic without power, and delivered 3000 diapers inside of Syria. WATAN is on the ground daily assessing and addressing the needs of the Syrian people.


The Impact: 

Inadequate availability of main staples such as flour, oil and milk has been identified as one of the main causes of malnutrition in protracted refugee settings, in a recent analysis conducted by the UNHCR jointly with the World Food Program. 
 
Infant feeding practices including: exclusive breastfeeding, the timely and appropriate introduction of complementary feeding to children around six months of age, and continued breastfeeding alongside other foods for children until two years of age and beyond are an essential part of infant and young child health. Sadly, most children inside of Syria are not receiving enough food, either through breastfeeding or due to the unavailability of supplemental milk. COHI aims to address this through the simple procurement of flour and oil for cooking and milk for moms, babies, and children to promote adequate caloric intake. 
 
Wars have a devastating impact on children's lives. The impact on women can be tremendous mentally, as well as physically. Some women may become malnourished themselves. There may be even more demands on a mother's time to get food for her family, source shelter and deal with insecurity. Her family support may be disrupted. All of these factors may undermine adequate feeding practices for moms and kids. Without protection and nutritional support for the mother who addresses all of these issues herself, the babies and kids are less likely to survive.

story:
ShrinkMeApp?

The idea started in our heads- Shimrit Lev and Gitit Lahav from the north of Israel ,after few years of running a business of personal coach for healthy life all over the country and after talking with hundreds of people that fighting their weight for years we realized that most of the time the overweight person knows exactly what he should eat..the problem is that he doesn't do it..!
This  smartphone application will be mostly free download and will help the user to remember his target even when temptation calls,and will help the user to change step by step his eating habits.
This amazing application is not a simple one because we need to personalized it to each user.That's why it takes a lot of working hours of programming the software.and it takes also money..:)
We are sure that when it will be finished and translated to different languages it will help a lot of people all over the world to deal with the everyday non stopping war with their overweight.
AND YOU CAN BE PART OF THAT TOO!
Help us to complete this very special application and you will also be the influence factor of helping lots of people to deal with the disease no.1 

What We Need & What You Get

We have already started working on the Application.
We have finished few long months of characterization so we know exactly how it is going to look and how much it is going to cost.we need 28,000 $ in order to complete it (including the cost of the graphic design )
In order to encourage you people to help us in this important goal he have prepared special perks for you ..from being a VIP member of the application till having you as our guest in the holy land..:)


The Impact of ShrinkMeApp

Our project will make this world a healthier world, and you can be a part of it!

WE KNOW EXACTLY WHAT PEOPLE WITH OVERWEIGHT NEED..

He have proved that already in the last years in Israel, and if you can read Hebrew you can read the testimonies in our web site:

www.studio-yordim.co.il

And now we want to take our special technique  and make it available to all the world in a simple smartphone use. 

Obstacles? We don't even see them. We focus on success!

When you decide to build an application you have always the risk it won't be enough special,or you won't reach enough downloads..
Off course we have risks ..but we have done a lot of research and we know there is no something similar existing.
We know this is exactly what people need in order to really work on changing their way of life (we are not interesting of counting calories..its boring and ineffective).
And when you have a friendly Application that helps you reaching your dreams-you download it! 


And if you can't contribute? You can still help !


You can't contribute? That's fine. you can still help us by making some noise about our campaign..:)

(You can use the Indiegogo share tools!)

story:
I am a close friend to David Graston. He has two sons and a wonderful
wife. This is David’s third battle with cancer as well as on kidney dialysis. He
needs to beat this cancer before he can receive a new kidney. David loves his wife
and boys and is a truly amazing family man and friend. Please help me raise
money to help pay for his medical bills and costs of traveling out of state to
surgically remove his cancer in his spin. Thank you and God Bless.

story:
You can't beat death, but you can beat death in life. -Charles Bukowski

I spoke these words in a eulogy for my best friend Abe after he died in a tragic plane wreck. Brian and I desire to dedicate our lives to fighting death in the small ways that we can. The research of REDS is dedicated in honor and in memory of Abraham Pishevar II, who died in a plane crash in August 2014.

The first day of classes at Emory University, biology professor Rachelle Spell issued a challenge to all freshmen: create a faster way to detect Ebola. The passion for humanitarian work that Brian and I share fueled our desire to transform her challenge in to a reality. After all, we attend one of the few universities that treat Ebola in the United States and live a short walk from the CDC. We have access to the materials, the experts, and the literature of Emory's excellent medical research facilities. Since we found ourselves at the crossroads of the right time and the right place, we felt obligated to take action. 

As wrestlers, Brian and I took Professor Spell's challenge to heart and outside the classroom. After speaking with numerous professionals in biochemistry, we designed REDS (Rapid Ebola Detection Strips), a user-friendly kit designed to test for Ebola in a portable and inexpensive method compared with current procedures. These procedures include Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) which can run assays for small cost. However, the start-up price of the machinery costs anywhere from 10,000$ to over 100,000$. Since Ebola is most concentrated in areas of the lowest socio-economic climate, these costs are significant obstacles for detection of the virus. 

Furthermore, these machines cement the process of detection to the hospital, as they are expensive and require electricity. Many people infected with Ebola die before reaching these hospitals. Some even refuse to go since hospitals are often associated with death in Western Africa.  According to the World Health Organization (WHO), the incubation period for the Ebola virus ranges from 2 to 21 days and has a case mortality rate of up to 90%. This allows the virus to permeate and cause death over a large population. Also, the WHO highlights that outbreaks of Ebola virus disease (EVD) are concentrated mainly "in remote villages in Central and Western Africa". This kit is intended to be portable and user-friendly, allowing African families to receive EVD detection screening in the village setting. Additionally, REDS is designed to test for EVD before symptoms even occur, which would allow for the identification, separation, and treatment of the infected, thereby containing the virus.

The funds we raise go to the materials and equipment needed to run the Phase 1 trials, to create a prototype, and to optimize that prototype to the highest quality which could endure in the conditions present in Western Africa as well taking in to consideration implications including temperature, longevity, and efficiency. We desire to  get the most effective product to the field as soon as possible. Please consider donating for a more portable, affordable, and effective detection method for Ebola. 

If you can't donate, we'd love you to take part by sharing and spreading our vision for a healthier world. Join us in creating REDS!
REDS: Rapid Ebola Detection Strips

story:
What we believe...

We believe our community is in desperate need of healthy, happy children. We believe our children are in desperate need of healthy, happy lifestyles. And we believe that it is possible to get children excited about moving and running around, and in turn develop those healthy lifestyles. 

We think children have a natural tendency to want to be active and so we are setting out to create The Kid's Stampede Series, the best kids-only running event around, where we focus on creating a fun, happy environment where we help our kids find joy in being healthy and fit. 

The Kid's Stampede Series

The Kid's Stampede Series is a series of running events, exclusively for children 16 years of age and under. Each event features a 100 yard dash for toddlers, and 1 and 2 mile runs for kids between 4 and 16 years old. They will not be timed (although we will have a race clock for kids and parents to be able to see their times), and there will be no awards. Instead we want to cultivate an environment of fun, unity, and community. Exercise should always be fun, no matter how good you are at it!

Our goal is simple: Celebrate the fun of physical activity and the benefits of healthy nutrition. This is achieved not only by organizing the running races, but also by partnering with health food companies and other organizations that promote healthy living for children. Each event will include a Fun-Health Expo where kids and their families can browse their local providers of healthy foods, and learn more about how the community can help them develop those healthy lifestyles that our children so desperately need. 

So far we have three events planned:

  • November 2, 2014 - The Monster Stampede - Kiwanis Park, Tempe
  • February 28, 2015 - Superhero Stampede - Location TBD
  • August 8, 2015 - Splash Stampede - Tempe Town Lake

What we're asking for...

To organize these events in a way that will make a true impact in the lives of children throughout our community, we need help. We need to buy equipment such as pop-up canopies, a start/finish line, cones, signs, banners, and other race essentials. This equipment will allow us to put together a quality event that will attract many children and change as many lives as possible. Your contribution to this campaign will allow us to hit the ground running!

    Our challenges...

    The biggest challenge with any event is getting the word out and making sure it's well funded. Our team has extensive experience in putting on these kinds of events, but funding and getting the word our is what you can help us with. We are confident that with this campaign, we can put on an amazing event series and we hope you join us on this journey!

      Other ways to get involved...

      We are very passionate about this project and we hope you are too. We know there are many lives to change and we hope we can do our part in creating a healthier and happier community. If you'd like to get involved beyond helping us fund this project, here's how else you can help:

      • Get the word out! Tell your friends about this project and let them know we're looking for help. Also, bring your kids, your kids' friends, and their friends to the event! Tell your schools about it and tell your children's sports teams about it. The more kids come out, the better these events will be! 
      • Know an organization that might want to help? We are looking for sponsors and partnering organizations that are just as passionate about this as we are so please, if you can connect us, email Johann at johann@unleashedeventsaz.com. Thank you!
      • Volunteer! We'll be looking for volunteers as the race day gets closer! If you're interested in volunteering, email Stephanie at stephanie@racelab.com.
      Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign! We hope you are as excited about this as we are and we hope you'll come out and join us at the Monster Stampede on November 2nd, 2014 in Kiwanis Park!

Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our campaign! We hope you are as excited about this as we are and we hope you'll come out and join us at the Monster Stampede on November 2nd, 2014 in Kiwanis Park!

story:
Tap water is not pure...

You might drink bottled water for many reasons, but the most frequent reason we hear is that tap water has a chlorine scent and a funny taste.

We understand that.

...but plastic bottles are no longer a solution!

Bottled water consumption enhances the plastic waste issue worldwide and has in addition a dramatic CO2 footprint that contributes to climate change. On top of that, mineral water bottles are extremely expensive and not that convenient: carrying heavy water packs and dealing with those cumbersome empty plastic bottles has never been a pleasure for anyone!

 

We developed LaVie 2GO for all these reasons

 

LaVie 2GO is a premium tap water purifier that requires neither consumables nor maintenance

 

 

Our patented process starts with chlorine photolysis induced by a specific 365 nm led-emitted light.

When chlorine molecules undergo photolysis, they give rise to strong reactive oxygen species : ozone, free radicals, peroxide...

These are among the most powerful water decontaminating reagents and take care of chlorine byproducts, traces of medicines, pesticides and the associated smell and taste.

Certified laboratory tests are available here for download : https://www.lavie.bio/press

 

In 2018, a thousand households in 41 countries have adopted premium quality water with LaVie

We launched LaVie last year, and 1000 households are now satisfied with their tap water, turned into excellent drinking water, equal or superior to the bottled water they used to buy at the grocery store.

But you'd better read comments from our Kickstarter backers or customers at the Boulanger retailer, this is a never ending five stars love story!

LaVie 2GO is a newly designed device with the same powerful action as our previous model, but in a portable format. It consists in a 550ml borosilicate ultra-transparent glass bottle that fits in an anodized aluminum tube that houses the automated light cleaning mechanism.

 

Purer water for everyone, everywhere

 

 

The device is USB-C QC 3.0 compatible, delivered with the corresponding charger, however any QC 3.0 12V 1,5A adapter will power it.

You can use QC 3.0 car adapters, power banks, Apple usb-c chargers (at least 18w, 12V-1,5A) and soon! You can therefore use LaVie 2GO just as easily at home or at the office, hotels, at your favorite sport club, in your car... Well, anywhere!

 

6 stylish colors

The ultra-light anodized aluminum case is available in six stylish colors that will appeal to just about anyone. This is an exclusive feature, only available during this campaign !

 

Roadmap 

 

Just make sure to share it with a public post so we can verify later on

Solable is a 4-year-old "tech for good" startup, aiming to bring simple and efficient sustainable solutions to reduce our environmental footprint.

We received 3 CES awards in the last three years, all in the sustainable technologies category.

Now, our goal is to promote LaVie worldwide, and have a massive impact on the plastic bottles market with your help. This is why we are now launching LaVie 2GO, an affordable and nomad application of our core patented technology for purifying tap water. What we offer is a long lasting device, that requires neither maintenance nor consumables.

 

About 2 billion people in the world survive without safe drinking water.

Last year, we promised to deliver free LaVie SUN systems in a developing country as a one backer/one gift deal, and you will get the opportunity to witness the operation during this new campaign.

This year, we decided to use 1% of the campaign's contributions to bring LaVie SUN to developing countries.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

We have a detailed storytelling about how we want to reduce human footprint on the environment, way too long to tell here. Be sure that we want to grow and make our sustainable water and energy solutions available to everyone. The skill set in our team ranges from industry, materials and electronics to biology and we have solid patented technologies up our sleeve.

We want our new backers to be as satisfied as the Kickstarter community, continue our five-stars rating story, and grow the LaVie community to support our eco-minded initiatives worldwide !

There is virtually no risk apart from potential delays in delivery, and our backers will receive their water purification system as always! This year we have even improved our timing by ordering parts way ahead of launch.

story:
Знакомьтесь - Южнея Горелик. Почти 50 лет, хотя и не скажешь.  Фридайвер, Мастер Спорта , Чемпионка России 2017 - 2018г, Рекордсменка России (CMAS). Способна долго задерживать дыхание.

6 лет назад телевизионный оператор Южнея случайно оказалась на тренировке по фридайвингу. «Я нырнула и очутилась в полной тишине и спокойствии. Это было что-то удивительное. Абсолютная расслабленность и покой. И теперь, все мои тренировки направлены, чтобы снова ощутить это состояние …» Так фридайвинг вошел в жизнь Южнеи. Продолжая получать удовольствие от тренировок, она незаметно для себя развила способность подолгу задерживать дыхание. Начала еще одну карьеру – спортивную. И вошла в число сильнейших женщин-фридайверов России. Ее личный рекорд в дисциплине «Статическое апноэ 6 минут 59 секунд. Он же – Рекорд России (CMAS).

Сейчас Южнея готовится к Чемпионату Европы по фридайвингу (CMAS), который пройдет 17-23 июня в Турции. Это  - важный старт для нее самой, ее тренера и команды России. Со слов Южнеи: «Подготовка к Чемпионату Европы меня многому научила. Но самое главное – выступить «в боевых условиях» и показать, все что могу. А могу я многое и я полностью готова!»

Но возник финансовый вопрос (часто у нас это бывает). Тренировки, отборочные соревнования поглотили уже немалую часть средств и отнимали время от работы. Билеты куплены, но нужны деньги на оплату проживания и стартового взноса. И вот с этим проблема…Спонсоров, к сожалению, не нашли, поэтому ищем возможности для участия на Чемпионате Европы самостоятельно.

СКОЛЬКО НЕОБХОДИМО
700 евро - оплата проживания и стартового взноса участия в Чемпионате Европы по фридайвингу.

Надеемся на  помощь друзей, фридайверов и просто тех, кто любит  спорт в России.  Если у вас нет возможности поддержать кампанию Южнеи финансово, то вы можете помочь даже просто поделившись ссылкой на эту страницу в социальных сетях! Спасибо вам всем!

КОНТАКТЫ
почта yuzhneika@yandex.ru
facebook https://www.facebook.com/yuzhneika
viber +79857531229
whatsapp +79857531229
story_txt: Знакомьтесь - Южнея Горелик. Почти 50 лет, хотя и не скажешь.  Фридайвер, Мастер Спорта , Чемпионка России 2017 - 2018г, Рекордсменка России (CMAS). Способна долго задерживать дыхание.6 лет назад телевизионный оператор Южнея случайно оказалась на тренировке по фридайвингу. «Я нырнула и очутилась в полной тишине и спокойствии. Это было что-то удивительное. Абсолютная расслабленность и покой. И теперь, все мои тренировки направлены, чтобы снова ощутить это состояние …» Так фридайвинг вошел в жизнь Южнеи. Продолжая получать удовольствие от тренировок, она незаметно для себя развила способность подолгу задерживать дыхание. Начала еще одну карьеру – спортивную. И вошла в число сильнейших женщин-фридайверов России. Ее личный рекорд в дисциплине «Статическое апноэ 6 минут 59 секунд. Он же – Рекорд России (CMAS).Сейчас Южнея готовится к Чемпионату Европы по фридайвингу (CMAS), который пройдет 17-23 июня в Турции. Это  - важный старт для нее самой, ее тренера и команды России. Со слов Южнеи: «Подготовка к Чемпионату Европы меня многому научила. Но самое главное – выступить «в боевых условиях» и показать, все что могу. А могу я многое и я полностью готова!»Но возник финансовый вопрос (часто у нас это бывает). Тренировки, отборочные соревнования поглотили уже немалую часть средств и отнимали время от работы. Билеты куплены, но нужны деньги на оплату проживания и стартового взноса. И вот с этим проблема…Спонсоров, к сожалению, не нашли, поэтому ищем возможности для участия на Чемпионате Европы самостоятельно.СКОЛЬКО НЕОБХОДИМО700 евро - оплата проживания и стартового взноса участия в Чемпионате Европы по фридайвингу.Надеемся на  помощь друзей, фридайверов и просто тех, кто любит  спорт в России.  Если у вас нет возможности поддержать кампанию Южнеи финансово, то вы можете помочь даже просто поделившись ссылкой на эту страницу в социальных сетях! story:
Life can be unpredictable and squeezing in a workout can be challenging. Whether you're on the road for work, wrangling kiddos all day or you simply dread the crowded gym. That's where we come in!

 

 

 
 
 

 

Our Pilates specific workouts target your flexibility, muscular strength, and endurance while emphasizing postural alignment, muscle balance, and core strength at a low impact.

 

 

Use the weighted handles and resistance bands to help tone by doing traditional exercises you would see at the gym: curls, extensions, pulling and pushing motions. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Many of our workouts focus on elongating, strengthening, improving muscle elasticity and joint mobility. 

The 2lb handle weights give you a deeper, guided movement. Removing the weights gives a gentler stretch.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Flobody Mini - BPA free, BPS free and Phthalate free.

  • Biodegradable
  • 10 oz
  • Removable rope and pearls.

Color Options: Pebble Gray | Mint | Light Pink

 

SWEAT TOWEL

 

 

Drip + Grip - Premium quality | Absorbent and quick drying | 16" x 26"

 

TRAVEL BAG

 

 

Flobody Travel Bag - Premium canvas material Durable | Sleek Customized to handle the Flobody Gym's weight. Front pouch for your training accessories and a bonus cell phone compartment. Color: Heather Gray

 

CLEANING SPRAY

 

 

Mat + Props - Organic cleaning solution for all of your Flobody equipment. Formulated to keep everything clean and smelling fresh.

  • Compact for travel
  • Lavender 
  • 4 oz.

 

FLOBODY TEAM

 

Two years ago, we introduced the Yoga Flexer on Kickstarter. Thanks to the crowdfunding community, our dream has become a reality! 

We started with one purpose, to help busy people get fit from anywhere, at any time. This is still our goal but now with the new and improved Flobody Gym!

 

Find us on social:

 

Flobody on Instagram

Flobody on Facebook

Workouts on Youtube

Flobody.com

 

RETURN POLICY

We offer a 30-day, no-risk return policy. If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality of the product within 30 days of receiving your order, simply send it back and we will refund you, no questions asked. The return policy will begin after we deliver your Flobody bundle.  

INFORMATION

Inevitably, there will be some bumps in the road but through hard work, preparation, and supportive backers, like you, this product will be delivered as promised. We already have the tooling and molding covered. That will save us a ton of time (roughly 45 days of production time).

In the event that something slows down the process (order volume) or quality control delays, we promise to always stay in touch. There are always things such as crowded ports and bad weather that can come up and make things take slightly longer than any of us would like. We will always respond to any backers that may have questions regarding the Flobody Gym and the shipping process. So don't hesitate to reach out!

story:
The future of wearable hydration is here. Wetsleeve is a patented lightweight, breathable soft sleeve worn on the forearm with a refillable hydration reservoir.

Wetsleeve allows you to focus and push forward without breaking your athletic rhythm. Designed for anybody with an active lifestyle, Wetsleeve is hydration in motion.

Zippered pocket securely holds the reservoir, and provides easy access for refills.

Adjustable wraparound band gives you the perfect fit at all times.

Also features two pockets to keep personal belongings safe on-the-go.

Made of premium, water resistant materials. Built-in insulation layer reflects heat away from the body, while keeping contents cool. For an extra cold drink, add ice to the reservoir or place it in the fridge before use.

 

Wetsleeve’s detachable hydration reservoir is durable, leak proof and made of FDA-approved food grade materials. With a volume capacity of 12 oz (350ml), it can be easily filled with water or your favorite sports drink. The replaceable silicone mouthpiece situated towards the wrist allows you to effortlessly drink from a natural position. The zip seal flap and roll-top opening allows for quick and easy refills and ensures no leakage.

 

A built-in spine ensures the reservoir maintains its shape and keeps the liquid distributed across the forearm at all times- even during the most rigorous activities. After each sip, the reservoir continuously compresses to prevent the liquid from sloshing around during use.

 

 

Wherever you go, Wetsleeve goes with you.

Even if you already have a hydration solution or just go running with a water bottle, we can't wait for you to try Wetsleeve and see how it changes your routine. It's lightweight, fits perfectly on your arm and it's the most convenient way to hydrate on-the-go.

 

 

Fit the sleeve onto your forearm and secure it into place with the adjustable wraparound velcro strap. That’s it! Now, you’re free to move without having to wear a bulky backpack, hold a bottle or stop your activity to hydrate.

 

 

 

 

The concept for Wetsleeve was born out of necessity. As passionate athletes, we are always challenging ourselves and trying to find ways to improve — whether it be through method or gear. We knew that hydration is the key to maintaining endurance while training, but couldn't find anything on the market that gave us what we needed: a seamless, convenient source of hydration that was hands-free and didn't weigh us down. That's when we got to work creating our own solution.

On a mission to create something that has never before existed, we teamed up with one of the best design firms in the world. Working with Development Never Stops LLC (DNS), a top athleticwear design firm based in Zurich with 16 international industry design awards, we’ve spent the last two years living and breathing hands-free hydration to find the perfect balance of capacity, utility and comfort. In doing so, we went through countless design iterations, meticulously chose every piece of fabric, rigorously tested each prototype with many athletes across a multitude of sports/activities under the most extreme conditions.

Our US-based hydration reservoir partner, TSI Manufacturing LLC, has been supplying customized hydration solutions for some of the top global sports wear companies for the last 32 years. We’ve worked with them on a daily basis to ensure we got the best customized hydration reservoir possible.

Wetsleeve also maintains an active worldwide intellectual property portfolio and our patents in the U.S. and international countries protect our products.

Through the many hours of research, drawing, designing and testing, our team has shared one belief: that the existing hydration systems are impractical, outdated and do not support optimal performance for all sports. In short, the industry was due for a massive upgrade. And in designing the best possible alternative for ourselves, we ended up designing the best hands-free hydration solution on the market.

 

 

The final version of Wetsleeve is exactly the kind of product we dreamed of when we started this journey. The perfect hydration solution that never lets you down, whatever the adventure, mission, or journey. We created it, we wear it, and we love it – and now, we can’t wait for you to try it. So come and join the hydration revolution! We can’t wait to have you on board!

Customs & Duty Policy: rewards do not include VAT or other country taxes, meaning you’d be responsible for them if applicable by your country’s import laws. They vary from destination to destination, might be subject to change, or might not be applicable at all. Finally, please note that we cannot mark any parcels as gifts.

 

 

Thank you for checking us out! We hope we can have you on board soon. If you have any questions, just leave a comment or send us an email at hello@wetsleeve.com. Thank you!

story:
Club Empowerment

We are here to make a massive impact in our community!

Our mission is to empower the Downriver Community to have a happy, healthy, active, fit life!

Thanks to our FUN, SIMPLE, MAGICAL philosophy, we are able to touch lives at ALL fitness levels and at ALL ages.

We are proud to say we accept and include ALL people within our community... and with your help, soon ALL under one roof.

Let's lock arms and give back to our community by creating a space where everyone feels Empowered to live the happy, healthy, active, fit life they deserve!

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently in the process of opening our new home. While we love doing what we do outdoors, we need a space for when the weather isn't on our side.

What we need:

  • $4,000 - Security Deposit & Move In Expenses
  • $4,500 - Equipment and Supplies for Classes
  • $2,000 - Sound System For Classes
What you get!:
  • An amazing group of people to support you in your goals
  • A Health Coach to support you one on one
  • To be a part of something that is impacting our community in a positive way
  • Awesome Fitness Classes throughout the week
FitClub - a group of people who get together to workout using body weight movements to increase strength in your Upper & Lower Body as well as your core! This is by far the most encouraging group you could be in.
Cardio Drumming - this is for those of you who LOVE to have fun and shake your groove thang! Dancing and drumming on a stability ball with great music is sure to cause some sweat and improve your cardiovascular system!
  • Informative Educational Classes throughout the month
Wellness Workshop - I love knowing what I need to do to get the best results possible. We cover a wide range of topics all geared around Nutrition, Fitness, and Mindset.

The Impact

The Impact is endless!!

  • You Get Your Life Back!
  • You Have More Energy!
  • You Lose Weight!
  • You Feel Amazing About Yourself!
  • You Finally Feel Like you Belong To  Something Great!
  • You Belong To An Amazing Community Where You Make Friends And Support Each other!


Other Ways You Can Help

Please Help!

  • Come and Join Our Group at Bishop Park in Wyandotte!
  • Join Our Group on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/clubempowerment/
  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Please use the share tools on this page!

story:
Wynd's campaign has moved to Indiegogo Marketplace! Click here to get Wynd. 

 

Wynd creates a bubble of clean air around you by removing dust, allergens, smoke, and pollution from your personal space. Since it filters harmful particles out of the air around you, Wynd helps you breathe clean air and feel refreshed.

Wynd isn’t just an air purifier—it’s an intelligent personal air quality system. It monitors your environment and cleans as needed. Wynd is the size of a water bottle, so it’s easy to use anywhere—in offices, hotels, cars, public transportation, and more. Wynd helps you breathe easy wherever you go.

 

 

 

Freshen up your car: Wynd can clean over 70% of particles in a typical car cabin in under 10 minutes. Wynd fits in standard cupholders.

 

 

 

 

 

Wynd weighs less than a pound, so it goes where you go.



Wynd’s size makes it easy to travel with, and it’s a must-have for those going to polluted areas.



No need to keep Wynd plugged in: It lasts for 8 hours of typical use without having to charge it.

 

 

Wynd keeps your personal space free from particulates, including allergens, germs, and industrial pollution (PM2.5).

Wynd cleans these particles out quickly. Despite its small form factor, Wynd can deliver over 8 liters of clean air per second.



You don't need to wait to breathe fresh air. Wynd can instantly funnel clean air towards you.

 

 

 

Wynd is more than one device: It's an air quality tracker and purifier in one— and the tracker can actually detach for ultimate mobility.



Know your air quality at all times. The Wynd Air Quality Tracker continuously monitors your environment and alerts you when it becomes unhealthy. The tracker senses for the level of particulate pollution, from sources such as allergens, tobacco smoke, bacteria, mold spores, and smog.

 

The tracker detaches from the purifier and can clip onto things.

 

It's the smallest particulate sensor on the market, so you can easily take it with you.


 

Check the air quality at a glance: The tracker's light color shows you how healthy the air is.

 

 

Auto mode

We don't just tell you the air quality: We proactively take care of the problem. With Auto mode, Wynd can automatically adjust its purification level to maintain a clean environment.

Learn more about what you're breathing

Open the Wynd app (for iOS and Android) to get more insights into your environment.

Get notified when the air quality around you is getting worse.



Track how your environment changes over time.

Wynd tells you how much pollution it's kept out of your lungs. By tracking air quality, airflow level, and usage duration, we can determine how many milligrams of particulate matter Wynd has cleaned from the air.

Got friends in L.A., a grandma in Beijing, or a child you want to keep safe? Keep tabs on your loved ones' air quality.

 

Check out macro air quality levels with Air Bubbles, our free companion iOS app.

 

As our community grows, we can even combine everyone’s tracker data to create a worldwide crowdsourced air quality map—the Waze of air quality. This would open the doors to hyper-local air quality info that could help people around the globe stay healthy.

 

 

 
Wynd was designed to fit in anywhere.



Wynd includes a dynamic 360-degree LED light ring that indicates air quality, airflow, battery level, and filter use.



We don’t believe in just having low, medium, and high settings: Wynd enables you to gradually adjust its purification level from 0 to 100—to find the setting that’s most comfortable for you—by turning the top knob left or right.



 

 

 

 

 

Airflow design

Our engineering lead, Eric, is an aerospace engineer who worked on the design of jet and rocket turbine blades before joining Wynd. He used his airflow expertise to craft Wynd’s patent-pending fluid dynamics.

We designed a low-turbulence, high-airflow system that keeps Wynd small while enabling it to clean a high volume of air and stay quiet.

Watch Eric discuss how he designed some of Wynd's airflow features:


 

The filter

Wynd contains a medical-grade air filter, capable of purifying particles as small as 0.3um (1 / 210th the average thickness of human hair).

The filter is lined with an antimicrobial layer lined with silver to keep it clean from microbes such as bacteria and mold. As air passes through this filter, the particulate pollutants are removed and any residual germs are killed off, and purified air flows out into your environment.

 

 

The filter typically lasts for 3 months in a polluted environment (with an average AQI of 200). In a less polluted environment, it lasts between 3 months and 1 year.

But don't worry about having to calculate it—we do it for you.

Replacing filters is automated: By tracking how polluted the air is around the filter—as well as Wynd’s airflow level and usage duration—we can tell you how used up the filter is and alert you when it’s time to order a replacement.



You can even subscribe to automated filter shipments: We’ll send a new filter to your door whenever it’s time for a replacement, so you don’t have to think about it.



Replacing the filter is way easier than on cars or house filters: With Wynd, just pop the old one out and pop the new one in.

Wynd's replacement filters will be $7 each.
 

Smallest particulate sensor on the market

The Wynd sensor—officially named the Wynd Air Quality Tracker—is highly accurate. It’s comparable to much more expensive (and larger) sensors. And, many of those large and expensive sensors stop working over time because grime and pollutants throw off their mechanisms. To avoid this, we engineered the tracker to remain highly accurate over time through dynamic calibration and an internal design that protects sensitive components from accumulating dust.

Our prototype trackers have a very high correlation (0.99) with high-end, professional air quality sensors such as the TSI DustTrak (which sells for around $5,000 and is the size of a handheld vacuum cleaner). The chart below shows a test we conducted of the Wynd Air Quality Tracker prototype vs. the TSI DustTrak II, and yields a correlation of 0.99 (the highest is 1.00):

Recharges quickly

 

Wynd uses the new (and soon-to-be widely adopted) USB Type-C cable, which enables the device to fully recharge in 4 hours.

 

Lab-tested

Although we built Wynd to purify the air in your personal space, we decided to see how well it could clean a small room. So we had it tested in a 640-cubic-foot chamber (comparable to an 8x10ft room) by Research Technical Institute, a leading national research institute and filtration testing laboratory. 

Check out the difference Wynd made:
story_txt:
Wynd's campaign has moved to Indiegogo Marketplace! Click here to get Wynd.  Wynd creates a bubble of clean air around you by removing dust, allergens, smoke, and pollution from your personal space. Since it filters harmful particles out of the air around you, Wynd helps you breathe clean air and feel refreshed.Wynd isn’t just an air purifier—it’s an intelligent personal air quality system. It monitors your environment and cleans as needed. Wynd is the size of a water bottle, so it’s easy to use anywhere—in offices, hotels, cars, public transportation, and more. Wynd helps you breathe easy wherever you go.   Freshen up your car: Wynd can clean over 70% of particles in a typical car cabin in under 10 minutes. Wynd fits in standard cupholders. 
Keep your baby safe on the go with the Wynd Stroller Holder. In a semi-enclosed stroller, Wynd can reduce PM2.5 (fine particles) by over 50% and PM10 (coarse particles) by over 70%.
  

"You can't see what's in the air that you breathe. But the sensor attached to the Wynd air purifier can figure that out for you, and actually do something to clean up that air before it hits your lungs." - Tom's Guide"Instead of being tied to one particular room or area, Wynd can adapt to different environment. This allows a range of possibilities for use." - PSFK"Most startups just want to reinforce your phone case or maybe make your speakers a bit more portable. And then there are the ones that have the weight of the world on their shoulders" - TechCrunch
  Wynd weighs less than a pound, so it goes where you go.Wynd’s size makes it easy to travel with, and it’s a must-have for those going to polluted areas.No need to keep Wynd plugged in: It lasts for 8 hours of typical use without having to charge it.  Wynd keeps your personal space free from particulates, including allergens, germs, and industrial pollution (PM2.5).Wynd cleans these particles out quickly. Despite its small form factor, Wynd can deliver over 8 liters of clean air per second.You don't need to wait to breathe fresh air. Wynd can instantly funnel clean air towards you.   Wynd is more than one device: It's an air quality tracker and purifier in one— and the tracker can actually detach for ultimate mobility.Know your air quality at all times. The Wynd Air Quality Tracker continuously monitors your environment and alerts you when it becomes unhealthy. The tracker senses for the level of particulate pollution, from sources such as allergens, tobacco smoke, bacteria, mold spores, and smog. The tracker detaches from the purifier and can clip onto things. It's the smallest particulate sensor on the market, so you can easily take it with you. Check the air quality at a glance: The tracker's light color shows you how healthy the air is.  Auto modeWe don't just tell you the air quality: We proactively take care of the problem. With Auto mode, Wynd can automatically adjust its purification level to maintain a clean environment.
Just sit back, relax, and know that Wynd is keeping your air healthy. 
Learn more about what you're breathingOpen the Wynd app (for iOS and Android) to get more insights into your environment.Get notified when the air quality around you is getting worse.Track how your environment changes over time.Wynd tells you how much pollution it's kept out of your lungs. By tracking air quality, airflow level, and usage duration, we can determine how many milligrams of particulate matter Wynd has cleaned from the air.Got friends in L.A., a grandma in Beijing, or a child you want to keep safe? Keep tabs on your loved ones' air quality. Check out macro air quality levels with Air Bubbles, our free companion iOS app. As our community grows, we can even combine everyone’s tracker data to create a worldwide crowdsourced air quality map—the Waze of air quality. This would open the doors to hyper-local air quality info that could help people around the globe stay healthy.    
 We worked with Mike Nuttall, one of the co-founders of IDEO, to bring Wynd to life. He designed numerous beautiful and successful consumer electronic products, so we knew he’d help us create a product that’s beautiful and easy to use.Watch Mike discuss his philosophy behind the design of Wynd: 
 
Wynd was designed to fit in anywhere.Wynd includes a dynamic 360-degree LED light ring that indicates air quality, airflow, battery level, and filter use.We don’t believe in just having low, medium, and high settings: Wynd enables you to gradually adjust its purification level from 0 to 100—to find the setting that’s most comfortable for you—by turning the top knob left or right.

 Early sketches of Wynd's filter form factor 
 The evolution of early Wynd prototypes
 
 
CADing Wynd  
 

 Wireframing the Wynd app
  Airflow designOur engineering lead, Eric, is an aerospace engineer who worked on the design of jet and rocket turbine blades before joining Wynd. He used his airflow expertise to craft Wynd’s patent-pending fluid dynamics.We designed a low-turbulence, high-airflow system that keeps Wynd small while enabling it to clean a high volume of air and stay quiet.Watch Eric discuss how he designed some of Wynd's airflow features:    Early iterations of Wynd's fluid dynamics   
 
3D-printed iterations of Wynd's airflow system components 
 
The filterWynd contains a medical-grade air filter, capable of purifying particles as small as 0.3um (1 / 210th the average thickness of human hair).The filter is lined with an antimicrobial layer lined with silver to keep it clean from microbes such as bacteria and mold. As air passes through this filter, the particulate pollutants are removed and any residual germs are killed off, and purified air flows out into your environment.  The filter typically lasts for 3 months in a polluted environment (with an average AQI of 200). In a less polluted environment, it lasts between 3 months and 1 year.But don't worry about having to calculate it—we do it for you.Replacing filters is automated: By tracking how polluted the air is around the filter—as well as Wynd’s airflow level and usage duration—we can tell you how used up the filter is and alert you when it’s time to order a replacement.You can even subscribe to automated filter shipments: We’ll send a new filter to your door whenever it’s time for a replacement, so you don’t have to think about it.Replacing the filter is way easier than on cars or house filters: With Wynd, just pop the old one out and pop the new one in.Wynd's replacement filters will be $7 each. Smallest particulate sensor on the market
We spent 18 months developing our own patent-pending, particulate matter (PM) sensor because everything on the market was too big—and too inaccurate.We created the smallest commercial PM sensor in the world.
The Wynd sensor—officially named the Wynd Air Quality Tracker—is highly accurate. It’s comparable to much more expensive (and larger) sensors. And, many of those large and expensive sensors stop working over time because grime and pollutants throw off their mechanisms. To avoid this, we engineered the tracker to remain highly accurate over time through dynamic calibration and an internal design that protects sensitive components from accumulating dust.Our prototype trackers have a very high correlation (0.99) with high-end, professional air quality sensors such as the TSI DustTrak (which sells for around $5,000 and is the size of a handheld vacuum cleaner). The chart below shows a test we conducted of the Wynd Air Quality Tracker prototype vs. the TSI DustTrak II, and yields a correlation of 0.99 (the highest is 1.00):Recharges quickly Wynd uses the new (and soon-to-be widely adopted) USB Type-C cable, which enables the device to fully recharge in 4 hours. Lab-testedAlthough we built Wynd to purify the air in your personal space, we decided to see how well it could clean a small room. So we had it tested in a 640-cubic-foot chamber (comparable to an 8x10ft room) by Research Technical Institute, a leading national research institute and filtration testing laboratory. Check out the difference Wynd made: 
We’re happy to give Wynd to your friends and family. If you would like to give Wynd as a gift, you can provide us with an alternate shipping address after purchasing an Indiegogo perk.  
   
 
 
   
  
We created Wynd out of a need to create clean environments for ourselves and our families wherever we go.Ray (the founder) frequently traveled to Asia, where poor air quality is a well-known problem. He hated the way pollution made him feel, and wanted to be able to take healthy air with him on the go. An engineering major at MIT, he decided to take action—he brought together a team that included other MIT engineers, seasoned designers, and even a former rocket scientist to build such a device.Air quality affects people all over the world and comes in different forms. Allergens, germs, and smog decrease quality of life and lead to long-term health issues. As we developed Wynd, we met people from all walks of life who wanted to breathe healthier air. Over 40 prototypes were distributed to people from the U.S. to China to Israel and Nepal. Testers used them to clear their allergies in San Francisco, keep themselves and their families (and even babies) safe from air pollution in Beijing, and filter out mold spores from hotel rooms in Southeast Asia.After 20 months of work we’re excited to bring you Wynd. We hope it will have a positive impact on your life.For more about our story please read Ray's blog post here.

story:
Faith. Integrity. Resilience. These are the qualities that make an athlete. I know because I was one out of the sixteen-thousand athletes who reach the level of Division I college athletics. I began swimming competitively when I was nine. After a decade of devotion and having been scouted by numerous colleges I chose to attend Rutgers University on athletic scholarship.

My life as I knew it was swimming.  On average I trained about 25-30 hours per week. I sacrificed any semblance of “normal” social life in order to pursue my passion. I had faith in myself. Faith that allowed me to challenge myself. Faith that pushed me to strive for perfection. Faith that I would someday get an Olympic Trial cut time. My body was my machine. My identity was an athlete.

My life changed during a practice in 2007. I injured my spine during a lift. I herniated two discs that have now unfortunately collapsed. Though I continuously tried to push myself to swim through the pain, it simply was not good enough; I was judged harshly for having to modify my practices by the people who were supposed to be supporting me. Ultimately, I was forced to make the decision to red-shirt my fifth year at Rutgers. Devastated and wounded, I knew I never reached my full potential. I didn’t know who I was anymore.

Eventually turning to another passion of mine, photography and video (my major in college), I tried to move on. I became dedicated to mastering the art of capturing subjects, however, I knew something was missing. I had really amazing internships and opportunities and somehow ended up being surrounded by extremely skilled, intelligent, and even famous people in the entertainment industry.  Even with the amount of fun I was having, my career path still always felt like I was trying to fit a square peg into a round hole. Something wasn't right. I knew photography/videography was something I could do well, but I realize now that what was missing was integrity. Without integrity no craft can be mastered. My integrity was still tied into athletics.

Even today I am in a great deal of pain. Doctors are still in the process of determining if, in addition to my collapsed discs, my thoracic spine is also herniated. My injury has altered my life in ways unimaginable. I have seen countless doctors, physical therapists, and chiropractors to help me with the pain. I have turned down endless offers for prescription pain killers in my refusal to become a zombie. I get routine trigger point injections in my neck, which temporarily lessen the aching, cramping, and gnawing pain that I have come to know so well. However, throughout endless MRI’s, X-rays, bone scans, nightmarish sessions in physical therapy, and needles being sunk into my spine, I have remained resilient and optimistic.     

A recently began coaching swimming. This is what led me to my current realization, or as Oprah would say, my “Ah-Ha moment”. We were all given special talents that are unique solely to us, so therefore, each of us must have a purpose. Although I may have many talents, my purpose is in athletics. My purpose is to inspire through my resilience. My resilience and drive will help others to overcome their physical struggles. I need to use my personal experience, drive, and proven resilience in order to help other athletes create and conquer their own battles.  

I love motivating the kids I coach- pushing them hard enough physically and mentally to do things they never thought they could, both in and out of the water.  I am driven to learn as much as I can about fitness, strength, and nutrition.  It is natural for me to write workouts for others because I myself have been trained with and been trained by some of the best athletes, trainers, nutrition experts and coaches in the country.  I have begun to personally train close friends and family members for free as practice for myself. I recognize that my love for personal training is just as strong as my love for coaching.  

I need to raise money in order take my personal trainer exam. I have already studied and I know the material. The only thing holding me back is the funding. The $600 dollars I am trying to raise will go directly to the Premium ACE Personal Training Certification Bundle ($599.00).  With the Premium bundle I will get the ACE Academy Elite (video lecture series, custom progress tracking, two practice tests, exam review and access to the ACE Resource Center) as well the Exam Voucher, Flashcards, a (new) Personal Trainer Manual) and an Essentials of Exercise Science Manual. If my goal of $600 dollars is not met, every penny raised will still go to funding my exam and I will creatively find a way to raise the remainder of the money needed.

I have this burning desire to pursue my passion and my dream. I am asking for your faith so that I may give you my integrity and prove to you my resilience. Thank you for listening to my story. 

 

Sincerely,

Kara Battistoni

story:
Adelyne Rose ("Addy") was born February 9, 2012, into a family of six women - mommy's, Gigi and Kelly and sisters, Alison Elizabeth Rose, McKenna Rose, Baylie Rose and Peyton Rose.

Despite being a healthy and happy eight month old baby, on November 3, 2012 her parents were met with the horror of finding little Addy unresponsive in her crib. She was immediately rushed to the hospital and is currently in ICU fighting for her life.

Addy's parents are keeping vigil at her bedside and are going to be unable to work for quite some time because of this tragedy. They also have four other daughters to take care of. Any donations made will go directly to the family to assist them with day to day expenses that will allow them to maintain their vigil at Addy's bedside, while caring for their four other precious daughters.

story:
This is my brother-in-law, Charlie (a.k.a. Chuck) Laskar.  Charlie is too humble to ask for help himself so I’m doing it for him.

Charlie is a life-long resident of Albuquerque, NM who has struggled with Type I diabetes all his life. He has lost the vision in one eye and partially in the other.  Now his kidneys are failing.  Last year he scraped enough together by having yard sales and with the help of friends and family to make a trip to the Mayo Clinic to be tested for transplant eligibility. Charlie qualified to be placed on the donor wait list for both a kidney and a pancreas.  However, they told him it could take 4 to 6 years and would require annual testing. 

It’s now time to make a return trip to the Mayo Clinic for another round of testing to remain eligible. He needs your help.  I know times are tough in today’s economy, but anything you can do will help.  Even sharing this campaign and getting the word out will help tremendously.  All funds received will go toward covering the costs of transportation, lodging, and meals.

Another way you can help is to visit and share his website: http://miracleofhealth.com/chucklaskar. He’ll receive a small commission for any purchase made.

Thank you and god bless you.

story:
Savannah's Story


When we received a letter from Savannah Hunter's parents we knew she needed a jump start on her weight loss journey. At just over 5 feet tall, Savannah weighs over 225 lbs and suffers as the target of her 7th grade classmates' cruelty. Savannah is an artist, girl scout and avid volunteer, who has recently started to teach art to autistic children. Loving, kind and sweet, Savannah doesn't recognize her own self-worth. Other people's opinions matter to hear, especially concerning her weight. 


Her Family's Struggle


Savannah is the youngest of three older brothers. Her parents struggle financially just to benefit from the top schools in a well-to-do area, which Savannah requires because of her educational special needs. Savannah's parents are suffering not only from the financial weight of living expenses, but one of their sons has heart complications and his surgeries have capped the insurance out at over $5 million—twice. He has endured 9 heart surgeries, 2 strokes and is on his third pacemaker. 


A few years ago sub-par home repairs after terrible storms exposed her entire family to toxic mold, which increased hospital and doctor visits, and of course, medical bills. Part of Savannah's prescribed care was high doses of steroids and prednisone, which increased her weight even more. Her blood pressure and weight have continued to rise. 


The expenses caused Savannah and her family to lose their home, personal belongings and most basic living necessities. With no savings and two bankruptcies on their record, Savannah's family rebuilt their life. Savannah still comes off the school bus crying because of what other students say to her. Her parents fear her weight will continue to be out of control and become life-threatening.
Both of Savannah's parents work in the medical field, but due to expenses they have a little over one hundred dollars in savings. Not only are Savannah and her brother's medical costs strapping the family budget, but her great-grandparents and her aunt are also the responsibility of her parents.


What Savannah Needs


Savannah needs a summer in the nurturing and unconditional love found at Camp Shining Stars, a non-profit teen weight loss camp in North Carolina. At Camp Shining Stars Savannah will learn:

  • How to make better food choices
  • Not to eat out of boredom
  • To be accountable for her actions

Camp Shining Stars “Where Winners LOSE” is a non-profit, co-educational summer weight loss camp for teens hosted on the Barton College campus of Wilson, NC. They believe every child has inherent qualities of importance, beauty, and the capacity to enrich and be enriched by the world in which they live, regardless race, sex, ethnic heritage, income or socio-economic class. Camp Shining Stars promotes the welfare and healthy development of children and grants an environment of acceptance, discipline and affection. Unique in size, privacy and independence, Camp Shining Stars is smaller than traditional summer camps, offers a private residence life with two campers to a room, and is the only weight loss camp that allows campers to choose their own activities. Focused on teaching young adults the habits necessary for leading a healthy life, raising self esteem and losing weight, Camp Shining Stars is supported by a distinguished medical advisory board and offers a menu influenced by nutrition majors at Cornell University, University of North Carolina and East Carolina University. www.campshiningstars.org


You can also help by:


  • Posting this page on your Facebook wall
  • Tweeting Savannah's story
  • Emailing your friends a link to this page

Camp Shining Stars' Story


My name is Ira Green and I am the founder and director for Camp Shining Stars.  My North Carolina-based non profit camp is a six-week summer weight loss camp for teens ages 12 to 18

. Savannah's story is just one of many young adults who are unable to afford a life-changing summer at camp.

 Not every family can afford to send their overweight kids to a camp. We hope to do that, not only for their self-esteem and immediate physical changes, but also to reduce their risks for developing chronic diseases later in life. $12,000 will send Savannah and two other underprivileged teens to camp for the summer. 


Every penny counts!  Even if you only have $5, please donate!

story:
Our Story

We are a group of college students who love to perform jazz and show tunes from the 30's, 40's, and 50's.  We are putting on a show directed, choreographed, and produced all by students... but WE HAVE NO MONEY FOR COSTUMES, PROPS, OR TO PAY THE BAND!  Please help us put on this show! All proceeds from the show as well as any excess donations will go to either the National Breast Cancer Foundation, or to local breast cancer treatment for low income women in Orange County (and if we make enough, to both!).  We are doing this to entertain, to raise awareness, and most importantly, to help women!


The Impact

No one should die of breast cancer.  Women who can't afford treatment for this disease need your help.  Period.


The money we raise with this show will help provide mobile breast cancer detection and treatment units to to Orange County area to allow low income and minority women access to good care and treatment that they would otherwise not have access to.


What We Need & What You Get

We need about $700 dollars for costumes, props, and payment for our live band.  (The rest of the performers are working for free.)  Without this money, we will not be able to put on the show, and that means that hundreds of women will not get the treatment they need for breast cancer.  WE WILL TAKE ANY DONATION, NO MATTER HOW SMALL!!!


What do you get in return for donating?  You get thanks on the program or an advertisement for you business (no matter how much you donate), and any donations over $100 will receive free tickets to the show!  We are offering other perks, like pin-up girl necklaces and sexy perfumes, which we will also be selling at the show to raise extra money for our cause.  And the best prize of all: you know you are making the world a better place and saving a life.  There is no better reward than saving someone's live.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are willing to put up flyers and posters for the show, please let us know!  We want to get the word out there!  The more people who come, the more money we can raise!  We would also appreciate it if you shared our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, a blog, etc... so we can raise awareness and money even more effectively.
story_txt:
Our Story
We are a group of college students who love to perform jazz and show tunes from the 30's, 40's, and 50's.  We are putting on a show directed, choreographed, and produced all by students... but WE HAVE NO MONEY FOR COSTUMES, PROPS, OR TO PAY THE BAND!  Please help us put on this show! All proceeds from the show as well as any excess donations will go to either the National Breast Cancer Foundation, or to local breast cancer treatment for low income women in Orange County (and if we make enough, to both!).  We are doing this to entertain, to raise awareness, and most importantly, to help women!


The Impact
No one should die of breast cancer.  Women who can't afford treatment for this disease need your help.  Period.

The money we raise with this show will help provide mobile breast cancer detection and treatment units to to Orange County area to allow low income and minority women access to good care and treatment that they would otherwise not have access to.


What We Need & What You Get
We need about $700 dollars for costumes, props, and payment for our live band.  (The rest of the performers are working for free.)  Without this money, we will not be able to put on the show, and that means that hundreds of women will not get the treatment they need for breast cancer.  WE WILL TAKE ANY DONATION, NO MATTER HOW SMALL!!!

What do you get in return for donating?  You get thanks on the program or an advertisement for you business (no matter how much you donate), and any donations over $100 will receive free tickets to the show!  We are offering other perks, like pin-up girl necklaces and sexy perfumes, which we will also be selling at the show to raise extra money for our cause.  And the best prize of all: you know you are making the world a better place and saving a life.  There is no better reward than saving someone's live.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are willing to put up flyers and posters for the show, please let us know!  We want to get the word out there!  The more people who come, the more money we can raise!  We would also appreciate it if you shared our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, a blog, etc... so we can raise awareness and money even more effectively.

story:
Run For Sarah Marie & Cerebral Palsy

Sarah's mother is running the 2013 Los Angeles Marathon in order to raise funds for her five year old daughter, Sarah Marie, who is diagnosed with cerebral palsy. Sarah is not able to walk, talk, eat, or sit up on her own yet. She is very intelligent, hard working and determined.

 

 

 The goal of this cause is to fundraise for:

*Physical Therapy

*Occupational Therapy

*Developmental Specialist

* A Communication Device

*To Raise Awareness about Cerebral Palsy and to help children like Sarah by donating 10% of all proceeds to the Los Angeles United Cerebral Palsy Foundation.

 

 What is Cerebral Palsy?? 

Cerebral palsy is a condition, a general term which means that there was a lack of oxygen to the brain at birth or sometime during the delivery. As a result of brain injury, developmental delays occur which affect motor coordination, reflexes, speech, and muscle tone. The injury can result in mild to severe developmental issues. It is very important to give children with cerebral palsy all of the resources possible in order for them to reach their full potential and are able to function as independent as possible as adults. Simple things that most of us do with ease can be difficult for those that have cerebral palsy, such as feeding oneself, and being able to communicate wants and needs. These types of tasks are important and can be accomplished by retraining the brain through various therapies and specialized equipment.

 How Can YOU Help??

You can SUPPORT this cause by Donating and/or by spreading the word about Run For Sarah Marie & CP. Help anyway that you know how.

What Will You Get??

Updates on Sarah's Marie's progress and a breakdown of how your contributions helped Sarah Marie.

 

Thank You for reading! Please DONATE! Any contribution would be GREATLY appreciated! Please Share!

 

 Run For Sarah Marie & CP on Facebook:

www.facebook.com/RunForSarahMarieCP

story:
Can anyone help us, PLEASE, our mom and us are facing homelessness soon and we are scared to death.

Our story:

Mom and dad bought our home 10 years ago but because they did not qualify for financing on their own they put the house in dad's parents' names. Now mom and dad are divorcing (without warning, dad left us at the end of May and just never bothered to come back) and dad's parents are falsely claiming the house is THEIRS so that mom doesn't get her share of what she is entitled to for the house. Today, the house is up for sale and mom can't do a thing to stop it because her name is not anywhere on any paperwork to prove who the house really belongs to. To make matters worse, there is an accepted offer on the house and if it goes through (must be court approved first) the new owners will take full possession of our house by mid-November which will leave our mom and us with no roof over our heads. Mom only first learned of this news (the accepted offer) just YESTERDAY (Oct. 18/12) so it's not like she's had any time to prepare for herself (and us) to be "uprooted" from the only home we've ever really known.

Currently, we are left with only two feasible options:

1 - Hit the streets! We currently have no real income to speak of because both of us (sisters) are full time honor students working extremely hard to acheive particular goals and we put all our effort into reaching them.  Kaila (oldest) is in interior design and Alicia, youngest, is focusing on criminal law as well as creative writing.  We both attend classes full time and then we dedicate our so-called "free" time with additional studies.  As for mom, the only income she has is spousal and child support which is minimal at best and she cannot work due to disability (she is awaiting disability benefits as we speak).  Housing here is most difficult to find at the best of times but with a household of three and no true income to even rely on, well...good luck with that ever happening because it won't (and even mom's lawyer and the judge presiding over her case agree).  

2 - Buy our home outright; The only way this can be done is by mom providing an offer on it that is "greater than" the offer that is already on it (the courts will "deny" current accepted offer if mom can "outbid" it) but her offer has to be in by next week to even be considered. She "DOES" have a way of getting approved for a mortgage but ONLY if she can come up with a minimum down payment of $30,000 first to "hold" any offer she presents.  Unfortunately, the money she would like to use for the down payment is currently being held in trust by the courts and will not be released until AFTER the house has actually been sold so she won't even have access to it until then and by then, of course, it will be too late to save our home.  This is the only home we have ever really known and we will be crushed beyond words if we have to leave it and, most especially, if we have to leave it based on the fact that someone else is saying they own it when they most certainly do not (talk about rewarding the guilty!!). It would also be in mom's best interest to buy the home outright because the monthly mortgage payments she would be paying would be FAR LESS than what she would be paying to "throw money away" on a rental here in Victoria so, naturally, that would be the very best option, both financially and for future security. 

This is where we are hoping all of YOU wonderful folks will come in and help us out; we need YOU to help us reach that $30,000 down payment as there is no way we can do it on our own (remember, we only got word of all of this YESTERDAY so it's not like we have time on our side to get such funds together so quickly). This is why our urgency; if mom is to stand ANY chance of saving our home she has to put an offer on it by next week at the latest otherwise our home will go to those who put the original accepted offer on it leaving us and our mother no home at all. Oh, and yes, we are aware that Indiegogo holds contributions for a two week period after a campaign ends but, even so, this is okay, just as long as we can still give the courts "ASSURANCE" by next week that we'll sincerly be able to come up with these funds needed for the down payment at the time mom actually puts in her offer (we don't physically have to have the funds by next week, we just have to have the assurance we will be getting them). 

Anyway, we hope we have shared enough to give you all the "gyst" of what we are trying to say. However, if you have any questions, please feel free to let us know at anytime and we will answer them in the very best way we can.  If you would like to contact mom personally/confidentially, you can reach her at her personal email address:  ametalqueen@yahoo.ca (this is also her Paypal account address if you would like to contribute that way instead).  For those who cannot contribute (and we know some of you surely cannot) we would sincerely appreciate it if you could spread word of our campaign anywhere and everywhere you can possibly think of (you can use the Indiegogo share tools for doing this as they are easy to use and will be of great service to you) so that our campaign gets noticed far and wide.  Any and all help would be more than welcomed.

Thank you so much for your time.

Alicia and Kaila (and mom, too!)  

PS:  If we do not reach our goal and we do lose our home, we will likely use any funds we do receive (dependent on amount, if any) to purchase a car so that we at least have wheels to get from A to B during the winter weather (dad took our only vehicle with him when he left). The reason we are requesting $33,000 instead of an even $30,000 is because we need to be sure we are left with $30,000 once Indiegogo takes their cut ($33,000 - Indiegogo fees = $30, 690). Also, mom says if anyone wants to talk to her lawyer to validate anything we are saying you are more than welcome to do so...just give us the word and we will give you the details for doing so.  We ARE real people in legimate need, we promise!
